loans.name: Osmar Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Osmar O. is from the municipality Condega where he has been a farmer for several years. This has allowed him to provide the necessities for his humble nuclear family which is made up of his wife and children. He is a very responsible gentleman who every day gives all his effort to provide for his family’s every day needs.

Today, the necessity that has come before him is the urgency of technological assistance for his crops as well as the acquisition of cattle. This is why he has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow him to obtain his objectives. Through this assistance both he and his family will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Osmar O. es originario del municipio de Condega donde se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde hace varios años con el cual ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de su humilde núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposa e hijos. Es un caballero muy responsable que día a día da todos sus esfuerzos por llevar el sustento diario a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día la necesidad que el atraviesa es la urgencia de brindarle asistencia técnica a sus cultivos y además la adquisición de Ganado para el negocio, por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el créditos que le permita llevar a cabo sus objetivos de brindar asistencia técnica a los cultivos y además en la adquisición del ganado. Por medio de este apoyo se beneficia tanto el como su querida familia.

loans.use: Purchase of products for cultivation

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José is a dentist and has a clinic in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto, which aims to help customers with limited resources; his wife works in another office as a dentist and they have a three month old son. His home is located in the Tembladerani hillside area in the western part of the city of La Paz. This is the first time he applies for a loan with Impro; the loan will be used to furnish his office with dental materials and equipment. His work, desire to succeed and most of all his focus on his work with clients will allow him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

José es dentista y tiene un consultorio en la zona de Alto lima de la ciudad de El Alto, con el objetivo de atender a clientes con recursos bajos; su esposa trabaja en otro consultorio como dentista y tiene un hijo de tres meses. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el crédito será destinado para el equipamiento de su consultorio con materiales de odontología. Su trabajo, las ganas de superación y mas que todo el sentido social que tiene con la atención de sus clientes le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his dental clinic

loans.name: Socorro Argentina

texts.es:
Mrs. E. is 58 years old and a widow. 13 years ago her husband died and left her two properties. She rents one for US$200 and the other for US$300 a month and uses that income to cover family expenses and other commitments, as is the case with a loan.

At this time she needs to make improvements to the home where she lives before the winter (rainy) season arrives. The children she is responsible for are two women who are the owners of the properties left by her husband. She has already had other loans and with them has been able to improve her home to provide her daughters better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. E. R. de 58 años de edad, viuda. Hace 13 años que murió su marido dejandole 2 propiedades, una la alquila en U$.200.00 dólares y la otra en U$.300.00 dólares mensuales, y así obtener ingresos que le permite cubrir los gastos familiares y algunos compromisos, como es el caso de un credito; en este momento requiere mejorar la vivienda donde ella vive antes de que entre el invierno. Los hijos que tiene a su cargo son 2 mujeres y son las dueñas de las propiedades que dejó su mario, ella ya ha tenido otros creditos y con ellos ha podido mejorar su casa para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas.

loans.use: Improvements to the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Berta Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. S., 44 years of age, is the owner of a small grocery store and sells soft drinks. She has three children, the youngest being seven years old. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly stipend of C$.3,000.00 that he uses to help with household expenses.

With her own income from the business, she can make the monthly payments for the loan she is requesting. The money will be used to make improvements to her home needed especially in the month of May as Nicaragua is entering into the winter (rainy) season. This client has already received another loan with which she demonstrated excellent behavior and the ability to make payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. S. Jarquin, de 44 años de edad, es dueña de una pequeña pulperia y venta de refrescos, tiene 3 hijos, el menor tiene 7 años de edad y su marido es pensionado y recibe un ingreso mensual de C$.3,000.00 con lo que le ayuda para los gastos del hogar, y con sus ingresos propios del negocio puede asumir el pago de la deuda mensual del monto del credito que está solicitando.

Dicho crédito lo solicita para mejorar su vivienda y en especial en este mes de mayo que en Nicaragua es la entrada del invierno; ésta clienta ya ha manejado otro credito en cual demostro una excelente conducta y capacidad de pago.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home repairs in anticipation of winter (rainy season)

loans.name: Delvis Janeth

texts.es:
Ms. Delvis Janeth is a very brave person who is from the municipality Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. She has a grocery store where she sells all types of products such as food and home products. It is necessary to point out that this is her only form of income to support her humble home.

Today she has requested a loan from Ceprodel to invest in the purchase of the products she sells. She is in need of a loan because her revenues have been low. However, she is aware that once she obtains the loan she will increase her clientele by being able to offer more products which will allow her economic condition to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delvis Janeth es una persona muy esforzada originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería donde oferta todo tipo de productos como lo son comestibles, personales y del hogar. Es necesario destacar que este es su único ingreso para la manutención de su humilde hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos en la compra de los productos para su venta. Ha acudido a este créditos por el hecho de que sus ingresos han sido muy bajos sin embargo está muy conciente que al obtener el crédito aumentará sus ingresos por lo que al ofrecer mas productos aumentara su clientela y de esta manera logrará mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel, a young 24-year-old, makes his living as an auto mechanic. He works at a shop called El Moreno in the city of Juigalpa. With his salary he supports his mother and takes care of his life partner and their three-year-old son.

He is interested in this loan because he wishes to buy mechanic’s wrenches to be able to do work in the shop after his shift and to make house calls to do personal repairs for vehicle owners that request his services outside the shop because he can’t use the shop’s equipment and tools when he’s off duty.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El Joven Jose Manuel de 24 años de edad, se gana la vida como mecanico automotriz, labora en el taller El Moreno de la ciudad de Juigalpa, con su salario apoya a su mamá y mantiene a su compañera de vida y a su hijo de 3 años.

Está interesado en este credito porque desea comprar llaves de mecánica y poder hacer trabajos en su taller despues de su turno, reparaciones personalizadas a domicilios a dueños de vehiculos que le soliciten el servicio fuera de su taller, porque no puede utilizar los equipos y herramientas fuera de su turno de labores en el taller.

loans.use: Purchase wrenches and shop equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is fifty two years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children. She sells Kenkey (a local dish) in her town. For the past fifteen years she has supported four of her children to help them complete school.

Rose wishes to increase her production of Kenkey since her customer base has increased. However, she is constrained by inadequate capital. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and vegetables to store, especially in the face of price hikes that have resulted from the current food crisis. This will allow her to increase production and raise her income.

Rose belongs to the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and vegetables for keep.

loans.name: Consesa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consesa M. is a single mother of 3 small children, whose ages are 9, 7, and 6 years old, respectively. She has a convenience store that allows her to obtain earnings to feed and support her children in their studies. The loans that she has received have allowed her to improve her financial situation and have improved her quality of life, both for herself and her family. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business and increase her inventory in order to grow and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Consesa M. es madre soltera, con 3 hijos, los cuales todavia son menores de edad, uno tiene 9, 7 y 6 años respectivamente; su negocio principal es una pulperia que le permite tener ingresos para alimentar a sus hijos y brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. Los creditos que ha recibido le han ayudado a mejorar su situacion economica y ha levantado el nivel de vida, tanto de su familia como el de ella misma. Solicita este credito ya que necesita invertir mas en su negocio y reforzar su inventario para poder crecer en la inversion y agrandar su actividad economica.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and products for her business.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Cáliz C. is from the municipality Cinco Pinos where he is in the business of raising cattle by means of buying and selling young bulls. He has been in this business since he was young which is why he has a lot of experience in raising animals. It is necessary to point out that he has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel. This support has been in the form of four loans which he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their locality.

Today, he has once again come to Ceprodel for a loan which will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family which is made up of his spouse and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Francisco C. C. es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos donde posee su negocio de crianza de ganado por medio de la compra y venta de toretes en desarrollo. Se ha dedicado al negocio desde que era muy joven y por este motivo ha alcanzado basta experiencia en la crianza de animales. Es de mucha necesidad destacar que ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado por medio de la entrega de cuatro créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra y crianza de los toretes en su localidad de habitación.

Hoy en día una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de los toretes para dar lugar a la crianza de estos animales para luego proceder a su respectiva venta. Son sus mayores sueños mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ganadero para así mejorar las condiciones de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of young bulls

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is forty nine years old. She is married with five children. She is a food vendor who has sold Kenkey for the last 24 years. Kenkey is one of the popular local foods prepared from milled maize grains. It is eaten with either hot pepper and fish in tomato sauce or stew. It is enjoyed as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Joyce supports three of her children in school, while two have completed school. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, vegetables and fish to increase her production. This will allow her to increase her income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community called Nkwabin Ladies. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María R. is married and has two dependent children. She has a general store in which she serves customers herself in her house in the “Five Pines” district of the town of Chinandega. She has devoted herself tirelessly to this business with the aim of improving her family’s economic conditions which desperately need this support. Her husband has also helped her in the store and both together have made huge efforts to advance their school-aged children.

Today, it is of particular importance to note that she has applied to Ceprodel to meet these needs by obtaining a credit which will permit her to buy products such as vegetables and other consumable goods. She strongly trusts that her request will be approved and she will be able to access this loan so she can continue with her grocery-store business from her home.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana María R. es casada y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Su negocio es la pulpería el cual es atendida por ella misma en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se ha dedicado arduamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo. Su esposo también la ha apoyado en la venta y ambos juntos hacen los mas grandes esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día es de suma importancia mencionar que ha acudido a Ceprodel para suplir su necesidad y obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como las verduras y otros comestibles. Ella confía grandemente que su petición será aprobada y podrá obtener el crédito para continuar con su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Stock her general store with more products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is twenty six years old and single. She is very hard working and dedicated. She is a hair dresser and supplies weavons, and hair products to other hair dressers.

Florence is not able to afford large quantities of weavons because of inadequate working capital. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock in weavons and include additional items like hair pomade, shampoo and activators. These are in high demand by her customers. She believes this will help grow her business and will provide her with increased income. She belongs to the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory of weavons and additional items like hair pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Ordóñez’s General Store’s owner is Leonor Rodríguez Ordóñez, who runs the business from her own home which is located in the “Five Pines” district of the town of Chinandega. She is a woman whom for a long time has devoted herself to this business, managing to stock her shelves with consumable goods and personal and home products which are highly sought-after by her customers.

In order to develop the business, today Leonor needs to invest in the General store in order to move forward: so she has very wisely sought the help of CEPRODEL in order to obtain a loan which will allow her to buy more products and offer them to her business’ customers. The business benefits not only her but also her family, which comprises of her two small children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La pulpería Ordóñez es un negocio cuyo dueña es la señora Leonor Rodríguez Ordóñez el cual administra en su propia casa de habitación que se ubica en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado al negocio logrando surtir sus estantes de productos comestibles, personales y caseros los cuales son muy solicitados por los clientes.

Por ser un negocio en desarrollo hoy en día la señora Leonor requiere invertir en la pulpería para salir adelante, para ello muy sabiamente ha buscado el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes en su negocio. Con el negocio es beneficiada tanto ella como su familia que está compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris N. is a twenty-nine-year-old single parent of one child. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past eight years. Doris is a very skilled and talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. That is her secret.

Doris believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators, among other products. This will help her to avoid shortages and poor service. Doris is a member of the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. Nkwabin is the name of the local community. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia M. M.’s is a woman whose hometown is the “Five Pines” district in Chinandega town. For several years now she has occupied herself by running a general store, which through the years she has been able to continue stocking little by little, increasing the volume of products on her shelves. She is a very strong and hard-working woman who has given everything to provide her two small school-age children the necessary conditions for their studies.

It is of particular importance to state that today she has requested a loan from Ceprodel with the aim of acquiring more products with which to stock her business. On being approved and delivered this loan will be helping to solve Bacilia’s need for employment, because she will be able to continue working in her grocery store.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Bacilia M. M. es una dama originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega y por varios años se ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería el cual a través de los años ha venido surtiendo poco a poco hasta tener mayores volúmenes de venta en sus estantes. Es una dama muy esforzada que ha dado todo por brindar a sus dos pequeños hijos escolares las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

Es de suma necesidad destacar que hoy en día ha solicitado préstamos en Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir sus productos para surtir el negocio. Al ser aprobado y entregado este crédito se está apoyando a solucionar la necesidad de trabajo de la señora para que pueda continuar con su trabajo en su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Bartolomé

texts.es:
In the “Five Pines” district of Chinandega town, Bartolomé P. has spent the last six years establishing a hardware store which he runs from his house, offering all types of materials to his customers in the area. It is necessary to state that being a single father of three children his efforts are greater in order that he may be able to provide them with all the necessary condition of life for their development.

Ceprodel have been a cornerstone of his business, for the simple reason that he has benefited from credits which have been of enormous use in the marketing of his hardware products. Each and every one of his loans has been repaid on time and in the manner agreed by both parties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Bartolomé P. se ha dedicado desde hace seis años al negocio de ferretería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación ofreciendo todo tipo de materiales a sus clientes en el sector. Es necesario destacar que por ser un caballero padre de tres hijos sus esfuerzos son mayores por lograr proporcionarles todas las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio por la sencilla razón que le ha beneficiado con créditos que le has sido de muchísimo beneficio para la comercialización de sus productos ferreteros. Hoy en día él acude una vez mas a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos ferreteros para comercializarlos. Todos y cada uno de los créditos que el ha tenido han sido pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use: Purchase of tools and materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is thirty eight years old. She is a wife and the mother of two children who are currently in school.

Esther believes in hard work and dedication. She is very serious in her business efforts. She has been a retailer of eggs and maize for the past twelve years. The business has been very helpful to her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and eggs to serve her customers throughout the season. This is especially important in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. Esther is a member of the trust group called Nkwabin Ladies. Nkwabin is the name of their local community. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize and eggs.

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
In the “Five Pines” district of Chinandega, Blanca P. has spent the last six years working in her General Store, where she serves her loyal customers, offering all sorts of plastic products such as buckets, spoons, baskets, bathtubs etc. She is the mother of two children: this has made her redouble her efforts, together with those of her partner, in order to give them the necessary conditions to ensure their development as students.

As with all businesses, the business of selling plastic products requires an immediate investment in merchandise and it is for this reason that she approached Ceprodel in order to be a beneficiary of a credit which would allow her to buy materials for sale. Currently she is client who has been able to repay all her loans on time and in the manner agreed between both parties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Blanca P. se ha dedicado desde hace seis años al negocio de pulpería donde atiende a sus fieles clientes ofreciendo todo tipo de productos de plástico tales como baldes, panas, cucharas, bañeras, etc. Es madre de dos hijos el cual junto con su cónyuge se esfuerzan para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo como estudiantes.

Como todo negocio, el negocio de la venta de productos plásticos requiere de una pronta inversión en mercadería y es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le de lugar a la compra de los materiales para la venta. Actualmente ella es un cliente que ha sabido cancelar todos sus prestamos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo pactado entre ambas partes.

loans.use: Purchase products to stock her general store

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah Sardia is a thirty-three-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two kids, aged nine and two. She owns and operates a grocery shop, which is located in a school. She has been running the grocery for the past four years.

Issah sells many grocery items, like evaporated milk, soaps, rice, sugar, biscuits, canned foods and drinks. Her current focus is to expand the shop. She wants to use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, soap, canned foods and biscuits, among other items. These items are commonly demanded by the students.

Issah belongs to the community group Acherensua Batch 1 (meaning the first batch of groups in Acherensua, one of the local communities). In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy stock in rice, sugar, soap, canned foods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry G. spends his time working in his General store which he runs from his house, located in the “Five Pines” district of the beautiful town of Chinandega.

He sells all sorts of foodstuffs, which he has been able to market in greater quantities as the years have passed in the business. Today, thanks to the credit support offered by Ceprodel he has been able to stock his business with products and at the same time has managed to buy a fridge in order to store products that require refrigeration.

It is for this reason that today he is once again looking for Ceprodel’s help to obtain a loan which will allow him to purchase these products from his suppliers and in this way he will continue to move forward with the General Store, which provides the only income with which to maintain his humble family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Henry G. se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual tiene en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Vende todo tipo de productos comestibles del hogar los cuales los ha venido comercializando en mayores cantidades a medida que han venido transcurriendo los años en su negocio. Hoy en día gracias al apoyo crediticio brindado por Ceprodel ha logrado surtir el negocio con productos y a la vez ha logrado la compra de una refrigeradora para almacenar los productos que así lo requieren.

Por esta razón es que hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos a sus proveedores y de esta manera seguir adelante con el negocio de pulpería siendo este su único ingreso para mantener su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
From the age of 6, Justo Pastor Mendez has worked in agriculture. He has his own nursery where he grows all kind of plants, including fruit trees and vegetables which he cultivates on his small plot of land, and later sells. It's important to note that he has grown his business over time by investing many resources and putting in a lot of hard work to succeed.

Ceprodel has been an important factor in his business, providing the loans which enabled him to improve the conditions of his nursery and purchase a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables to plant. Now he needs to invest in more seeds and is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials to grow his business and continue to improve his quality of life.

El señor Justo Pastor M. desde hace seis años se ha dedicado al negocio de agricultura teniendo su propio vivero de plantas frutales donde cultiva todo tipo de plantas y hortalizas en su parcela para luego al momento de la cosecha comercializarla a sus clientes. Es de importancia destacara que a medida que ha transcurrido el tiempo ha venido mejorando este negocio invirtiendo muchos recursos y esfuerzos humanos para lograr su mejora en el negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante por lo que le ha brindado créditos que le han permitido mejorar las condiciones del vivero obteniendo mayores cantidades de frutas y hortalizas para su respectiva siembra. Su necesidad hoy en día es la compra de semillas e insumos para el cultivo por ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de estos insumos para mejora de su negocio y de su nivel de vida en su municipio de trabajo.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SEEDS NEEDED TO GROW THE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES HE CULTIVATES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes Mondragon V. stands out as a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business in the city of Chinandega. She runs her own nursery where she grows fruit trees and plants. From the time she began her business she has been able to grow her income and help cover the expenses for her family, including the costs of educating her young children who depend on her.

With her business, she has managed to overcome difficult economic circumstances with the help of Ceprodel, whose support has enabled Mercedes to invest in more seeds and tools needed to cultivate them. As her business continues to grow, she is requesting a new loan to invest again in more seeds and materials needed to continue to succeed.

La señora Mercedes Mondragon V. se ha destacado en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega por ser una muy buena trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de la agricultura en su propio vivero frutal y forestal que atiende en su localidad. Desde que inició el negocio h a logrado salir adelante en las necesidades de su hogar y ha podido brindarle estudios a su pequeño hijos que por cierto depende de ella para subsistir.

Por medio del negocio ha superado sus condiciones económicas gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual al otorgarle créditos ha ayudado a que se desarrolle su actividad por lo que la señora M. muy sabiamente los invierte en la compra de la semilla y asistencia técnica para los cultivos. Una vez mas hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de semilla e insumos para el cultivo forestal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEEDS AND MATERIALS NEEDED TO FOR HER NURSERY.  THIS WILL ENABLE HER TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND TAKE CARE OF HER YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah S., fifty one years old, is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. In the community market, Hannah sells palm oil, corn dough, onion, pepper, vegetable oil and other products. Hannah is driven to work by her vision of a better future for her children.  Her warmness and kindness is admired by all members of her community, the Acherensua Batch 1. On numerous occasions, she has lent a helping hand to those struggling. Now, in her time of need, she desperately needs your help. Using your loan, Hannah will be able to by more products, increasing her revenue. Finally, her community promises to repay the loan. Please help Hannah. Donate now, for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of palm oil, vegetable oil, pepper and onion.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is fifty six years old and is married with six children. She works extremely hard to support her husband to provide food for her family as well as pay the bills. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey. Kenkey is one of the local dialects prepared from maize and is eaten with hot pepper and fish. Many people enjoy it as breakfast, lunch, and supper. However, production is slowing down due to low working capital. Comfort is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize, vegetables, fish, and firewood in order to help her expand her production to serve additional customers. She belongs to the community group called Acherensua Batch 1 in which members are guaranteed to one another as social collateral to be able to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, vegetables, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati D. is a kind and generous thirty two year old woman in Ghana. She is a wife and mother of two children. She has started a small local grocery store in which she sells a variety of foods such as rice, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, and soaps. She is very resourceful and hardworking. She is looking for a loan that will increase her stock of items. She is hoping to use the money to pay for the education of her two kids. She is a member of a community trust group, in which they have agreed to each other that they will pay back the loan. Fati would greatly appreciate the money and use it well.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soaps etc.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia is a widowed 42 year old teacher. She has three children who are studying in elementary school, high school, and the university. Her parents help to support her as she works as a teacher in a rural area teaching multiple grades. She has served as a teacher for 20 years and she stays the entire week in the area where she works. She asked for a transfer from an urban area since she earns a better salary in rural areas. Her parents help to take care of her children. She is a very responsible, honest and dedicated woman who provides a great service for children who have no opportunity to study in the city.

Ms. L. would like to add an additional bedroom to her parents’ home, since she does not own her own home. Due to her small salary and the costs of her children’s studies, it is impossible for her to get her own home. With this loan, she would like to provide better living conditions for her children. She had wanted to continue her own studies, but upon the death of her husband, she decided to focus on her children and their studies since she believes that is the best inheritance she can leave them. With their studies and knowledge, they will be able to face life head on, since their knowledge can’t be sold and will never end.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora Lucrecia de 42 años es viuda, tiene 3 hijos estudiando primaria, secundaria y universidad. Recibe el apoyo de sus padres, ya que ella trabaja como maestra en la zona rural atendiendo multigrados, tiene 20 años de servicio y permanece toda la semana en la zona de trabajo. Nno ha solicitado su traslado a la zona urbana debido a que en la parte rural tienen mejor salario, sus hijos son cuidados por sus padres; es una persona responable, honesta y dedicada a brindar el pan de la enseñanza a niños y niñas que no tienen la posibilidad de estudiar en la ciudad. La Sra. L. realizara la construccion de un dormitorio anexo en casa de sus papás, ya que ella no posee vivienda, pues con el bajo salario y el estudio de sus hijos no es posible llegar a obtener una vivienda, con este credito quiere darle una mejor comodidad a sus hijos. Sus deseos fueron continuar con sus estudios, pero al quedarse viuda prefirio apoyar a sus hijos ya que considera que la mejor herencia que puede dejarles es lo que aprendan porque con ello podran hacerle frente a la vida ya que los conocimientos, no se venden, ni se terminan.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Celia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Celia is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadores, and is located at Jr. Raymondi 958 in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 43 years old, has one child and her husband works in a mine. Celia took out an initial loan of $100 and invested it in a small shop selling cosmetics.

Today, she continues selling cosmetics and also prepares gourmet chocolates which are very rich in flavour. In the mornings she prepares the chocolates and in the afternoons she sells her products.

With this loan of $925, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy perfume, lipstick, talcum powder, eye shadow, pieces of jewelry, sugar, chocolate, pecan nuts, peanuts etc.

Despite her physical disability, Celia continues making progress and says that working with Manuela Ramos is a great help as it enables small businesswomen to generate both income and savings.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Raymondi 958, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja en una mina, es así que Celia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad continua con sus productos de belleza, también prepara chocotejas que son una manjar muy rico, por las mañanas prepara sus chocotejas y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos y cobrar. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: perfumes, labiales, talcos, sombras, colonias, joyas, azúcar, chocolate, pecanas, maní, etc. Celia pese a su discapacidad física ,ella sigue adelante y dice que es un gran apoyo trabajar con Manuela Ramos por que les ayuda a las mujeres microempresarias para poder generar ingresos y ahorrar.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata C. is 25 years old and married. She sells cotton material in the Makeni town of Sierra Leone and has been running this business for the past five years. With a previous loan from SMT, she expanded her business and income.

Fatmata would like to prepare for her future so that her family will not suffer in poverty. She is requesting a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) to expand her business and generate more income.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris S. is a 36 year old teacher. She is single and has one son who is married and works as a driver. Since she was young, she has worked as a teacher in her village. She has worked for the ministry of education for 9 years in a rural area. She travels daily leaving at 630 am and returning at 700 pm. She is a high school graduate but could not continue her studies due to problems with her son. She would like to better herself by studying to be a certified teacher. When she has free time at school, she does a bit of handiwork and on weekends she helps her sister in making suits, all in order to earn more income.

Damaris has her own home and with this loan, she will whitewash four walls and tile the living room. She does not want to move to the city because the teachers in rural areas earn more than those in urban areas. Parents of her students and the students themselves are very happy with the attention she gives them, and are generous enough to provide her with food. This helps her substantially since her salary barely pays for her transportation costs.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Damaris S. es mestra tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que es casado y trabaja como conductor. Desde muy joven inició el trabajo en la docencia por medio de la alcaldia de su pueblo, trabaja para el ministerio de educacion con 9 años de servicio en la zona rural, viaja diario a las 6:30 a.m. y regresa a las 7:00 p.m., es graduada pero no pudo continuar sus estudios por problemas de su hijo, trabaja en la zona rural con multigrados. Tiene el deseo de superarsen y piensa estudiar la Lic. en Pedagogia, en los ratos libres en su escuela realiza labores de manualidades y los fines de semana trabaja con una hermana en la sastreria, esto lo hace con el fin de obtener otros ingresos. La profesora Damaris tiene su casa propia y con este crédito desea repellar 4 paredes y embaldozar la sala. No pretende trasladarse a la ciudad porque los profesores del campo ganan un poco mas que los urbanos. Los padres de familia y sus alumnos se sienten muy contentos con la atencion brindada por la profesora, de tal manera que ellos asumen su alimentacion, lo que a ella le favorece porque su salario le rinde mas, ya que solo paga el transporte.

loans.use: Whitewash the walls and tile the floor of her home

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna is a 27 year old married woman with an 8 year old son who is in elementary school. She is supported by her husband who is a driver. She is a selfless young woman who takes care of her elderly parents. Sadly, years back her father had a horrible accident working for the MTI where he lost both legs and is confined to a wheelchair.

In spite of her difficult situation, she is studying computing in order to improve her state in life. She is a very responsible and balanced person, working in a rural area of her country.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna es una joven de 27 años, con 1 hijo de 8 años estudiando la primaria, casada, y recibe el apoyo de su esposo que es conductor, es una joven sacrificada, ya que desde hace un tiempo se ha responsabilizado de sus padres que son ancianos, pero lo mas triste es que su papá hace varios años era trabajador de MTI y sufrio un brutal accidente donde perdio ambas piernas y se mantiene en una silla de ruedas, a pesar de su dura situacion estudio computacion, es una persona con deseos de superacion, responsable, centrada, trabaja en la zona rural con multigrados.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Deyling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Deyling A. is a 27 year old single teacher. She has six years of teaching experience and has one son who is in elementary school. She currently teaches multiple grades. She is 5 months pregnant and has no one to support her. She was studying Pedagogy (teaching), but left her studies due to health problems; nonetheless, she would like to continue her studies next year. She is a responsible young woman who is very thoughtful; she always helps others when they need her support. She works in a rural area very close to the city.

She would like to improve her house to provide better living conditions for her children and to have a decent home. With this loan, she would like to whitewash and tile her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora Deyling A. de 27 años de edad es soltera, con 6 años en la docencia y con un hijo el cual esta estudiando la primaria, trabaja con multigrados, con un embarazo de 5 meses, no tiene apoyo de nadie, estaba estudiando Pedagogia, pero se retiró por problemas de salud, pero su deseo es continuar con el estudio el proximo año, es una joven responsable, participativa, con muy buenos sentimientos, pues siempre ayuda a los demas cuando necesitan su apoyo, trabaja en la zona rural, pero muy cerca de la ciudad, pues a ella se encuentra siempre por la tarde en su casa que es propia y piensa mejorarla para darles mas comodidad a sus hijos y como persona con vision de futuro es tener una vivienda digna, desea con este crédito repellar y embaldozar, si es posible realizar las dos actividades con el crédito.

loans.use: Whitewash and tile her home

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela is a member of Banco Comunal Las Almedras, and is located at Jr. Manco Cápac 315 in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 63 years old and has five children. Her husband is self-employed but their income is too low to keep the family. Under these circumstances Ángela took out an initial loan of $100 and invested it in the selling of food.

She now has her own restaurant, and gets up very early in the morning to go to the market and buy her supplies, after which she prepares the food. With the help of her children, she tends to her clients with a lot of care and dedication..

With this loan of $375, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, vegetables, meat, seasoning, noodles, oil, salt, etc.

The loans Ángela receives are a great help to her and her business. She also entertains her group a lot, sharing experiences which are unforgettable for her.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ángela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. Manco Cápac 315, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Ángela con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una venta D. comida. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante, en las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar sus víveres, y luego dedicarse a preparar sus comidas, con la ayuda D. sus hijos atienden a sus clientes con mucho esmero y dedicación. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, verduras, carnes, condimentos, fideos, aceites, sal, etc. Los prestamos que recibe son una gran ayuda para ella y su negocio, a la vez se entretiene mucho con su grupo, comparte muchas experiencias que son recuerdos inolvidables para ella.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu K. is 40 years old and married with five children. With an unemployed husband, Mamusu bears the biggest part of the responsibility of taking care of the family expenses.

She has been selling fish, rice, and vegetables for three years, but due to her lack of capital, Mamusu could not expand her business. In order to increase her income, she approached SMT for a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) to expand and diversify her business and also to rent a stall in the market.

loans.use: To increase stock for more income

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto E. C. runs a hardware shop from his home in the municipality of Cinco Pinos. Roberto is married and takes care of his wife and children, watching out so that they don't lack anything in the home. From the time he started his business, he has gone through difficult financial times, but thanks to the support from Ceprodel, he has been able to continue growing his business and stocking more products to sell. It's important to note that he has repaid the loans he's received on time and is well established within the institution.

El caballero Roberto E. C. se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de productos ferreteros y artesanales vendiendolos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos donde posee su propio establecimiento.

Es casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su esposa e hijos velando para que no les falte nada en el hogar. Desde que inició en el negocio ha atravesado por circunstancias económicas difíciles pero gracias al apoyo que le he brindado Ceprodel, ha logrado salir adelante en la adquisición de los productos ferreteros y artesanales para su venta. Es necesario destacar que todos los créditos que he realizado los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo que se ha establecido en la institución.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HIS GROWING HARDWARE BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HIS FAMILY.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is 30 years old and works as an accountant with the SOS Children's Village. Amadu is single and planning for his future by building a family home. His salary is insufficient and it would take him months to save, and at the same, the price of the building materials is on the rise.

Amadu is therefore requesting a loan of $700 (Le.2,000,000) to purchase building materials to allow him to complete the family house. He will pay the loan installments from his monthly salary.

loans.use: Purchase building materials for completion of the family house

loans.name: Rommy

texts.es:
Rommy Lopez has a small general store which she runs from her home in the city of Chinandega, in the municipality of Cinco Pinos. From the time she began her business six years ago, she has been able to improve her economic situation as her husband's salary was not enough to cover the household costs.

Today, she continues to grow the business thanks to the support of Ceprodel, whose loans have enabled her to buy more merchandise to sell. With the new loan, she is confident that she will continue to grow her business.

La dama Rommy L. posee su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido por ella misma en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Cinco Pinos. Desde que lo inició hace seis años atrás ha logrado mejorar su situación económica debido a que se incorporó a este negocio por el hecho de que el ingreso de su esposo no cubría con los gastos del hogar.

Hoy en día ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual al haberle brindado créditos los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos de a pulpería. Hoy en día una vez más solicita créditos para la obtención de su mercadería. Por esto es que ella permanece confiada esperando que se le otorgue el crédito para así continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR THE SMALL GENERAL STORE SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos Alexander is a humble man that earns a living in the cattle farming business in the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. He is the father of a young son, who motivates him to work harder everyday to be able to meet his needs.

It is important to note that this business requires a lot of physical work mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Santos continues to work hard and it has now come to Ceprodel to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Santos Alexander es una persona muy humilde que labora en el negocio de ganadería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es padre de un hijo pequeño el cual es el motivo por el cual cada día se esfuerza aun mas para satisfacer sus necesidades.

Es necesario destacar que el negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico por la sencilla razón de que debe de trasladar los animales de una distancia a otra atravesando largos trechos de camino bajo la exposición al sol lo que provoca enfermedades y mucho desgaste físico. A pesar de esto, Santos continua trabajando fuerte y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para su desarrollo y comercialización en su zona donde se desempeña.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Joesfa L., a teacher, is a 40 year old, single mother of two, one in elementary school and one in high school. She works as the director of the NER rural educational center with seven teachers under her supervision. She has always desired to improve her situation in life, and after receiving her university diploma, she now would like to receive her masters degree. Her parents help her, allowing her to live in their home for now. She is currently building her own two-story home, with only the bottom floor finished. She will use this first loan to whitewash the walls of her home and buy screens for the many windows on the first floor.

In carrying out her work, she supervises seven teachers twice a week. She has worked in education for 11 years, 2 of them as director. She enjoys helping others and sharing with them. As she supervises, she is very cautious and careful in pointing out shortcomings she notices which makes her well-loved by the teachers, parents, students, and society in general.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora Josefa L. de 40 años de edad es soltera, con 2 hijos, uno en la primaria y la otra en secundaria, trabaja como directora de un nucleo educativo rural NER, con 7 maestros a su cargo, siempre ha tenido deseos de superacion, obtuvo en la universidad un diplomado y desea sacar una maestria, sus padres le ayudan ya que habita en casa de ellos, tiene su casa propia en construccion con 2 pisos, faltandole la planta alta, este primer credito lo utilizará para repellar y comprar protectores, ya que la plata baja tiene varias ventanas. Para desarrollar su trabajo supervisa 2 veces por semana a los maestros que están bajo su responsabilidad, tiene 11 años de labor educativa, pero 2 de ellos como directora; le gusta ayudar y compartir con los demás, en las supervisiones es muy cautelosa para señalar las deficiencias que encuentra, por tal razon es muy querida por los maestros, padres de familia, estudiantes y sociedad en general.

loans.use: Whitewash walls of house and buy screens for windows

loans.name: Rubia

texts.es:
For the past five years Rubia O. has earned a living working in her small grocery store. With a lot of effort and hard work she was able to set up her store in her home located in the Cinco Pinos municipality in the city of Chinandega. She has distinguished herself as an excellent worker and for the way she cares for her three school-age children.

Currently, Rubia is in need to purchase her merchandise, for this reason she has come to Ceprodel requesting a loan that will allow her to buy products such as groceries, personal care products and products for the home, to sell them to the customers that live in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rubia O. desde hace cinco años ha laborado en el negocio de pulpería el cual con muchísimo esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado surtir en su casa de habitación citada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora por la responsabilidad que posee de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

La situación que actualmente atraviesa la señora Rubia es la necesidad de invertir en la compra de sus productos, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como lo son comestibles, personales y del hogar para comercializarlos a sus clientes el municipio donde reside.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lesbia De La Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Lesbia is a certified public accountant, married, 34 years old, with a 3 year old daughter who is currently in pre-school. She lives in her parents’ house. With her prior loans, she built her bedroom and used part for the sale of cosmetics and clothing in order to improve her income and help her face the difficult economic situation in her country. She has worked for eight and a half years in Enacal Juigalpa; for six years she worked as a secretary and a year and a half ago, she was promoted to portfolio recovery analyst.

With this loan, she would like to make improvements to her parents’ home, where she has a small bedroom that she would like to expand; she would also like to build a bathroom to provide better living conditions for her daughter. She was able to finish her studies with significant effort on her part and the support of her husband, who works as an MTI project administrator.

Mrs. G. is highly esteemed by her co-workers who believe that she was very deserving her promotion. In her community, she is well-liked since she is a young woman who is very willing to serve others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lesbia es Lic. En Contaduria Publica, casada, de 34 años de edad, con 1 niña de 3 años estudiando 1er nivel de pre-escolar, habita en casa de sus padres, con los creditos anteriores construyó su cuarto y la otra parte la utilizó para venta de cosméticos y ropa y así obtener otros ingresos que le ayuden a hacerle frente a la dificil situacion que está atravesando el pais; tiene 8½ años de trabajar en Enacal Juigalpa, de los cuales 6« años los desempeñó como secretaria y hace año y medio fue promocionada al cargo de analista de cartera y recuperacion. Con este crédito pretende realizar mejoras en casa de sus padres donde tiene un dormitorio pequeño que piensa ampliar y construir un baño para darle mejores condiciones a su hija. Logró culminar su carrera con esfuerzo propio y el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como administrador de proyecto en el MTI. La Sra. G. goza del aprecio y estima de sus compañeros de trabajo, por lo que vieron con buenos ojos el ascenso del que fue merecedora, en su comunidad tambien es muy querida, ya que ella es una joven que esta dispuesta a servir al que lo necesita.

loans.use: Expand family bedroom and build a bathroom

loans.name: Seneyda

texts.es:
Running a general store requires continuous investment because every day the competition grows, and you have to maintain a good inventory of each of the products you offer. This is the case for Seneyda P.'s business, located in the town of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega. Seneyda is a mother of two children, both of them good students who are well cared for thanks to the income of her small shop.

Seneyda is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more merchandise to sell, as the competition continues to grow and she needs to offer the best service to her customers.

El negocio de pulpería requiere de continua inversión por el hecho de que cada día la competencia crece y para poder estar en pie es de necesidad mantener un buen stock de inventario de cada uno de los productos que se ofrecen. Tal es el caso de la Pulpería P. cuya dueña es la dama Seneyda P. el cual posee su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega. Es madre de dos hijos que han sido muy buenos estudiantes y son mantenidos gracias a los ingresos percibidos de la pulpería.

Actualmente la señora Seneyda ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener crédito para la adquisición de sus productos es por este motivo que espera confiadamente en que se le otorgue el crédito para así suplir sus estantes de productos por el hecho de que su competencia al ir en crecimiento ella también debe de brindar mejores oportunidades para su sclientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO STOCK HER SMALL GENERAL STORE WITH MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She works as a secretary with the (. Children's Village in Makeni. Her husband is a petty trader with a meager income.

Because Mary's salary and her husband's income are insufficient for major family expenses, Mary is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to purchase zinc sheets and cement to renovate their family home.

loans.use: Purchase cement and zinc sheets to renovate the family house

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita is a member of the Banco Cumunal Virgen de la Natividad, located in the Jr. Sinchi Roca 125, of the Calleria district, Departamento de Ucayali. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a professor, but his income is not enough to support the family. Due to this Angelita used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of s/.300, to open a small grocery store where she mainly sells candy and soft drinks.

Currently, she sells her products from her home to be able to spend more time with her young children, to be able to do the housework and in this way tend to her business in a more relaxed manner.

With this loan, in the amount of S/. 1,500 which will be payed in 4 months, she will purchase: a variety of candy, soft drinks in different prices and some groceries.

With a lot of effort Angelita is helping her family get ahead, to achieve the well being they need and to have a more comfortable life, free of need.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca 125, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Angelita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega de venta de golosinas y gaseosas. En la actualidad vende es su casa sus productos para poder estar mas tiempo con sus hijos que aun son pequeños, y así puede realizar sus tareas domesticas, y atender su negocio con mas tranquilidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: golosinas en general, gaseosas de diferentes precios y tamaños, un poco de abarrotes. Angelita saca adelante a su familia a base de mucho esfuerzo, para darles el bienestar que necesitan y tener una vida mas cómoda, sin necesidades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Carolita

texts.es:
Carolita is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, and is located at the Micaela Bastidas Market in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and has two children. Her husband is a businessman but their income is too low to keep the family. Under these circumstances Carolita took out an initial loan of $100 and invested it in a shop selling plastic bags.

Today, she continues running this shop, selling plastic bags both wholesale and also at the market. She gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, after which she works until 6pm.

With this loan of $850, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy plastic bags in bulk, disposable plates, polystyrene, packs of toilet paper, etc.

Carolita is very happy, now that she can manage her own income and appreciate the value in herself. Her business is growing and so she can help her husband with the household expenses. For this she is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos can give to her business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carolita pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Mercado Micaela Bastidas del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Carolita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas. . En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda de venta de bolsas plásticas al por mayor y al por menor en el mercado, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2, 300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: bolsas plásticas por millares, platos descartables, tecnopor, paquetes de papel higiénico, etc. Carolita esta muy feliz, ahora puede manejar sus propios ingresos y valerse por si misma, su negocio esta creciendo y de esta manera apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar por eso esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aida Merith

texts.es:
Aída is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, and is located at Jr Coronel Porillo 256 in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has one child. Aída invested her first loan of $100 in a business selling iced drinks.

Today, she continues running this shop, getting up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her son, after which she works until 7pm.

With this loan of $550, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy gas canisters, empty bottles, mineral water, sausages, etc.

Aída is very pleased with all her achievements in life. With her own effort and perseverance, she has been able to move forwards with her son and come out winning. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos can give to her business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aída pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 256 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 1 hijo, es así que Aída con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. venta D. bebidas heladas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda D. venta D. bebidas heladas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. su hijo, D. allí se dedica a la atención D. su negocio hasta las 7 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: cajas D. gaseosas, botellas vacías, agua mineral, embutidos etc. Aída esta muy contenta y satisfecha por todos los logros que ha tenido en su vida pudo salir adelante junto con su hijo solo con esfuerzo y perseverancia logro salir triunfadora por eso esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Senora Hilda belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Almendras which is located at 29 de Mayo Street in the District of Calleri, part of the Department of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and mother of 4 children, her husband is a fisherman, but his income alone is insufficient to support his family, so with Hilda’s first loan from Manuela Ramos for S /. 300 she decided to invest in selling fruit and fish. She currently has a stand in the De La Hoya market where she comes every morning to be able to sell her products; this allows her to help support her family economically, helping pay for their needs. With this loan of S /. 1200 to be paid in 5 months she will buy different species of fish and regional fruits. Hilda is a woman who all her life has faced various difficulties, with the loans she has received she is getting ahead and hopes that we will continue supporting her.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. 29 de Mayo Mz. 200G Lt. 28, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es pescador, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Hilda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de frutas y pescados. En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de la Hoyada donde acude todos los días muy temprano para poder vender sus productos, y poder llevar mas sustento económico a su familia, aportando para cubrir las necesidades que tiene. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: pescados de diferentes especies y frutas regionales. Hilda es un mujer que toda su vida tuvo que afrontar diversas dificultades, con los prestamos recibidos esta saliendo adelante y espera que la sigan apoyando.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gabe Abelina

texts.es:
Gabe is a member of the Community Bank ‘Sarita.”

Gabe is married, 42 years old and has two daughters, who are 3 and 8 years old. Gabe sells clothes like underwear, stockings, and polo shirts on a moveable stall in the market of Nery García from Monday to Saturday and on Sundays with her spouse they travel to different fairs in the region.

Gabe needs a loan of 1000 soles (US $375), money that will be invested in the purchase of underwear, stockings and polo shirts.

The dreams of Gabe are to purchase land to construct her house, a stall in the central market and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Gabe es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.

Gabe es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijas de 3 y 8 años, Gabe vende ropa como interiores, medias, polos, de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García de lunes a sábado y los días domingos junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región.

Gabe necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropas interiores, medias y polos.

Los sueños de Gabe son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, un puesto en un mercado céntrico y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Gabe needs a loan of 1000 soles (US $375), money that will be invested in the purchase of underwear, stockings and polo shirts.

loans.name: Suyapa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Senora Suyapa E. opened her small general store 10 years ago with just a few products. Over the years, she has grown her business and now offers a greater selection to her customers. She is married and has 4 children. 2 of her children attend school and so she must help cover the costs of their education.

Suyapa is requesting the loan to invest in more merchandise to sell. This will enable her to continue to grow her business and improve the quality of life for her family.

La señora Suyapa E. se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual lo inició desde hace 10 años habiendo iniciado el negocio con pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo lo ha venido mejorando ofertando mayores cantidades de productos en sus estantes. Es madre casada y con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que les debe de proporcionar todas las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

El negocio de pulpería de la señora Suyapa hoy en día requiere de inversión en los productos, es por este motivo que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería para salir adelante y así mejorar su condición de vida y el de su familia en su municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Vicky Haydee

texts.es:
Vicki is a member of the Community Bank “Renacer.”

Vicki is married, 34 years old and has three children. Together with her husband, Vicki is dedicated to the transportation of cargo such as potatoes, construction materials and other products, from the city of Ayacucho to the city of Lima and vice versa. Vicki has three cars that are associated with a cargo transport company, and she is dedicated to the collection of freight.

Vicki needs a loan of 2000 soles (US $725), money that will be used to purchase tires for her cars.

The dreams of Vicki are that her children become professionals and that she has more cars and grows her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Vicki es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Vicki es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Vicki junto a su esposo se dedican al transporte de carga como papa, materiales de construcción entre otros productos, de la ciudad de Ayacucho a la ciudad de Lima y viceversa, Vicki tiene 3 carros que están asociados a una empresa de transporte de carga, Vicki se dedica al cobro de los fletes.

Vicki necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de llantas para sus carros.

Los sueños de Vicki son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener más carros y crezca su negocio.

loans.use: Vicki needs a loan of 2000 soles (US $725), money that will be invested in the purchase of tires for her cars

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Senora Elizabeth belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Paraiso, located at 536 Apurimac Street, in the District of Calleri, part of the Department of Ucayali. She is 38 and the mother of 6 children, her husband is a taxi driver for a moto-car, but their income is not enough to support their family. With Elizabeth’s first loan from Manuel Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the purchase of a moto-taxi. At present they have 2 moto-taxis and she must get up at 6am in order to hand over the moto-taxis to their drivers. She then prepares breakfast for her children and her husband and then does work around the house. With this loan of S /. 900, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy parts for the mechanical maintenance of the moto-taxis. Elizabeth is very happy with her family which is always filled with encouragement allowing her to get ahead in life; she is also very happy with the support offered by Manuela Ramos for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 536, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad ella cuenta con 2 motocarros, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para entregar sus motocarros a sus choferes, de allí prepara el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y luego se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 900 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: piezas para realizar el mantenimiento mecánico de sus motocarros. Elizabeth esta muy contenta por tener una familia como la que tiene pues siempre la llenan de aliento para que pueda salir adelante en la vida, y esta muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will be able to perform maintenance on the moto-taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a member of the Community Bank “Renacer”.

Carmen is married, is 54 and has six children. Carmen sells grains that she buys in her town of Ticllas and sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Carmen also grows grains and tubers. She also dries potatoes, which she then sells in the markets of the city of Ayachucho.

Carmen needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $925), money that will be used to purchase potatoes, barley and wheat. The dreams of Carmen are that her children study and she improves her businesses. Camen es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Carmen es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Carmen venD. cereales que compra en su pueblo D. Ticllas y lo venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Carmen se dedica a la agricultura D. cereales y tubérculos. También hace papa seca, que luego venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa, cebada y trigo.

Los sueños D. Carmen son que sus hijos estudien y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $925), money that will be invested to purchase potatoes, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Esna Nicida

texts.es:
Señora Esna Nico belongs to the Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, located at 7 Alfonso Ugarte Street, in the District of Calleri, part of the Department of Ucayali. She is 42 and the mother of 2 children, her husband is a businessman. With Esna’s first loan from Manuela Ramos of S /. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of groceries for a reduced price. At present she has a stand in one of the busiest markets in our city, which opens very early in the morning since people come here to buy their staple goods. She serves everyone with great kindness because it is very important to her to provide good service. This 4 month loan for S /. 2300 will allow her to buy: 10 boxes of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 5 bags of noodles, 1 sack of salt, 1 carton of milk, 2 boxes of canned goods, etc. Esna is very happy about the support offered by Manuela Ramos which allows her to continue with this project that has changed her life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esna Nicida pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Esna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de nuestra ciudad, abre muy temprano su puesto por que a tempranas horas las personas acuden para comprar sus productos de primera necesidad, los atiende con mucha amabilidad por que para ella es muy importante brindar una buena atención. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 10 cajas de aceite, 5 sacos de arroz, 5 bolsas de fideos, 1 saco de sal, 1 caja de leche, 2 cajas de conservas, etc. Esna se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para seguir adelante en el proyecto que se ha trazado para su vida.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yda Maria

texts.es:
Yda is a member of the Community Bank “Renacer.” Yda is married, 32 years old with two children, and together with husband and the help of employees, she makes artisanal items made from the stone of Huamanga (alabaster), such as Nativity scenes. Their products are sold by distributors in the city of Lima.

Yda also has a store selling headstones in front of the general cemetery in the city of Ayachuco. The headstones are made by her husband in different materials such as marble, most of which are brought from the city of Lima.

Yda needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $ 925), money that will be invested to buy marble and stone from Huamanga. The dreams of Yda are to buy more technical machines, to better her businesses and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Yda es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Yda es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Yda junto a su esposo y con ayuda de empleados realizan artesanías, tallados en piedra de Huamanga (alabastro) como nacimientos, sus productos lo envían a intermediarios en la ciudad de Lima.

Además Yda tiene una tienda de lapYdas al frente del cementerio general de la ciudad de Ayacucho, las lapYdas son elaboradas por su esposo en distintos materiales como mármol, mayólicas que son traídas de la ciudad de Lima.

Yda necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mármol y piedra de Huamanga.

Los sueños de Yda son comprar maquinarias más tecnificadas, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Yda needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $ 925), money that will be used to purchase marble and stone from Huamanga.

loans.name: Ubaid

texts.ru:
Ubaid M. lives in the Rudaki area. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. He owns a “Kamaz" truck which he drives himself and which gets hired to transport goods and heavy loads.
