Right now the truck needs repairs that require additional funds that Ubaid does not have. He has decided to apply for a loan to help get the repairs done as this business is the sole income for his family. He plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Машрабов Убайд житель района Рудаки. Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет 5 детей. Имеет грузовую автомашину «Камаз». Работает на ней водителем Камаза. Перевозит грузы на заказ. Сейчас в данный момент у его машины произошла поломка, для починки которой нужны деньги. Поэтому клиент решил обратится к нам за кредитом. Его деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому ему необходимо ремонтировать машину , чтобы обеспечиват свою семью.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Truck repair

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is an experienced and ambitious entrepreneur who operates a flourishing grocery store in San Cristobal. This businesswoman is also the mother of three school-going children.

She explains that she had been operating a similar store in her hometown. Two years ago, she moved to a rural community in San Cristobal, and opened a new business. This entrepreneur says that, in her business sector, there hadn’t been a grocery store as well stocked as hers, so she seized the opportunity and established her business, which is flourishing at the present time.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy an assortment of goods to add to her inventory so she can meet the needs of her customers. Leonarda intends to save the extra business profits in order to start the construction of her own house.

loans.use: To a larger variety of goods in bulk to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Zendia 2020-1 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Mary N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan for business expansion.  Mary is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a Sudan People's Liberation Movement (SPLM) officer. She has 3 children ranging in age from 10 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Mary is joined in her small group by Adena K., Asunta R., Jane A., and Dalia A..  Adena K. has a business selling vegetables and wants to open up a shop.  Asunta R. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to expand her business.  Jane A. operates a business selling bread and wants to expand her business.  Dalia A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
K. Nasiba has been an organized and reliable client of MicroInvest since 2008. She first applied to MicroInvest when she heard about the open and moderate loan procedure.

Mrs. K. Nasiba makes yarn and warm yarn socks that she trades in the local bazaar. She is five years of experience in business of the yarn-making business. She is 33 year old, married, and has 5 children. She is eager to work to ensure a good future for her children. She does not have special or higher education, so she works very hard to provide a fine education for her children.

Mrs. K. Nasiba is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48678

loans.name: Zurafo

texts.en:
Zurafo K. is 38 years old, and she is married with 2 children. In order to help her husband support their family, Zurafo operates her own business selling clothing for kids. To do so, she rents a store located in her home town. Each Friday, with her husband's assistance, she works from 5 am until late in the evening to sell her goods at the large market in the neighboring city. 
Currently Zurafo is planning to expand her business by purchasing additional goods for the summer season. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be paid back over a 6-month term. Having already proven herself to be an honest and reliable client, Zurafo now promises to repay this loan in a prompt manner. Zurafo expresses her gratitude to everyone who has supported her and has thus allowed her to develop her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing new kids' clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Ashurmat

texts.en: U. Ashurmat lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan, where agriculture and livestock are common pursuits. Mr. U. Ashurmat, along with many of his fellow villagers, raises and sells livestock. It is the family business that he shares with his wife. He dreams of having a large flock, so Mr. U. Ashurmat has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ  ($625 USD) to buy a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Zendia 2020-2 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Mary A..  She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan for business expansion.  Mary is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging in age from 10 to 25 and her children go to school.  Each week, Mary makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Mary is joined in her small group by Fatina E., Hawa J., Lona P., and Joice M..  Fatina E. has a business selling charcoal and wants to open up a shop.  Hawa J. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business.  Lona P. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to expand her business.  Joice M. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Tursunbibi

texts.en:
N. Tursunbibi is 54 years old. She is married, and she has 5 children. Tursunbibi sells clothing and shoes for kids in the local market. Her husband and elder sons help her with the business, which she has operated for the past 10 years. The goods she sells are purchased in the neighboring town, which is situated 100 km away from her town. As is the case with any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and her dream is for all of her children to receive higher education. 
Because there is always a strong demand for kids' clothing regardless of the season of the year, Tursunbibi's business is rather stable and generates a sufficient amount of income to support her large family. Currently Tursunbibi needs to increase her working capital in order to purchase new children's shoes for her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to be paid back over a 6-month term. Tursunbibi thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be promptly repay this loan.

loans.use: To increase her business' working capital in order to purchase additional kids' shoes

loans.name: Adinajon

texts.en:
A. Adinajon lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where agriculture and livestock are common pursuits. Mrs. A. Adinajon has a large farm with cows, bulls, and rams, and she also makes and sells yarn and warm wool socks. She has 6 years of business experience. In addition, Mrs. A. Adinajon works in a collective farm.

She is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ ($350 USD) for 6 months to purchase a spinning frame to make yarn.

loans.use: To buy a spinning frame for making yarn.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
J. Shahnoza has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she has proven to be reliable and trustworthy. Her business stability and business income helped her to repay her first loan on time and to improve her business.

She started a small business run from her household, now she sells ready-made traditional dresses. She has good taste, so she has many customers.

Mrs. J. Shahnoza is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ ($825 USD) for 7 months.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling traditional Tajik dresses

loans.name: Khushbaht

texts.en:
O. Khushbaht is 52 years old. She is married, and she has four children. Her husband is currently unemployed, which is why Khushbaht is now the primary bread-winner. As is the case with any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and her dream is to see to it that her children all receive higher education. She sells clothes and shoes for kids in the local market, and she has been in this business for 10 years. Because she is always very friendly, she has built up a loyal client base over the years. 
The business is stable, but she would like to generate significantly more income to further improve her family's living conditions. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to be paid back over a 6-month term in order to expand her inventory by purchasing new men's shoes. Khushbaht thanks all for your support and promises to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of goods for sale by purchasing new shoes for men

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
T. Mutabar lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. It is the region where the agriculture and livestock are well-developed pursuits. Mrs. T. Mutabar has a large farm wth cows, bulls, and rams, and she also spins yarn and makes warm wool socks. She has 10 year of experience in this business.

Mrs. Mutabar is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months. She wants to purchase a spinning frame for making yarn.

loans.use: To purchase a spinning frame for making yarn.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48686

loans.name: Buluk 2027-3 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Asha D.. She is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Asha is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging in age from 10 to 30. Each week, Asha makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Asha is joined in her small group by Rohay H., Rose K., Grace P., and Sernira E.. Rohay H. has a business selling bread and wants to buy a motorbike. Rose K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to open up a bakery. Grace P. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to build a house. Sernira E. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
M. Alisher lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where the agriculture and livestock are well developed pursuits. Mr. M. Alisher, like many of his fellow villagers, raises and sells livestock. It is the family business. Although Mr. M. Alisher is only 22 years old, he is experienced in the livestock business, because he has been helping his father take care of their livestock for many years. He dreams of having a large flock.

Mr. M. Alisher is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 6 months to build a cow shed.

loans.use: To build a cow shed for his livestock

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en:
T. Saidjon has been raising livestock for 5 years. He learned the necessary skills from by watching his father care for their livestock during his earliest years. He has a good flock, including a pedigree bull and a milk cow. Mr. T. Saidjon raises and sells livestock, and also he works on the collective farm. Mr. T. Saidjon has a good reputation.

Mr. T. Saidjon is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 6 months to buy rams to expand his sheep business. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy rams to expand his sheep business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
E. Gulbahor lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mrs. E. Gulbahor is married and has one child. Like many of her fellow villagers, she raises livestock. It is the family business, and Mrs. E. Gulbahor is responsible for taking care the animals, collecting milk, and making sour-milk products. It is a very hard work, so her child helps her. In addition, she teaches in the rural school. She works hard and has good reputation.

Mrs. E. Gulbahor is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy modern equipment for milk processing.

loans.use: To buy modern milk-processing equipment.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48690

loans.name: Javhar

texts.en:
S. Javhar is 47 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mr Javhar lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where agriculture and livestock are well-developed and one of the main avenues of the business development in the Asht region.

Mr. Javhar is a very hard-working man, and a good family man. He works in the collective farm, but because it is seasonal work, he also works in his family's livestock business. Mr. S. Javhar has the necessary skills and bring a love of animals to the livestock business.

Mr. S. Javhar is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625) for 6 months to buy pedigreed bulls to add to his herd.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed bulls.

loans.name: Saiful

texts.id:
Saiful is already in the Recycling business for years. Daily he went around Kuta area to search and buy used items, then brought them to his storage place in his home at Patih Jelantik street, Denpasar. After sorting these items according to type, he sells these items. Obtained income is sent to his family who lives in Java island. His wife is still not living with him, but with her parents in Java. Every 2 or 3 months he went home to Java to see his wife and family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi sebagai pemulung sudah dijalani oleh Saiful selama bertahun-tahun. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling sepanjang kawasan Kuta untuk mencari dan membeli barang-barang bekas lalu kemudian dibawa ketempat penampungan dirumahnya di Jl.. Setelah dipilah sesuai jenis barangnya, kemudian barang-barang dijual. Penghasilan yang didapat sebagian dikirimkan untuk keluarganya yang tinggal di Jawa. Istrinya saat ini tidak bersamanya, tetapi tinggal bersama orangtuanya di Jawa. Setiap 2 atau 3 bulan sekali dia pulang ke Jawa untuk menjenguk istri dan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Suhir

texts.id:
Suhir's daily activity as a recycler of used items. Every morning he has to go and search for used items to be collected. The location he usually went are areas around where he lives, Patih Jelantik street, and also Denpasar area. He usually works from morning till evening. After a short break, he sorted the used items according to type. Afterwards he brought them to the collection place and weigh them for sales. This 23 year old young men hopes he could be given the capital, so that he could buy used items to be resold, and not only searching for already thrown away items as he is doing now.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Suhir adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas. Setiap pagi dia sudah harus berangkat mencari barang bekas untuk dikumpulkan. Lokasi yang biasanya dia lalui adalah kawasan sekitar tempat tinggalnya, di Jl.Patih Jelantik dan juga di kawasan Denpasar. Biasanya dia bekerja dari pagi sampai siang. Setelah beristirahat sebentar, dia melanjutkan dengan menyaring dan memisahkan barang bekas menurut jenisnya. Setelah itu, dia membawa ke tempat pengumpulan dan menimbang lalu menjualnya. Pemuda 23 tahun ini berharap bisa diberi bantuan modal, sehingga nantinya dia bisa membeli barang bekas kemudian menjualnya lagi, tidak hanya mencari seperti yang dia lakukan sekarang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sulikanah

texts.id:
Sulikanah has been sewing since many years. Every day from morning till evening she is busy with this work. Her husband's job as a transportation driver is not enough to pay for family needs expenses, therefore she is working too. Her income from sewing is enough to help family economic situation. Now with husband and child, Sulikanah is living in Laksamana street Denpasar, by renting a room for Rp150,000 (about US $ 19)/month. She hopes with the loan she could expand her seamstressing business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan menjahit sudah dijalani oleh Sulikanah sejak bertahun-tahun. Setiap hari dari pagi sampe sore dia disibukkan dengan pekerjaan ini. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai sopir angkutan kota belum cukup memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarga, karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Penghasilan yang didapat dari menjahit cukup untuk membantu ekonomi keluarga. Saat ini bersama suami dan anaknya, Sulikanah tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar Rp.150.000 per bulan. Dia berharap, pinjaman kali ini bisa dipakai untuk mengembangkan bisnis jahit-menjahitnya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Supik

texts.id:
With her sailor husband being home only once every 3 months, forced Supik to work. Every day she sells yellow cooked rice around the city using a motor cycle. Besides finding buyers, she also has permanent customers who buys her cooked rice sales. Obtained profit is only enough to pay for daily expenses, not able to be saved. That is why she is expecting the loan for business capital, so that when her business could expand, she could save to pay for her child Nurhadi schooling expenses. With her child, Supik now lives in Mertasari street, Denpasar by renting a room.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pelaut dan hanya pulang sekali dalam 3 bulan membuat Supik juga ikut bekerja. Sehari-harinya dia berjualan nasi kuning keliling menggunakan sepeda motor. Selain harus mencari pembeli, dia juga sudah memiliki pelanggan tetap yang membeli nasi jualannya. Keuntungan yang didapat hanya cukup memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari, belum bisa untuk ditabung. Oleh karena itu dia berharap mendapat pinjaman modal usaha, sehingga nanti usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan bisa menabung untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya Nurhadi. Bersama anaknya, saat ini Supik tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan menyewa sebuah kamar kost.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Bahtiyar

texts.en:
A. Bahtiyar is 31 years old, is married, and has 2 children. He became a MicroInvest client when he heard about MicroInvest's loan procedures and its successful history of business improvement from his brother. He borrowed his first loan from MicroInvest and his business stability and income helped him to repay the loan on time and improve his business significantly.

Mr. A. Bahtiyar is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock. His wife is responsible for making the sour milk products that they sell in the local bazaar. Mr. A. Bahtiyar sells meat in the trade outlet that he opened with his first MicroInvest loan. He has 10 years of experience in livestock and has the important skills that he uses in its practice.

Mr. A. Bahtiyar is now applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy special equipment used in making milk products.

loans.use: To buy special equipment for making milk products

loans.name: Sutarjo

texts.id:
Sutarjo's business is collecting junks, or buying and selling second-hand goods. He goes out 2 times a day. In the morning, he departs at 6 am and in the evening he goes out at 3 pm. He covers the area from Monang-Maning until Kerobokan using a cart or a bicycle cart. Even though the weather sometimes changes, it doesn't discourage him to do this job. His daily income is enough to cover his daily expenses. Currently, Sutarji wants to expand the business but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he hopes that DINARI can help him with a loan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni oleh Sutarjo adalah sebagai pemulung atau jual beli barang bekas. Setiap hari dia keluar 2 kali sehari. Pagi hari dia berangkat jam 06.00 dan sore dia berangkat jam 15.00. Wilayah yang dikelilingi mulai dari Monang-Maning sampai Kerobokan dengan membawa gerobak atau menggunakan sepeda dayung. Walaupun cuaca acapkali berubah namun tak mengurangi niat untuk melakukan pekerjaan ini. Dari keuntungan setiap hari bisa untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Saat ini Sutarji ingin mengembangkan bisnisnya, tetapi terkendala modal usaha. Oleh karena itu dia sangat berharap DINARI bisa membantu memberikan pinjaman.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 37 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a primary police officer whose income is insufficient to meet the family income needs. Abie supplements the family income by producing and selling Gara tie-dyed materials in the market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone.

Some of her children are preparing to go to college and Abie needs to work hard to generate income for their school requirements. She is therefore requesting a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) to increase her fabric production and also to diversify her business.

loans.use: To expand production of tie-dyed materials and to purchase 40 gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Sutikan

texts.id:
In the age of 50 years old, Sutikan has dilligently worked as a junk collector for 8 years. His activities from the morning until the evening are going around the neighbourhood to search or buy second-hand goods and junks, and then sellling them. Besides his work as a junk collector, he also spends his time to pick up garbages. He spends his income not only for covering his family's expenses, but also for paying the house rent fee. Sutarjo hopes to get the loan so that he can expand his business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Diumurnya yang sudah tua, 50 tahun, Sutikan masih tekun menjalani pekerjaan sebagai pemulung yang sudah dijalaninya selama 8 tahun. Kegiatannya setiap hari mulai pagi sampai sore adalah berkeliling mencari dan membeli barang bekas dan rongsokan lalu kemudian dijual. Selain sebagai pemulung, dia juga mengisi waktu sebagai tukang angkut sampah. Penghasilan setiap bulannya selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan ekonomi keluarga, juga untuk membayar biaya kontrak rumah. Sutarjo mengharapkan diberi bantuan pinjaman modal sehingga bisnisnya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
A. Mahmud lives in J.Ismoil, Tajikistan. He is 29 years old and married. Mr. A. Mahmud is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He and his wife work in the collective farm, but because it is the seasonal work, he also raises livestock. Mr. A. Mahmud is very experienced in livestock. It is the family business, so his wife helps him to support and develop their livestock business, and he uses his skills and experience in practice.

Mr. A. Mahmud is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy a milk cow and start a sour-milk product business.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and start a sour-milk product business

loans.name: Ni Nengah

texts.id:
Ni Nengah W. has run the food kiosk since 12 years ago. Even though she often has to relocate because the rent term ends, she still consistently runs this business. She sells various kinds of food such as snacks, drink, rujak (cut fruits with spicy sauce), fruit cocktail, nasi campur (rice with some meat or vegetables) , and so on. She buys all her supplies in Tegal market. She goes shopping for the supplies in Tegal market everyday at 5 am, then she cooks them and ready to sell them at 8 am. She uses some of the income as the next business capital. She wants to expand her business so that she can sell more varieties of merchandises.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah W. menekuni usaha warung makanan sejak 12 tahun yang lalu. Walaupun dia harus sering pindah karena sewa tempat habis, dia tetap menekuni usaha warung makanan ini. Jenis makanan yang dijual antara laim makanan ringan (snack), minuman, rujak, es buah, nasi campur dan lain-lain. Semua barang yang dijual dia beli dari Pasar Tegal. Setiap jam 05.00 pagi dia harus berbelanja kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Tegal, lalu kemudian dimasak dan siap untuk dijual pada pukul 08.00 pagi. Dari hasil usaha ini dia bisa menggunakannya sebagai modal lagi. Dia berkeinginan mengembangkan lagi usahanya sehingga bisa lebih banyak jenis barang yang dijual.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Yuhati

texts.id:
Yuhati has run the traditional massage practice since 13 years ago. Her regular customers usually come to her house and sometimes she also visits their house. She usually starts the practice from 10 am until 4 pm. However, when she has many customers, she can finish until very late at night. The income she gets is enough to cover her daily expenses. Besides this massage business, Yuhati also sells kerosene in her house. She hopes she can get the loan from DINARI.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Yuhati menekuni usaha sebagai tukang pijat tradisional sudah sejak 13 tahun yang lalu. Biasanya pelanggannya yang datang kerumahny, tetapi terkadang dia juga yang kerumah pasiennya. Biasanya dia memijat dari jam 10.00 pagi sampai sore jam 16.00. Tetapi kalau pelanggannya banyak, dia bisa memijat sampai larut malam. Hasil yang didapat cukup untuk memnuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Selain bisnis ini, Yuhati juga berjualan minyak tanah dirumanya. Dia berharap diberi pinjaman oleh DINARI.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Barnogul

texts.en:
K. Barnogul lives in the J.Utkansoi, and she is married and has a child. Along with many fellow villagers, she raises livestock. It is the family business, and she is responsible for taking care of the animals, milk production, and making sour milk products. It is a very hard work, but she is eager to work to ensure a good future for her family. She has 10 years of experience raising livestock.

K. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy special modern equipment for milk processing and making sour-milk products.

loans.use: To buy special modern equipment for milk processing and making sour-milk products

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48703

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sallay and her husband have six children who are all in school. Her husband is a teacher whose salary cannot meet all the family expenses. Sallay sells rice, palm oil, and other food items from her home in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. She needs to generate more income to supplement her husband's income.

Sallay would like to expand her business and rent a stall in the market. However, due to her lack of capital, she can't do so. She is therefore requesting a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand the business and rent a stall in the market.

loans.name: Buluk C 2027-4 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Emma S.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Emma is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children ranging in age from 15 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Emma makes approximately 400 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Emma is joined in her small group by Rose P., Vonconca K., Grace J., and Betty K..  Rose P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy a car.  Vonconca K. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to buy a television.  Grace J. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to expand her business.  Betty K. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to open up a bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 41 years old and has four children. Her husband is a retired police officer and does not have any other source of income.

Isatu sells cigarettes, bread, fried fish, bananas, and biscuits by the roadside in Makeni town. With the rainy season approaching, she will move her business to a shelter near her homestead where she does not have as many customers. Isatu would also like to increase her stock to generate more income for her family. Isatu is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1000,000) for that purpose.

loans.use: Construct a shelter and increase her stock.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu sells cigarettes, bread fied fish, bananas and busuits by the roadside in Makeni town.  With the rain season approaching, she will move the business in the homestead where she has no many customers.  Isatu also would like to increase her stock to generate more income for the family.  Her husband is a retired ploice officer and to not have other source of income.  Isatu is requesting a loan of Le.1000,000 for the purpose.  Isatu is 41 years old and with four children.

loans.use: Constract a shelter and increase her stock.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: The sale of food is a business that is lucrative, Philomena O. tells us. She is thirty-eight years old and married with four children. She learned the business of selling food for a year before starting her own business in 2002. If there are more funds available, she will be able to buy more food to sell in larger quantity. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more bags of rice and beans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
R. Muhabbat is 29 years old. She is divorced, though she has a wonderful son from her marriage. Currently she is living with her parents. Muhabbat is a market vendor: she sells clothing for men, including sport suits, shirts, trousers, suits, and other such clothes, in the local market. Muhabbat has been in this business for 8 years already, and she is proud to say that she works very hard to provide her dear son a quality education and to make him happy. Over the course of the past 8 years, she has managed to stabilize her business and to generate considerable profits, thereby providing the main source of income for Muhabbat’s family and supporting her parents.

At present, Muhabbat is planning to expand her business and, in order to do so, she will need to increase her working capital in order to purchase new clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Muhabbat is requesting $600 over a 4-month term. As a repeat client of IMON with a positive credit history, Muhabbat promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all for supporting her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing new goods to sell at the market.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: T. Inobat is 47 years old. She is married with four children. Her husband is tractor operator at the local farm. For the past seven years, Inobat has made a living selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, strawberries and cherries. Her elder son helps Inobat with the business, which begins early in the morning at 5:00 a.m. She buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers and sells them in the market.  She does her selling in a market that is known for attractive prices. All this allows Inobat’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family. Today she is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods she offers. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a loan of $300 which she will pay back in three months. Inobat has a positive credit history with IMON, and promises to repay the current loan as promptly as she has done in the past. Inobat and her  family need some help and hope you will become a part of her business.

loans.use: To increase the range of vegetables and fruits she has to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 44 years old and married with five children. Her children are all in school. She works in the SOS Children's Village as a mother to orphans.

Her salary and her husband's income from petty trading is insufficient to enable them complete the construction of their house. Rose is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1000000) to purchase cement and doors for the house they are building. She and her husband will pay the loan installments from her salary and his income.

loans.use: Purchase house building supplies

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet I. is58 years, and married with eight children. She hails from Oka in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business of selling wood for the past four years. The wood business is profitable to her; she learned the business for six months before starting her own business. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more wood for sales.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 39 years old and married with four children. She works as a secretary for the SOS Children's Village. Her husband is an electrician but his irregular income doesn't enable the family to renovate their old house.

With the coming of the rainy season, the family needs a good warm house to live in. Veronica is therefore requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1000000) to renovate their family home. She will repay the loan in installments from her salary.

loans.use: Purchase material to renovate family house

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene U. sells cosmetics, woven clothes, and other necessities in Oka markets. She is forty years old and married with five children. She hails from the Oka community of Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1980. She learned the trade from her mother when she was young. She is also a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $1050 to buy more clothes to sell. She thanks kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken O. is a hair stylist. She is single and twenty-seven years old. She creates various hair styles for people in her community. This business has been profitable for her. She has been in it since 2003. She learned the business for a year before starting her own business.  She is also a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $875 to buy clothes and start selling clothes in her community as an additional business.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for sales

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan U. is 40 years old and married with five children.. She is from Sakpoba in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks, and rents VCDs and phone accessories. This is a trade she learned for five years, and then started her own business in 2003.She needs a loan of $700 to buy more turkey and frozen chicken to sell.

loans.use: To buy chicken and turkey parts for sale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a 26-year-old married father of two school-going children. He lives with his family in Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. He operates a motorbike taxi business which he initiated last year. His taxi is able to generate a daily income of Kshs 800. He has applied for $800 to enable him to pay part of the purchase price of a new motorbike.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Pay part of the price for a new motorbike

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice E. is thirty-one years old. She is married with four children. She sells drinks and provisions to people in her community. She is from Oka Area Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business for six years and she needs a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale. She thanks kiva and the lender.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Arun

texts.en:
Arun is 37 years old and married with one child. He started working a year ago with the SOS Children's Village. His main responsibility is to help the SOS children and their foster mothers to live cooperatively.

Arun would like to build a small house for his family and has finished the foundation. Because it will take him a long time to save to continue with the construction, Arun is requesting a loan of $350 (Le1000000) for cement to make building blocks. He will pay the loan installments from his monthly salary.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou G. is young, unmarried, and lives at her parents' place in the Randoulène Nord district in Thies. She sells breakfast foods near her home; developing her business is the purpose of her loan application. With this money, she wants to stock basic ingredients (milk, sugar, coffee).

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

F ATOU G. est une jeune célibataire qui habite chez ses parents au quartier Randoulène Nord à Thies .Elle vend le petit déjeuner près de chez elle ;c'est dans le but de développer son activité qu'elle sollicite un pret. Avec cet argent elle veut faire un stock de matière première (Lait - Sucre - Café)

loans.use: To stock basic ingredients for breakfast foods

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel O. is 40 years old, married with five children. She hails from Edo state, Nigeria. She owns a patent medicine store where she sells drugs to people in her community. She has been in this business since 2004, learning the trade for three years before she started her own business.

Mabel has been a LAPO client for the past six years. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more  drugs for sale.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa works for the SOS children's village in Makeni, Sierra Leone. With his meager salary, he cannot save enough money to establish a small business for his wife. Issa thinks that his wife could generate more income for the family from the business and this could supplement his salary.

He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to help his wife to start a business selling agriculture products such as rice, beans, palm oil and chilli peppers. He will repay the loan from his monthly salay. Issa is 37 years old and married with three children.

loans.use: To assist his wife to establish a food selling business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She hails from Oka in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She trades in clothes and has been in the business since 1998. This is a business that she started on her own.

Eunice has been a LAPO client for the past seven years. She needs a loan of $775 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is forty-eight years old, married with two children. She is from the eastern part of Nigeria, but resides in Edo State. She is into the sale of drinks of various brands in her community. She learnt this trade from her uncle and she has been in the business since 1986.

Juliet has been a LAPO client for the past seven years now. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Fatou Gogo

texts.fr:
Fatou Gogo N. is a woman who lives in the Tenth district in Thies; she is married and the mother of three. Her main business consists of buying and reselling second-hand clothing. She has been in this business since 2005, and with this loan, she proposes to increase her inventory with the goal of improving her revenue.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU GOGO NDIAYEest une femme qui habite au quartier dixieme à Thies ; elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants; son activité principale consiste à acheter et à revendre de la fripperie ; elle fait cette activité depuis 2005 et avec ce prêt elle compte augmenter son stock dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: Inventory of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a teacher at SOS children's village in Makeni, a town in Sierra Leone. 47 years old and with four school-going chidren, Mariam needs additional income to meet her childrens' educational requirements. Mariam diversified her sources of income by establishing a small business selling agricultural products and has been running the business for a year.

She would like to expand her business and hire a part-time attendant to manage the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1500,000 and will repay the loan from her monthly salary.

loans.use: Increase her stock of rice, palm oil, chilli pepper and peanuts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is 52 years old, She is married with seven children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks, a business she has been in since 2002. She started the business on her own.

She is a LAPO client and needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Imuentiyan

texts.en:
Imuentiyan O. trades in bread, groundnuts and butter. She has been in this business since 2001, after learning the trade for three months. She is thirty-five years old, married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Imuentiyan has been a LAPO client for the past five years. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is fifty-six years old and married with ten children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for the past five years and she learnt the trade from her mother.

Rose needs a loan of $700 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Hadija's Group

texts.en:
They call themselves the "Business Community." All of their businesses are located in the Temeke market in Dar Es Salaam.

They sell various food items, including fruits and vegetables, maize flour, and rice wheat products. Some own kiosks in the market. They all in need of loans to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
CHEIKH D. is a specialist in animal feed and sells local grains at the retail level. He lives in the Malamine Senghor district in Thies and is single. He has been improving in his business for 17 years. With this loan, he wants to buy an ox and to increase his inventory of grains. He has a good loan history.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

MONSIEUR CHEIKH DIOUFest spécialisé dans l'embouche et vend des céréales locales au détail .IL habite au quartier Malamine Senghor à Thies et est célibataire. Il évolue dans son activité depuis 17 ans; avec ce prêt il veut acheter un boeuf et augmenter son stock de céréales. Il a un bon antécédent de crédit

loans.use: Animal feed

loans.name: Latiffa

texts.en: Latiffa I. is a business woman in Kariakoo in Tanzania. She has been in business for the past five years. She runs a shop selling cosmetics and medicated soap. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cosmetics and soap.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Alrelumhe is into production of cellophane. This she sells to stores and bakeries for packaging of various items like breads, groundnuts, etc.

Esther is 34 years old and married with four children. She has been a LAPO client for the past seven years and she has been in this business for ten years.

Esther needs a loan of $875 to buy more materials for her cellophane production. This will help her to make more profit and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more materials for cellophane production.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi S. R. is a 66 year old resident of Unguja in Zanzibar. He has been in business since he was twenty. His businesses have ranged from a kiosk, to a restaurant, to a grocery. He now runs a shop selling several household items. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business selling household items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is 48 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs, a business she has been into for the past eight years.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Zaituni Nagawa’S Group

texts.en:
N. Zaituni is a widow, age 40, with four children ranging in age from 20 to 14 years old, all of them in school. she is the first one from the left in the photo. She lives in Rubaga, a neighborhood in Kampala. Her business is selling charcoal, which she has been doing for the past 18 years.

Every two weeks, she buys 20 sacks of charcoal from motorcars and then sells it from her house. Each sack costs 20,000/= (Ugandan shillings, approximately $12 US). Charcoal is sold in smaller parcels to individual buyers from the village, with a typical profit of 5,000/= per sack (about $3).

With a loan, she would like to be able to buy more than 20 sacks at a time. She would also like to have a more permanent workplace. The loan will help with all of this, also making it easier for her to pay school fees for her children. Her future goal, though, is to build houses to rent. Additional profit from her charcoal business will eventually help her reach her goal. She has successfully serviced more than 4 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Bala

texts.fr:
Bala G. is a young mechanic who repairs motorcycles. He lives in the Escale Sud district in THIES and is married and a member of the Jammy Xaléyi bank. As a mechanic, he became specialized in repairing motorcycles and draws his entire income from this business. With this loan he is requesting, he wants to buy supplies for doing repair work.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

BALA G. est un jeune mécanicien réparateur de motos qui habite au quartier Escale Sud à THIES ; Il est marié et sociétaire de la caisse de Jammy Xaléyi ; étant mécanicien il s'est spécialisé dans la réparation de motos et tire tous ses revenus de cet activité. Avec le prêt qu'il demande il veut acheter des matériels de réparation.

loans.use: To buy supplies and parts for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi R. is a hard working, 57 year old mother of five. She's a resident of Temeke in Dar Es Salaam.

Bibi has been doing business for the past twenty years, and the profits have helped her sustain her family. She runs a restaurant selling all sorts of common seals in the Temeke market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Winifred Nakalema ’S Group

texts.en:
N. Winifred is 36 years old, married, and has eight children, ranging from 18 years to 4-year-old twins. she appears first from the left in the photo. She lives in the Nalukolongo, a suburb of Kampala. Her business is selling produce and charcoal at the market, which she has been doing for ten years.

Produce is expensive at times, but she buys sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes in the village directly from the farmers before selling them in the open market. Charcoal she also buys in the village, 25 sacks at a time. Each sack costs 21,000/= (Ugandan shillings, about $12 US), including truck transport to her market stall. She makes a profit of about 4,000/= (about $2.50) per sack of charcoal.

With a new loan, she wants to get more charcoal to sell. A loan will also help pay school fees for her children. Ultimately, her goal is to build rental houses. She has successfully serviced more than 7 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra I. is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. This is a business she has been into for the past 11 years. She sells her goods at home and at the market.

Sandra has been a LAPO client for the past seven years. She needs the loan of $700 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working, 37 year old mother of five. She lives in the Mjimwema area of Dar Es Salaam. She has been doing business for the past ten years, and the profits have helped her sustain her family.

She runs a food store selling all sorts of common seals in the Mjimwema market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her food store

loans.name: Mamoud

texts.en:
Mamoud B. is thirty nine years old and married with two children. His source of income comes from providing transportation services to the people of Makeni, a town in Sierra Leone.

Mamoud would like to expand his business and hire a motor rider to assist him. He is requesting a loan of Le.2000000 to purchase a second motor bike to expand his business to help him earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase one motorbike

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Mr Benjamin I. is married with two children. He is 40 years old and he lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells cooked food and drinks, a business he learnt from friends for two years. He has been running his own business for the past eight years.

Mr I. needs a loan to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sales to satisfy the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food stuffs for cooking and sales

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
“I thank God for making LAPO to be in Benin, I am very sure God made it to be in Benin because of me,” says Mrs Charity E.. She is 58 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

Mrs E. sells and supplies pure water which she learnt by herself. She has been into this business for the past 21 years. She needs the loan to buy more table water for sales to meet the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more Table Water for sales

loans.name: Sylivia Tibahwerayo `s Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a leader of a group of 4 members. She is aged 38 years and married with 2 children. They are aged 18 and 9 years. Both of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has a retail shop for essential commodities in Nakulabye, one of the nearby highly populated trading centers, where she also sells cold drinks. She has been in this business for 10 years.

The challenges she faces include high transport costs, price fluctuations and sometimes clients who purchase on credit take long to fulfill their obligations. The limited funds limit the range of goods she can access for onward selling, yet there is an available market.

Her benefits include ability to pay school dues and to contribute to the family welfare. She also acquired a motorcycle that is hired for public transport.

She aspires to buy a plot of land, where she can construct a house. Sylivia has successfully paid back more than 4 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Salum

texts.en:
Salum is married with two children. He lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam where he owns a shop in Tandika market. Salum sells new, imported clothes and has been in this business for more than six years.

He has had training in entrepreneurship and small business management from Youth Self Employment (YOSEFO). He has expanded his shop, and now wants to start selling cosmetics and medicated soaps, along side the clothing business. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his clothing business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu M. sells plastic sandals in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. She has been running the business for a year with very little capital. With three children and an unemployed husband, Kadiatu works hard to meet her family's needs.

She would like to expand her busines and rent a table in the market or another strategic location in the town, from which to run her business instead of hawking. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800,000. Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plastic sandals

loans.name: Liberacion Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a sweet young woman who lives with her husband and 3 children (ages: 4,6,7) in the beautiful town of Samana. With her first loan, Rosa started a small shop that sells fried foods such as fish, chicken, plantains, etc. She will use this loan to purchase more materials, and she also wants to purchase higher quality meat and fish. She said that when she’s not working, she loves to watch TV, eat chicken, and learn how to be a great businesswoman. She enjoys spending time with her family, and wants her kids to grow up to be professionals in the DR.

All of these women and men are taking out their second loans with Esperanza, and are very excited about the future. Thank you to Kiva lenders for your support and generosity in helping these entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, and oil.

loans.name: John Y.

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and married with two children. He sells soft drinks and beverages in Makeni, a town in Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, he increased his stock and has now many customers.

John would like to diversify and expand his business and is requesting a loan of Le.2000000.

loans.use: To diversify and expand his business.

loans.name: Delematus' Chickens Group

texts.en:
Delematus is 36 and married with a three year old son. He started a poultry business in 2000 and works raising his chickens from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day. In a month, he makes about $380.00 in profit from his sales.

Delematus now hopes for a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed for his business. He will share this loan with his loan group, called Tai, whose eighteen member guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

Delematus is pictured above, squatting on the right.

loans.use: Delematus would buy more chicks and chicken feed with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: “Since I began to take out loans from LAPO seven years ago, my business has been increasing," says Beatrice B.. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Beatrice lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and earns income buying oil in drums and supplying it to retailers in gallons. She was trained in this business for two years and currently needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more oil for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of oil for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 58 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and earns income selling provisions and foodstuffs. Florence learnt this trade from her friends, and currently needs a loan of US$875 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She will be very glad to have the loan, as it will boost her sales and thereby help her family. Florence is thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Gladys Bakitte `s Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a leader of a group of 4 members, and the first from the left in the photo. She is a 58-year-old widow with 5 children. They are aged 38, 25, 29, 22 and 20 years. Two of them are in school. She is also looking after 10 grandchildren, some of whom are orphans. They range between the ages of 8 and 16 years. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She hires redundant chunks of land and employs young men to make bricks, which she later sells. She also employs someone who is in charge of buying bales of clothes. She later sells these clothes in the mobile markets in different locations on different days.

Some of her challenges include the high transport costs and rising prices of the bales, and having to look for a market away from home in order to sell her goods. There is an available market for the bricks because many people are putting up buildings in the surrounding areas.

Her achievements include managing and looking after her family single handedly, and she has acquired piped water. She plans to put up rooms for renting out on the redundant piece of her land. Gladys has successfully paid back more than 4 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora C.´s business is the sale of various products at her own convenience store in the municipality of Cinco Pinos, where she is from originally. Through her efforts and by offering greater quantities of products on her store´s shelves, she has been able to support her three school-age children and has improved their economic condition.

As with any growing business, Teodora´s convenience store needs an investment in products to offer to her customers. For this reason she has been using loans from Ceprodel to acquire those products. Now that she has applied for another loan, she hopes her application will be approved so that she can continue to support her children and improve the standard of living of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Teodora C. es a la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de donde es originaria. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar, hoy en día ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas ofreciendo mayores cantidades de productos en sus estantes.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de pulpería de la señora Teodora necesita la inversión en productos para ofertarlos a los clientes. Es por esta razón que ella hace uso de los créditos que Ceprodel le brinda para la adquisición de dichos productos. Hoy en día al haber solicitado el crédito espera que le sea aprobada su solicitud para así continuar manteniendo a sus hijos y mejorar cada vez mas las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She sells provisions, fruit drinks and wine in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Currently, Patience needs a loan of US$875 to buy more provisions, fruit drinks and wine for sale. She is thankful to Kiva and is very happy about the opportunity to take out the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions, fruit drinks and wine for sale

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy O. is 41 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income selling provisions and drinks. Dorothy learnt this trade from her sister for two months and started her own business three years ago. She now needs a loan of US$450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale to be able to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en: Esohe O. is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she earns income running a hairdressing business. Esohe O. was trained for 3 years and started her business this year. She is now requesting a loan of US$525 to be able to buy beauty salon materials like hair attachments, creams, and relaxers. Esohe is thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon materials for sale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Doña Georgina is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas”, located in Jr Maya de Brito 399 of the District of Calleria of de Department of Ucayali. She is 22 years old and is the mother of a daughter. With a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, she decided to invest in a business buying and selling merchandise. At the present she is dedicated to buying and selling merchandise, she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her daughter, and then she sells and collects from her sales until 5 p.m. With this loan of S/.1200 ($450) to be repaid in 4 months she will buy ladies’, gentlemen’s, and children’s clothes, jewellery, etc. Georgina is very satisfied with her achievements up to now; thanks to her effort and perseverance she has been able to get ahead in order to provide for the expenses of her home in spite of the difficulties of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Georgina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr Maya de Brito 399 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años y es madre de 1 hija. Georgina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hija, de allí se dedica a la venta y cobranza de su mercadería hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropa para damas caballeros y niños, joyas, etc. Georgina esta muy satisfecha con lo que hasta el momento ha logrado; gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia, pudo salir adelante para poder mantener los gastos de su hogar a pesar de las dificultades de la vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
Doña Darcy is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Heroinas”, located at the “Mercado No. 1”, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and a mother of 3. Her husband is a merchant but the income is not enough to support his family and therefore, with a previous first loan from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Darcy decided to invest in a business selling juice. Presently she has a stall selling juice at the market. She gets up a 6 a.m. to prepare her juices and get ready for selling them on the market until 12 p.m. when she takes care of her children and does her chores. With this loan of S/.800 ($300) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a blender, a grill and other devices to increase sales. Darcy is very happy, she feels successful and important to her family as, thanks to her effort, she has been able to contribute at home, and on the other hand she is very thankful for the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Darcy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Heroínas, ubicado en el Mercado N° 1 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para el sustento familiar, es así que Darcy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de jugos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de jugos en el mercado, para ello se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar sus jugos y alistarse para ir al mercado a venderlos hasta las 12 pm y de allí se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a los que haceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 licuadora, 1 plancha, artefactos para vender, etc. Darcy esta muy contenta, se siente una mujer realizada e importante para su familia por que gracias a su esfuerzo puede aportar en su hogar y además esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice O. is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income selling table water. Beatrice learnt the business from a friend for 3 months, and currently needs a loan of US$1,125 to buy more water for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of table water for sale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Mr. Vincent E. currently needs a loan of US$875 to buy more tailoring materials for sale and thus be able to improve the standard of living of his family. Vincent is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children. He earns income running a fashion design business, which is a trade that he learnt for four years and which he operates in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

loans.use: Purchase of tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Naygir

texts.es:
Doña Naygir is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso”, located in Jr Apurimac 372, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of 2 daughters. Her husband is a chauffeur, but his income is not sufficient to support his family, and therefore, with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Naygir decided to invest in a business, buying and selling beauty products. Presently she has a business of promotion and investment in beauty products; she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her daughters and husband and then she works in her office until 5 p.m. With this loan of S/.1,700 ($625) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy showcases to increase her stock as well as more cosmetics. Naygir feels as a successful entrepreneur remembering how her income was poor when she started her business and with limitations to support her family, but with hard work and effort she has moved ahead and if it has not been for Manuela Ramos, this would not have been possible.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Naygir pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 372, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 2 hijas, su esposo es chofer, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Naygir con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de promoción e inversión de productos de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijas y de su esposo y luego se dedica a la atención de su oficina hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: vitrinas para ampliar su negocio y también comprará mas cosméticos. Naygir se siente una mujer emprendedora y con mucho éxito recuerda que cuando empezó su negocio sus ganancias eran muy pocas y aun tenia limitaciones para apoyar a su familia pero le costó trabajo y esfuerzo lograr lo que hasta ahora ha obtenido pero dice que si no fuera por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos nada de esto hubiera sido así.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Janeth's Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 47 and married with four children, aged 25, 21, 19, and 15. She started her business raising cows and selling milk in 1999. She works each day from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm with her cows and selling the milk. In a month, she is able to make a profit of about $70.00 from her sales.

Janeth has taken two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania in the past to pay for school fees and help her business. She now hopes for a new loan to buy another cow. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

Janeth is pictured above on the left.

loans.use: Janeth will buy a cow with her portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina I. is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income hawking and selling female shoes and clothes. Paulina learnt this business by herself, and has been involved in it for 5 years now. Currently, Paulina needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more female shoes and clothes for sale, so as to increase her profit and be able to take better care of her children and family's needs.

loans.use: Purchase of female shoes and clothes for sale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes is a member of “Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad”, located in Jr González Prada 148, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and the mother of 1 son. Her husband is a chauffeur, and with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Mercedes decided to invest in a small general store. Presently her store is well supplied and has grown with the help of her son who attends the business every day and it is very important for her to be on top of special offers and products to offer her clients the best. With this loan of S/.2,200 ($800) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 box of cooking oil, 1 sack of rice, 1 bag of noodles, 1 sack of salt, 1 box of milk, bread, marmalade, jelly, pops, yogurt, candy, etc. Doña Mercedes says that the loans are a big help for many things she is achieving, they help her out when she has needs, and make her business grow day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Gonzáles Prada 148, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es chofer, es así que Mercedes con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega esta muy surtida y ha crecido, con la ayuda de su hijo atienden todos los días, y para ella es muy importante estar siempre al pendiente de las ofertas que salen y de los productos para poder ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 saco de sal, 1 caja de leche, pan, mermelada, gelatinas, gaseosas, yogurt, golosinas, etc. Mercedes dice que los préstamos son una ayuda para muchas cosas que ella esta realizando, la salvan de algunas necesidades que tiene, y hacen crecer su negocio cada día.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock of a general store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Miss Josephine O. is 31 years old, single, and has two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income hawking and selling used clothes. Josephine learnt this business for 14 months, and has been a member of LAPO for over 5 years now. Currently, she needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more used clothes for sale, and is thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothes for sale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes is a member of “Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad”, located in Jr Revolución 520, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a teacher, and with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Mercedes decided to invest in a business selling prepared meals. Presently at her house she sells soups from very early in the morning and breakfasts which are very popular because of the area where her house is located, and therefore she gets up very early to get ready and have everything prepared for her customers. With this loan of S/.1,500 ($550) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 box of cooking oil, 1 sack of rice, 1 bag of noodles, 1 sack of salt, 1 box of milk, meat, vegetables, etc. Doña Mercedes is happy as the loans allow her to go on working and feel useful supporting the economy of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Revolución 520, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es profesor, es así que Mercedes con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas. En la actualidad vende desde muy temprano en su casa caldos, y desayunos que tiene mucha demanda por la buena zona donde esta ubicada, para ello se levanta muy temprano para alistarse y tener todo listo cuando lleguen sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 saco de sal, 1 caja de leche, carnes, verduras, etc. Mercedes se siente feliz por que gracias a los prestamos puede seguir trabajando y sentirse útil para ayudar en la economía de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for the preparation of food.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She hawks female wrappers - a trade she learnt for two years. Faith has been running the business for 5 years; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Faith has borrowed from LAPO Microfinance before, and currently needs a loan of $700 to buy more female wrapper for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of female wrapper for sale

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara O.is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She earns income selling medical drugs. By now, Clara has acquired many years of experience - she has been running her business since 1994. Currently, Clara needs a loan of $1,200 which she will use to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs for sale

loans.name: Tania Benturina

texts.es:
Tania is 39 years old, married but separated from her husband and has 2 daughters, 12 and 8 years old. Both study at primary level. Tania takes care of her daughters´expenses with help from her parents, who live with them.

She has a technical diploma in management. For 10 years she has worked as a cashier at the San Francisco de Asis school from 7:30 am to 5:30 pm. She is requesting a loan which will used to build a closet and paint a room in her home, an improvement she would like to make as she currently does not have a safe place to store her belongings and the walls have not had any maintenance for several years. At this time she has more emotional stability in her life and thinks about improving her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tania de 39 años de edad, es casada pero está separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijas de 12 y 8 años , ambas estudian la primaria, ella asume los gastos de sus hijas con el apoyo de sus padres, habita en casa de ellos.

Tiene un diploma de técnico en dirección de la economía; tiene 10 años de laborar como cajera en el Colegio San Francisco de Asis en horario de 7:30 a.m. a 5:30 pm, está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la construccion de un closet y pintura en su dormitorio, esta mejora la realizará debido a que no tiene un lugar seguro para guardar sus pertenencias y las paredes ya tiene varios años sin mantenimiento. En este momento se encuentra con mas estabilidad emocional y está pensando en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Build a closet and paint a room in her home.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Doña Mireya is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas”, located in Jr Maya de Brito, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a tank driver but his income is not sufficient to feed his family, and with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Mireya decided to invest in a business selling chickens. Presently she is selling chickens from a stall at the market, and therefore she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, then she takes care of her chores and later she sells chickens from 4 to 8 p.m. With this loan of S/.700 to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more chickens to increase sales. Mireya is happy, and she feels she is on the right track as her business starts paying off and she is able to help out with the expenses at home and she is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos has offered her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mireya pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr Maya de Brito del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para el sustento familiar, es así que Mireya con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de pollos. En la actualidad ella cuenta un puesto de venta de pollos en el mercado, para ello se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar para luego ir a vender sus pollos a partir de las 4 pm hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de pollos para incrementar sus ventas. Mireya esta muy contenta, y se siente encaminada puesto que su negocio empieza a darle frutos y de esta manera puede apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of poultry.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela belongs to the Mujeres Soñadoras community bank, located at Jirón Tnt. Carlos López 120, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the family so Mayela, with her first loan from Manuel Ramos, invested in a small amount of clothing for resale.

She currently has fixed up an of her house from where she can sell clothing, and this also makes is easier for her to take care of her home and to rent out rooms. She is always busy and this makes her feel fulfilled. With her businesses and with much effort, she is getting ahead.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy merchandise such as: clothing, shoes, jewelry, watches, etc.

Mayela works hard because she wants to have a peaceful, worry-free life, and with the income she has, in the future she would like to expand her storefront and sell other products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mayela pertenece al Banco Comunal _Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Tnt. Carlos López 120, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre D. 7 hijo, su esposo es chofer, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Mayela con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. ropas.
