En la actualidad ha acondiciono un ambiente en su casa para poder ofrecer sus prendas D. vestir, y le facilita también cuidar D. su casa y D. su alquiler D. cuartos, siempre esta en constante actividad y eso la hace sentirse mas realizada, con sus negocios esta saliendo adelante a base D. mucho esfuerzo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mercadería como: ropas, zapatos, joyas, relojes, etc.

Mayela trabaja mucho por que quiere tener una vida mas tranquila sin preocupaciones, con los ingresos que tiene en el futuro esta pensando ampliar mas su local y vender otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma Isabel belongs to the Las Almendras community bank, located at Jirón 29 D. Mayo, Mz. 200G, Lt. 25 in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman, but since his income is not enough to support the family, Norma, with the first loan she received from Manuel Ramos, decided to invest in land mollusks and vegetables for resale.

She currently has a stand in the La Hoyada market, where she goes early every day to sell mollusks to clients who anxiously wait to have breakfast and to buy her vegetables, which are in demand for preparing the area´s regional dishes. With another loan which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: corn, peanuts, fish fillets, paiche (a local freshwater fish) and vegetables.

Norma is happy with the loans she has received as they have allowed her to solve her financial needs and to give a better standard of living to her family, which is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. 29 D. Mayo Mz. 200G Lt. 25, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es pescador, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Norma con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. hupe y verduras.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Hoyada donD. acuD. todos los días muy temprano para poder vender su hupe a sus caseritos que esperan con ansias para tomar su desayuno y comprar sus verduras que tiene mucha demanda en nuestra comida regional. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: maíz, maní, hoja D. pescado, paiche y verduras.

Norma con los préstamos recibidos se siente feliz por que tiene como solucionar sus necesidades económicas, dar mejor calidad D. vida para su familia, que son lo mas importante para ella.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her food products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Noelia Antuanet

texts.es:
Noelia Antuanet belongs to the Virgen de la Natividad community bank, located at Jirón Sinchi Roca 236, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayalo, She is 29 years old and the mother of 1 son. Her husband is a verterinarian. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, Noelia invested in a small general store.

She currently takes care of the store as well as houshold work. Having the business in her home makes things easier for her as she can attend to her son, have things at home in order and continue to grow the business.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, candies, milk, medicines, coal, soft drinks, canned goods, oil, detergent and vegetables.

Noelia is happy to belong to Manuel Ramos because, thanks to them, she is more independent, is working and feels useful and can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Noelia Antuanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca 236, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es medico veterianario, es así que Noelia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad atiende su bodega, y realiza sus labores domesticas, tener el negocio en su propia casa le da muchas facilidades, puede atender a su hijo, tener en orden sus cosas, y seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, golosinas, leche, medicinas, carbón, gaseosas, embutidos, aceite, detergente, verduras.

Noelia se siente feliz al haber ingresado a Manuela Ramos, pro que gracias a ellas es mas independiente, trabajadora, se siente mas útil y puede ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora belongs to the Las Almendras community bank, located in the La Hoyada market in the Calleria district, department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a salesman but his income is not enough to maintain the family so Nora, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, invested in a business to sell cecina (a spiced, smoked beef) and chorizo (spicy pork sausage) from the region.

She currently has a stand in the La Hoyada market, where she goes very early each day to sell her products, like cecina and chorizo, which are in high demand in the area. She sells all her products because of the quality of the meat and the attention she gives her customers, with her charisma and smile.

With a loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: pork, corn, chorizo and cecina.

Nora is happy with the loans she has received as they have helped her to get ahead and to have a better future with her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nora pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Mercado D. la Hoyada, D. Distrito D. Calleria D. Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Nora con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. cecina y chorizo regional.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Hoyada donD. acuD. todos los días muy temprano para poder vender sus productos, como la cecina, el chorizo, tiene una gran demanda en nuestra región, termina toda su venta por la calidad que tienen sus carnes y la atención que ella da con su carisma y sonrisa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: chanchos, maíz, chorizo, cecina.

Nora esta feliz con los prestamos recibidos la están ayudando a salir adelante, a tener un futuro mejor a lado D. sus hijos y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing food.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis M. is a 52-year-old man who lives on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. He has a small business selling used and new clothes, but in the past year he has experienced a significant increase in demand and has began to do very well—his biggest challenge right now is that he simply does not have the capital available to buy enough merchandise to adequately keep up with demand from his community members.

Luis plans to use his loan to go to the large market place in the heart of the capital, called La Duarte. There, he will be able to buy his clothes in bulk and, with the help of the loan, he will not only be able to buy the amount he actually needs, but he will also be able to save money on the discounted wholesale price he receives.

His dream is to help his children be able to go back to one of the local universities in the area so that they can become professionals, and he also hopes to build and buy his own home one day in the near future.

On behalf of Luis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase the quantity of clothes and merchandise he is able to buy and sell to his community members.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora belongs to the Las Orquídeas community bank, located at Jirón Comandante Barrera 605, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband retreads tires, but his income is not enough to maintain the family. Nora, with the first loan she received from Manuel Ramos, invested in a small general store.

She currently has a store and rises at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband. After that, she takes care of the store until 8 pm.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: rice, sugar, milk, detergent, soft drinks, eggs, sweets, etc.

Nora is very happy now that she can manage her own income and stand on her own, and in this way support her children with their studies as well as help with household expenses. She is very grateful for the help she has received from Manuel Ramos for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nora pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr Comandante Barrera 605 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es vulcanizador, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia. Nora con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella cuenta una bodega, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica a la atención D. su bodega hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar, leche, detergente, gaseosas, huevo, golosinas, etc.

Nora esta muy feliz, ahora pueD. manejar sus propios ingresos y valerse por si misma, y D. esta manera apoya a sus hijos en sus estudios y también en los gastos del hogar por eso esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi T. is 43 and married. He buys and sells general foodstuffs such as tomatoes, canned goods, rice, oil, sugar and milk. His store is located in Adéta, a town approximately 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, he would like to increase supplies for his store and thus better meet his family’s needs thanks to the profit he will earn from selling these goods.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Koffi T. est âgé de 43 ans et marié. Il est spécialisé dans l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale que sont les tomates, les boîtes de conserve, le riz, l’huile, le sucre, et du lait. Sa boutique est localisée à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en stock de marchandises et par là participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly belongs to the Mujeres Soñadoras community bank, located at Jirón Guillermo Sisley 781, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of 5 children, and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Nelly decided to invest in a small business selling soft drinks.

She currently has a storefront in her own home from where she offers soft drinks, allowing her to take care of her domestic duties as well as the business. Her children take turns helping out, as they are still in school, and everything Nelly does is to give them best she can.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: soft drinks, candies, gelatins and mineral water.

Nelly says that since she began to work with Manuela Ramos her life has changed. Now she feels more secure, optimistic, and is very grateful to all the women who work at Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley 781, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, es separada. Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. gaseosas.

En la actualidad tiene un local para que ofrezca sus gaseosas en su propia casa, comparte sus tareas domesticas con la atención D. su negocio, sus hijos la ayudan y se turnan por estudian aun en el colegio, todo lo que hace Nelly es por darles lo mejor a ellos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas, golosinas, gelatina, agua mineral.

Nelly nos cuenta que desD. que empezó a trabajar con lo préstamos su vida ha cambiado ahora se siente mas segura, optimista, y esta muy agradecida a todas las mujeres que trabajan en Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mr. Mohamed F. is 25 and married. He sells general food products and cosmetics. Mr. F.’s store is located in Adéta, a small village approximately 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Many women like to purchase cosmetics in his store, and he sells sufficient quantities of these products. With this second FECECAV loan, he would thus like to purchase straightening creams, pomades, nail polish, hair extensions and wigs. He also hopes to purchase twelve bags of rice, ten containers of oil, five boxes of soap, ten boxes of powdered milk and five boxes of mayonnaise. These purchases will allow him to increase his supplies so that he can meet his customers’ needs and earn more profit. In doing so, he believes he can truly improve his life.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Mohamed F. est âgé de 25ans et marié. Il est spécialisé en alimentation générale et en produits de beauté. La boutique de Monsieur Mohamed est située à Adéta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise .Comme beaucoup de femmes aiment acheter les produits de beauté dans sa boutique et comme il les vend en quantité suffisante, avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite acheter les savons de défrisage, les pommades, les vernis, les mèches et les perruques .Il espère acheter également 12 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 5 cartons de savons de toilette, 10 cartons de lait en poudre et 5 cartons de mayonnaise. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits. Il compte vraiment améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his store

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
Ndèye F., a divorcee with four children to take care of, has been a member of the Djirighon Village Bank in Ziguinchor for five years. She is asking for a loan to buy and resell palm oil and lemons. Her income allows her to support her family, for which she has sole responsibility. Ndèye has always honored her commitments. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ndèye F., divorcée 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de DJIRIGHON à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et du citron. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille dont elle a entièrement la charge. Ndèye a toujours respecté ses engagements. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kafui D. is 27 years old and single. She works as a seamstress. She specializes in sewing boubous (traditional West African outfit), as well as clothing for women, young girls, and children. Her workshop is located in Adéta, a small village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan from FECECAV, she would like to buy fabric which she will use to make clothing. She would also like to buy a sewing machine to improve her work in order to meet her customers’ needs and to participate in the development of her community.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Kafui D. est âgée de 27 ans et célibataire. Elle opère dans la couture. Elle est spécialisée dans la confection des boubous, des habits des femmes, des jeunes filles et des enfants. Son atelier de couture est situé à Adéta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise .Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, elle aimerait acheter les tissus avec lesquels elle confectionne les habits. Elle désire également acheter une machine à coudre pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa clientèle et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Petrolina

texts.es:
Pertronila belongs to the Nativity Virgin Communal Bank, located on Jr. Raymondi 1095 Street, in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has four children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income, which they depend on, is not enough to sustain the family. For this reason Petronila decided to invest in rooms to rent out with her first loan of 300 soles ($100) from Manuela Ramos.

She is currently building more rooms and is also remodeling. Every day she supervises construction because she wants the rooms to be well-built and ready to rent. With this loan of 700 soles ($275), which she will repay over 4 months, she will purchase wood, cement, tools, door knockers, corrugated iron, and nails.

Petronila attends communal bank meetings regularly, and she enjoys the talks that the promoters give because they motivate her to keep growing her business and she can share the happy moments in the different activities in which her communal bank is involved.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Petronila pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Raymondi 1095, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Petronila con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de cuartos para alquiler.

En la actualidad esta construyendo mas cuartos, y también esta remodelando. Todos los días supervisa la construcción por que quiere que sus cuartos queden bien terminados y listos para ser alquilados. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: maderas, cemento, fierros, aldabas, calaminas, clavos.

Petronila asiste muy puntual a sus reuniones, le gustan mucho las charlas que siempre dan las promotoras por que la motivan mas a seguir creciendo con su negocio, y comparte momentos alegres en las diferentes actividades que hacen con su banco comunal.

loans.use: Purchase materials to construct rooms to rent

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Adamou

texts.fr:
Mr. Adamou I. is 32 years old and married. He works in butchery and cooking brochettes. His restaurant is located in Adéta, a small village about 150 kilometers away from Lomé, the Togolese capital. As many people enjoy meat, he is hoping that with this third loan he will be able to increase the scale of his business by buying beef to make brochettes. With the profit he will make from selling brochettes, he will greatly improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Adamou I. est âgé de3 2 ans et marié. Il opère dans la boucherie et dans la préparation des brochettes. Son restaurant est situé à Adéta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise . Comme beaucoup de personnes aiment la viande, avec ce troisième crédit, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant du bœuf pour faire la brochette. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente des brochettes, il va énormément améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the scale of his business by purchasing beef

loans.name: Noumovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Noumovi K. is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children. In order to earn money to meet the needs of his two children, he is a retailer of electrical products and spare parts in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, he hopes to strengthen his business with the purchase of new electrical products and spare parts in order to meet the constant demand of his customers and to participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Noumovi K. est âgé de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2 enfants, il achète et revend le produits d’électricité et les pièces détachées à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat de nouveaux produits d’électricité et de pièces détachées afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse de la population et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: Purchase of new electrical products and spare parts

loans.name: Enedelia

texts.es:
Enedelia is a married mother of 2 children, ages 27 and 26. She started her business 3 years ago, initially selling used clothing by bulk in the markets of Salinas, Ciénaga de Flores and Zuazua. She set up this business in order to get ahead in life and to support her husband with the household expenses.

She is now requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can stock up on shoes for the season and offer a wider selection of merchandise to her customers. This will be possible with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedelia es casada y tiene dos hijos de 27 y 26 años, empezó su negocio desde hace 3 años, inicio vendiendo ropa usada de paca en los mercados de Salinas, Ciénaga de Flores y Zuazua, ella empezó con el negocio para salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir zapatos de temporada y tener más variedad de mercancía para así ofrecerla a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Issatou

texts.fr:
Issatou D., 36 years old, who is married with five children in her care, has been a member of the Dinguiraye Village Bank in Vélingara for five years. She wants to boost her restaurant business by buying a second-hand refrigerator, chairs, rice, oil, meat and other ingredients for her restaurant. Her income allows her to buy cattle and improve her family's living conditions. Issatou is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Issatou D., 36 ans mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Dinguiraye à Vélingara depuis 5 ans.Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration en achetant un frigo d'occasion, des chaises , du riz,de l'huile, de la viande et autres ingrédients pour son restaurant . Ses revenus lui permettent d'acheter des boeufs et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Issatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand refrigerator, chairs and provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children (his daughter, Renée, is in the photo with Kossi). In order to earn money to meet the needs of his two children, he is a tailor in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first loan from FECECAV, he would like to strengthen his business by purchasing new fabric, buttons, and other sewing materials. With the profits he’ll make from selling clothing, Kossi hopes to also purchase another sewing machine to expand his business. He appreciates the opportunity that this loan will provide to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Kossi A. est âgé de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants (sa fille, Renée, est dans la photo avec Kossi.) Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2 enfants, il fait la couture à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat des nouveaux tissus, boutons et plaintes. Par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses vêtements, Kossi aussi espère acheter un autre machine à coudre pour agrandir son entreprise. Il apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie et la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Building his business by purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Adelfina

texts.es:
Adelfina is married to a truck driver. They have 3 children ages 19, 15, and 13. She started the business in order to help out financially with her children’s educational expenses. When her third child began his studies, the fees started to increase. Eight years ago, she started selling shoes and beauty products to her family and friends. Little by little, after so much effort, she has been able to establish a strong client-base.

She now needs a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy shoes for the season, and so that she can fill her customers’ orders. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelfina es casada y su esposo es chofer de transportes. Tienen tres hijos de 19,15 y 13. Inició el negocio para poder apoyar económicamente con los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, cuando empezó estudiar su tercer hijo, se empezaron incrementaron los gastos. Comenzó hace ocho años vendiendo zapatos y productos de belleza entre sus amistades y familiares. Poco a poco y a base de esfuerzo a podido hacerse de una cartera de clientes.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de temporada, y poder surtir los encargos que le hacen. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Ms. Adjo T. is 30 years old and married. She is a seamstress in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, she hopes to strengthen her shop by purchasing new fabric and another sewing machine to expand her business. This opportunity will allow her to earn more money in order to meet the needs of her family now and in the future.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Adjo T. est âgée de 30 ans et mariée. Elle fait la couture à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat des nouveaux tissus et une autre machine à coudre pour agrandir son entreprise. Cette occasion lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de son époux et à ses besoins futurs.

loans.use: Strenghten her business with the purchase of new fabric and another sewing machine

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena started the business in order to support her children and help them get ahead in life because after her divorce, she was left without her husband’s financial support. Eight years ago, she started selling tacos in her spare time outsiD. the factories in her district, taking advantage of the workers’ lunch hour. She currently sells her tacos full-time in front of her house.

She currently needs a loan of $475 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy the ingredients needed to prepare her tacos, offer a greater variety of food, and purchase new pots and pans. With your help, Magda’s business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena inició el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos, y sacar adelante su casa y su familia, ya que después D. su divorcio se quedo sin el apoyo económico D. su esposo. Comenzó hace ocho años vendiendo tacos en sus ratos libres con una hielera afuera D. las fábricas D. su localidad, aprovechando L. hora D. L. comida D. los trabajadores, actualmente venD. afuera D. su casa D. tiempo completo

ElL. requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y tener más variedad en sus comidas, así como comprarse unos sartenes nuevos. Con tu apoyo Magda seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies needed to make tacos

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena started the business in order to support her children and help them get ahead in life because after her divorce, she was left without her husband’s financial support. Eight years ago, she started selling tacos in her spare time outsiD. the factories in her district, taking advantage of the workers’ lunch hour. She currently sells her tacos full-time in front of her house.

She currently needs a loan of $475 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy the ingredients needed to prepare her tacos, offer a greater variety of food, and purchase new pots and pans. With your help, Magda’s business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena inició el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos, y sacar adelante su casa y su familia, ya que después D. su divorcio se quedo sin el apoyo económico D. su esposo. Comenzó hace ocho años vendiendo tacos en sus ratos libres con una hielera afuera D. las fábricas D. su localidad, aprovechando L. hora D. L. comida D. los trabajadores, actualmente venD. afuera D. su casa D. tiempo completo

ElL. requiere un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y tener más variedad en sus comidas, así como comprarse unos sartenes nuevos. Con tu apoyo Magda seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and materials to prepare her tacos

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia S. is 34 years old, single with 2 daughters who are in primary and secondary school. She does not receive support from anyone. She leaves for her job in a rural zone at 6:00 am, returning at 4:00 pm. Her mother takes care of the girls while she teaches boys and girls in the Guanacastillo de Acoyapa region. For the past 10 years she has worked as a teacher in different grade levels. She lives in her mother´s house and has always dreamed of having her own home. With some prior loans, she built a room in her mother´s house and bought a lot. Now she can be part of the San Sebastian project which is being developed in Acoyapa, where she will contribute US $200 and make a commitment to clear the land as well as pay for someone to help with the construction. With a loan she can take care of all the expenses for the construction of a house and a latrine.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Virginia S. de 34 años, soltera con 2 hijas estudian primaria y secundaria, no tiene apoyo de nadie, sale a su trabajo en la zona rural a las 6:00 a.m., regresando a las 4:00 p.m., su mamá cuida las niñas mientras ella brinda el pan de la enseñanza a niñas y niños de la comarca Guanacastillo de Acoyapa, hace 10 años labora como docente atendiendo multigrados.

Habita en casa de su mamá y siempre ha soñado con tener una vivienda digna y propia. Con los créditos anteriores construyó un cuarto en casa de su mamá y compró un lote urbano, en estos momentos ha sido beneficiada por el Proyecto San Sebastian desarrollandose en Acoyapa donde dara un aporte de U$.200.00 dólares, teniendo que asumir movimiento de tierra y relleno mas un ayudante para la construccion. Con este credito cubrirá todos los gastos que pueda ocasionarle la construcción de su vivienda y una letrina.

loans.use: Build a house.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Ms. Afi A. is 33, married and the mother of 2. She lives and works in Adeta, a town around 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To make a living and to help support her family, she runs a small boutique called "Carrefour 2000." She has a good client base because she has already benefited from two previous loans and successfully repaid them and has remained in good standing. This is her third loan with FECECAV. Afi would like to purchase drinks, sweets, cookies and other products to sell in her boutique. This will allow her to increase her profits and respond to the needs of her customers as well as help to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ms. Afi A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle opère une petite boutique qui s’appelle « Carrefour 2000. » Elle est un bon client puisqu’elle à déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, Afi veut acheter des boissons, des bonbons, des biscuits et autres produits variés pour revendre dans sa boutique. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et d’améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase various items to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Franck

texts.fr:
Mr. Franck E. is 36 and single. To make a living, he purchases and sells various products in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan, he hopes to restock his store in order to respond to customer demand and to participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur Franck E. est âgé de 36 ans et pas encore marié. Pour gagner de l’argent, il achète et revend les pièces détachées à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, il espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat de pièces détachées afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse de la population et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To restock his store

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en:
Ndeye N. is 44 years old and married. She sells animal vaccines in her community and is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies.

She has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank for four years and has a strong history of repayment. This loan is for six months and will repaid in a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To purchase animal vaccinations to sell in her community.

loans.name: Kpakpo Apelete

texts.fr:
Kpakpo Apelete A. is 23 years old, single and has no children. He lives in Lavie, a village about 30 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. Mr. Apelete specializes in selling telephone calling cards . He hopes to purchase a new phone and the repaint his store with the goal of earning more and improving his quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Kpakpo Apelete A. est âgé de 23 ans, et célibataire sans enfant. Il habite à Lavie, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Apelete est spécialisé dans la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Il désire par ce crédit acheter un nouveau téléphone et re-peintre sa baraque afin de gagner plus pour améliorer sa condition de vie.

loans.use: To purchase a new phone

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a beautiful 43-year-old woman who looks half her age! She lives with her husband and four children in the community of Los Alcarrizzos and runs a small business selling home accessories and supplies, as well as a small range of daily foods.

She is asking for this loan so that she can have enough money to increase her inventory and expand the amount of merchandise she is able to offer her customers. She says that the more she is able to offer, the more customers she will attract—if they can get all of their shopping done with her, they will only need to come to her!

She hopes that with the extra income she can generate from her business and this loan she can begin saving money to help send her youngest children to the local university in Santo Domingo. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand, and that she will always have the ability to work on her own to improve her family’s life.

On behalf of Luis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase inventory and expand the variety of merchandise she is able to offer.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Binta Baldé is 34 years old and married. She has 4 children and lives in the Kolda region of Senegal. Binta has been a member of Sinthiang Coundara Village Bank for five years and has significant experience with loans. She used to sell boubous, traditional Senegalese clothing, but then began making and selling peanut butter instead.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy peanuts and containers for the peanut butter. Buy purchasing in bulk she can increase her profits from the business. She hopes to improve the overall lifestyle of her entire family. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be reimbursed with a singe, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and containers for her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Madame Yawa A. is 39, married and the mother of 2. She lives in Lavie, a small village around 130 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. Yawa sells cereals that she purchases from neighboring areas. She would like to apply for this loan so that she can purchase 10 sacks of corn, 15 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of beans and 15 sacks of manioc flour in order to satisfy customer demand which continues to grow nonstop. With the additional profits she will see, Yawa hopes to pay for the schooling costs of her 2 children and help to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Yawa A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle réside à Lavie, une ville située à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Yawa vend des céréales qu’il achète dans les régions environnantes. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 15 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de haricots et 15 sacs de farines de manioc pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle qui est sans cesse croissante. Par les bénéfices qu’elle réalisera sur ses ventes, Yawa désire soutenir les frais scolaires de ses 2 enfants et de participer à l’amélioration des contions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase food products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Fatou Manda

texts.fr:
Fatou Manda C., aged 35, and married with three children to take care of, has been a loyal member of the Sinthiang Coundara Village Bank in Vélingara for five years. She wants to buy peanuts, shell them and turn them into peanut butter to then sell. Fatou honors her commitments, and her income allows her to improve the living conditions of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Manda C., 35 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides,les décortiquer, les transformer en pâte d'arachide et vendre. Fatou respecte ses engagements et ses revenus lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Awo

texts.fr:
Madame Awo A. is married and the mother of one. She is 33 years old. A seamstress, she also specializes in preparing red oil "l'huile rouge"." Awo hopes to apply for this first loan with FECECAV to help increase her commercial activity by enabling her to purchase more traditional style skirts and palm nuts(to make the oil). The profits she sees will help her to support her family as she is currently the sole provider while her husband is unemployed.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Awo A. est mariée, mère de 1 enfant et âgée de 33 ans. Couturière, elle est aussi spécialiste de la préparation de l’huile rouge à partir de la noix de palme. Awo souhaite par ce crédit qui est le premier de FECECAV, augmenter les capacités de son activité en achetant 5 balles de pagnes et des noix de palmes. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de son enfant étant donné que son mari n’a pas d’emploi.

loans.use: To increase her commercial activity by purchasing traditional style skirts and palm nuts

loans.name: Resplandecer Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother of 4 kids (ages: 5, 6, 11, 12) and lives in the town of Samana where she will soon begin selling shoes and clothing on the streets and to her friends. She will use this loan to purchase her items from a local flea market, and then will walk around to different homes and businesses selling the items. This is a very common business in the DR, and Francisca is confident that she will be successful. She has several ideas of how to differentiate her business. Her favorite foods are rice and lentils, and she said that in her free time she visits people who are sick and spends time talking with them. She has dreams of being a professional in the future, and wants to begin taking classes at the University soon.

Thank you for supporting this group of amazing people!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ms. Ama A. is 38, married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Lavie, a small village about 130 away from Lome, the capital city of Togo. With this first loan with FECECAV, she is hoping to purchase palm nuts in bulk so that she can produce red-oil, a popular local product. The profits she will make will help her to support her children and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ms. Ama A. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle réside à Lavie, un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce première crédit de FECECAV, elle espère acheter en gros les noix de palmes pour fabriquer et vendre l'huile rouge, un produit populaire. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr:
Mr. K. Mensah is 28, married and has no children. He has had a small business selling firewood for 3 years now. He lives in Lavie, a small village about 130 kilometers away from Lome, the capital of Togo. Mensah would like to apply for a loan, his second with FECECAV and hire two young men to help him with the labor involved in his business. This will help to satisfy customer demand and to increase his profits which will help him to improve his quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur K. Mensah est âgé de 28 ans, marié sans enfant. Il exerce l’activité de fabrication et vente de charbon de bois depuis bientôt 3 ans. Il habite à Lavie un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lome, la capitale togolaise. Mensah désire par ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, engagé 2 jeunes hommes qui vont l’aider dans l’exécution de ses tâches pour augmenter sa capacité de production. Ce faisant il satisfera à la demande de sa clientèle et dégagera plus de profits lui permettant d’améliorer sa condition de vie.

loans.use: To hire two young men to help increase production.

loans.name: Akoss

texts.fr:
Madame Akoss A. is the person to the right in the picture, together with the woman on the left who helps her. Akoss is 25 years old, married and mother of one. She runs a restaurant in Lavie, a small village about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She specializes in making traditional plates like fufu and pastas. She is applying for her first loan with FECECAV to purchase yams and corn to improve her business which will help her to support the needs of her family and satisfy the demand of her regulars.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Akoss A. est la personne située à droite et l’autre personne est sa collaboratrice. Akoss est agée de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle opère un restaurant situé à Lavie, un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de , la capitale togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation des plats traditionnels comme fufu et la pâte. Elle désire avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV acheter les ignames et du maïs pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle fidele.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies

loans.name: Khady Isagui

texts.fr:
Khady Isagui D., aged 56, is a widow with one child and three grandsons to take care of, and has been a member of the Médina Plateau Village Bank for three and a half years. She sends away to Mali for a special dyed cloth called “thioub,” which she then sells in Bignona. She wants to boost her capital. The income she makes from her business enables her to contribute towards the support, health and clothing of the children. Khady is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Khady Isagui D., 56, veuve,01 enfants et trois petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle envoi acheter des thioub (tissus teintés) au mali pour les revendre à Bignona. Elle veut renforcer son capital. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer à l'entretien, la santé et l'habillement des enfants.Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy dyed cloth

loans.name: Soleil D'amour Group

texts.en:
Anise is a hard-working and dedicated mother who lives alone with her three children (ages 8, 5, 2) in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. With this loan, she wants to buy used clothing to begin selling in her community. She told us that life in Haiti is very difficult right now, with food prices continuing to rise. She can only afford to send her children to school a few days a weeks, so she hopes that with her new business she will be able to better support her children. In the future, she wants to have her own shop with plenty of nice clothes and shoes to sell.

This group of women are very excited to start their own business, and improve their lives. Thank you to all Kiva lenders for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Futuro De La Mujer Group

texts.en:
Marileidi is a beautiful young woman with two children (ages: 6, 8). Their family lives in the small, coastal town of Samana in a nice quiet community. With this loan, she wants to start a business selling clothes. She plans on traveling to S. Domingo (the capital city) to purchase her initial stock, and then will sell it at a higher price in her town. Marileidi is a very motivated and intelligent woman, and one day wants to open her own store. During her free time, she enjoys watching the popular Spanish soap operas on TV.

Thank you for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 42 year old father of six who sells potatoes and matoke from a road-side stall in Kampala. He has had this business for ten years in the same location, buying his produce from the local market. He also has a business which rents out wheel barrows to supplement his income.

Abbas is seeking a loan to purchase another wheel barrow for his hire business and a sack of matoke to sell at his stall. 

Abbas' wife has her own little restaurant business and together they raise their children who range in age from four to 17 years. He hopes to one day have a shop from which to sell his vegetables rather than from his road-side stall.

loans.use: Abbas is seeking a loan to purchase another wheel barrow for his hire business and a sack of matoke to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Felix Amado

texts.es:
Mr. Felix R. stands out as a very hard-working person who works in cattle farming, raising and selling young bulls. He is the head of a family, and it is his responsibility to give the best standard of living possible to his wife and son. He lives in Chinandega, in the Cinco Pinos area, where he dedicates himself to hard work. When he saw the necessity to increase the standard of living for his family, he decided to invest in repairing his home which has been in poor condition for quite some time. After he began the repairs, he was not able to finish because of a lack of funds. For this reason he has turned to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan which will allow him to purchase the construction materials, with the purpose of continuing to give his beloved family an adequate standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Felix R. se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora el cual se dedica al negocio de la ganadería en la crianza y comercialización de novillos. Es padre de familia cuya responsabilidad es brindar las mejores condiciones de vida para su esposa e hijo. Habita en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega donde se dedica a su labor muy esforzadamente. Al ver la necesidad de brindar mejores condiciones de vida ha decidido invertir en la reparación de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en muy mal estado. Al iniciar la reparación se dio en la obligación de suspender esta obra por el recurso económico. Es por esta razón que hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales para la construcción con el único propósito de continuar dando las condiciones de vida adecuadas a su familia que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gloria Isidra

texts.es:
Living in the Cinco Pinos neighborhood of Chinandega, Ms. Gloria M. is devoted to agriculture, along with her husband. She has managed to get her children into a small community school. When she realized the need to invest in home repairs, she started with construction, but had to shut it down as their income was not sufficient to cover the expenses. For this reason she is now seeking Ceprodel’s financial support, in the form of a loan to purchase materials and pay for labor costs.

We should keep in mind that, over the years, she has been a faithful client of Ceprodel. She has obtained credits, which she has repaid according to the terms of the institution. Her main need nowadays is to obtain the loan in order to be able to start with the final stage of her home’s repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega la dama Gloria M. se dedica al negocio de la agricultura en conjunto con su esposo, habiendo logrado que sus hijos ingresaran a estudiar en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad. Al darse cuenta de la necesidad de invertir en la reparación de su casa de habitación, ella inició la reconstrucción pero suspendió la obra ya que no logró obtener el ingreso económico necesario que cubriera la construcción. Por este motivo es que ella hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo financiero en Ceprodel, para obtener el crédito con el cual logre adquirir los materiales de construcción y además el pago de la mano de obra para su vivienda.

No podemos obviar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de Ceprodel desde hace varios años, habiendo realizado créditos, que los ha cancelado de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es adquirir lo mas pronto el crédito para iniciar con la etapa final de la reparación de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and payment for labor costs.

loans.name: Modesto Emilio

texts.es:
Mr. Modesto M. comes from the Cinco Pinos neighborhood in the city of Chinandega. He works hard to make a living for his humble family. He is committed, along with his wife and three children, to improving their home, damaged by hurricanes, earthquakes and storms. He has started its reconstruction and enlargement, so that his children can enjoy better living conditions and be prepared in the event of another natural disaster.

Presently Mr. Modesto needs to invest in the purchase of construction materials. He has sought Ceprodel’s support, in the form of a loan, to be invested in the purchase of bricks, cement and sand. His investment in labor costs will be minimal, as he has construction skills.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Modesto M. es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, donde trabaja fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su humilde casa de habitación. Está comprometido con su esposa y tres hijos para mejorar su vivienda, ya que debido a los fenómenos naturales como huracanes, temblores y tormentas han maltratado su casa. Por esto ha iniciado su reconstrucción, ampliándola para que sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida y además para lograr tener menores riesgos al momento de algún fenómeno natural.

Actualmente el señor Modesto necesita invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel, para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de bloques, cemento y arena. Con respecto a la mano de obra, su inversión es mínima ya que él mismo tiene conocimientos en albañilería, lo que le beneficia en su obra de reconstrucción.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man with seven children, six of which are in school. He has a full time job in a tailoring factory, making uniforms for schools and businesses. He earns $47 per week. He buys a carton of 1000 empty sacks for $411 which his wide sells individually for a net profit of $58 per carton.

loans.use: David is seeking a loan to purchase one carton of sacks

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 36-year-old married man who owns and drives a boda-boda (motorbike taxi) for a living. He started this business five years ago with a bicycle taxi. After a few years, he sold the bicycle and bought a small motorbike. He has since sold that motorbike and now owns a bigger mortorbike. Eventually, Richard hopes to buy another motorbike and rent it to a driver to use as a taxi.

Richard also has a plot of land in his village where he cultivates maize, cassava and beans. He employs two workers to tend the land and sell the vegetables they harvest. Richard visits his plot in the village every three months to check on it.

Richard is seeking a loan to buy a small cow for $118 and seeds with the remainder of the money. His plan is to sell the cow's milk in his village and to plant the seeds on his plot.

Richard's wife works full-time at a tailoring factory. They have no children.

loans.use: To buy  a small cow  for $118 and seeds with the remainder of the money

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 25 year old married woman with a ten month old daughter. She started her restaurant business two years ago. It offers typical Ugandan cooked food - beans, rice and matoke - which she serves three times a day, seven days a week, from 7am to 10pm. Hanifa employs only one worker in her restaurant. 

Hanifa is seeking a loan to purchase a saucepan, some plates, and ingredients to cook in her restaurant.

Hanifa's husband sells shoes on the side of the road in Kampala and she cares for her daughter at work each day. She would really appreciate this loan so she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: Hanifa is seeking a loan to purchase a saucepan, some plates and ingredients to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Saly Sagna

texts.fr:
Saly Sagna Sambout, 49 years old, is married with 4 of her brothers' children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Château d'eau in Ziguinchor for 4 years. Her business consists of making traditional African outfits in Bignogna and sending them to France for sale. With her income, she takes part in the support of her family. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Saly Sagna S., 49 ans, mariée 04 enfants de ses frères en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste a confectionner des ensembles traditionnels africains à Bignona et de les envoyer en France pour la vente. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To make traditional African outfits

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Senora Norma is member of the community bank “Las Orquideas, located at Avenue Bellavista and Maya Brito in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and is a mother of four kids. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest it in a business of food sales.

Presently, she works through a sales position that she holds at the market, for which she wakes up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children. From there she dedicates her self to the preparation of the meals that she sells from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.

With this loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy staple foods such as rice, sugar, plantains, eggs, oil, noodles, etc.

Norma is very thankful for the support through Manuela Ramos, since it let’s her work in an independent manor with the support of her kids. Together they are able to conquer barriers and achieve their goals as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista con Maya de Brito del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 4 hijos, es así que Norma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado, para ello se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas que los vende desde la 5 pm hasta las 11 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres como: arroz, azúcar, plátano, huevo, aceite, fideos, etc.

Norma esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos pues de esta manera puede trabajar de manera independiente con el apoyo de sus hijos y así juntos salen adelante para vencer las barreras y poder lograr sus metas como familia.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
Olga Luz is a member of the community bank Las Almendras, located at Jr. Agustin Cauper 458 in the district of Calleria of the province of Ucayali. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband is a maize transporter, but the income isn’t sufficient to support the family. So Olga decided to invest in clothing sales with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles.

Presently she attends to multiple orders made by her clients and she travels constantly to be able to acquire products of very good quality. In the mornings, she’s dedicated to domestic jobs, and in the afternoons she goes out to offer her products.

With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be paid back in five months, she will buy: clothes, perfumes, bracelets, necklaces, undergarments, etc.

Olga feels very happy because she is proudly helping her family move forward and with the loans that she receives, she knows that she will invest them very well.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Olga Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. Agustín Cauper 458, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es estibador de maíz, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Olga con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropas.

En la actualidad para poder atender los múltiples pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, viaja constantemente para poder traer sus productos de muy buena calidad, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas, y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas, perfumes, aretes, collares, ropas interiores, etc.

Olga se siente feliz, contenta por que esta saliendo adelante para el orgullo de su familia con los prestamos que recibe sabe invertirlos muy bien y progresar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita is a member of the Communal Bank known as Virgen D. La Natividad located in Jr. Antonio Mayo D. Britto 528, in the district of Calleria. She is 48 years old and is a mother to four children. Her husband is a personal administrator, but the economic income which she counts on isn’t enough to be able to support her family. With her first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest it in buying cold beverages.

Now she has invested her earnings in more cold beverages as well as food sales. In the mornings she works as a teacher, which she has always enjoyed. In the afternoons her children help her out with this sales business.

With an upcoming loan of 1000 Soles, she hopes on buying ten boxes of soft drinks, goodies, some staple food items, etc.

Paquita feels great because she can keep making an income.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Paquita pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen D. la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Antonio Mayo D. Britto 528, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es personal administrativo, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Inés con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas invirtió en sus bebidas heladas y también en la venta D. comidas, por las mañanas trabaja D. profesora en una I. E. profesión que siempre le ha gustado, por las tardes atienD. su negocio con la ayuda D. sus hijos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 cajas D. gaseosa, gaseosas descartables, golosinas, víveres, etc.

Paquita se siente muy bien, por que pueD. implementar su negocio y generar mas ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: She will buy more beverages to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the communal bank Virgen D. la Natividad, located at Jr. Perú 597, in the district of Calleria and in the department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old and is the mother three children. Her husband is a worker for DREU and his income is not enough to support the family. For that reason, Norma received a loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles and she decided to invest the money in a beauty salon.

Presently she operates her business in her home. This way she can take care of her family and her home as she attends her clients. She has a lot of clients because she treats them well and does a good job.

With this next loan of 2,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in products for hair coloring, perms, treatments for shine, curlers, hair caps, brushes, etc.

Norma’s business is prospering and she is growing each day as a woman and as a business owner. She has received very good advice from the educators at Manuela Ramos and at the workshops that she as attended at the Manuela Ramos center.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen D. la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Perú 597, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es trabajador D. la DREU, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Norma con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una estética D. belleza.

En la actualidad su negocio lo tiene en su propio domicilio, se le hace mas fácil por que pueD. atender a su familia y hogar, goza D. mucha clientela por el buen trato amable que brinda y los acabados D. su trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementará su estética con la compra D. tintes, permanentes, esmaltes, bigudíes, capas, peines, etc.

Norma con su negocio esta prosperando, creciendo cada día mas como mujer y empresaria, gracias a los buenos consejos que recibe D. sus promotoras, y las charlas que siempre les dan en Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buy more products for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia belongs to the community bank, Las Flores of Paraíso (The Flowers of Pardise), located in Jr. Ucayali 669, Distract of Calleria, of Department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is the mother of one child. With the first loan that Virginia received from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian Soles), she decided to invest it in a small business of making clothing.

She sews all kinds of clothing. She wakes up at 7 am, to prepare breakfast for her child. From there she dedicates her time to make clothing to be able to deliver them to her customers until the late hours of the night.

With this next loan of 300 Soles, which will payoff in 4 months, she will buy: clothes for adults and kids, fabrics in diverse colors, zippers, elastics, buttons, etc.

Virginia is very happy, because her business is growing a little by little. Her sales are also increasing. All of the effort she puts into her business is so that she can give her child a good education and a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Ucayali 669, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Virginia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño negocio de confecciones.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confecciones de ropas de todo tipo, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de allí se dedica a la confección de sus prendas para entregárselos a sus clientes hasta tardes oras de la noche.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niño, telas de diversos colores, sierres, elásticos, botones, etc.

Virginia esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas también aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darle una buena educación y futuro a su hijo.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is the mother ot 2 school-age childes. She lives with relatives and her husband is an employee at a lodging in the city. The income he receives is minimum wage and is not enough to support the family. For this reason, two years ago Elsa decide to open her own business so she could help her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

LA señora Elsa es madre de dos niños en edad escolar vive en casa de sus familiares, el esposo es empleado en un alojamiento de la ciudad donde el ingreso que persive es el equivalente a un salario minimo nacional que no abastece para el sustento de la familia es por este motivo que ella hace dos años atrás decidió abrir su megocio para ayudar a su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and canned goods for her business.

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara belongs to the communal bank Las Alamendras, located in the Jr. Manco Capac 270, of the district of Calleria from the department of Ucayali. She is 62 years of age and a mother of 1 child, her husband is an independent worker, but the daily income is not enough to support their family. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest it in a small chicken coupe.

Presently with the earnings of her chicken coupe she has decided to start making shoes and purses to earn more money and keep herself more busy.

With this loan of 1,200 soles that will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy food for her chickens, vaccines, templates for purses, thread, and other accessories.

Sara is one of the founding members for her communal bank with her group. They are like family to one another, they always start activities to keep growing, and working with Manuela Ramos is one of the greatest things that ever happened to her.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr Manco Cápac 270, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es trabajador independiente, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño galpón de pollos.

En la actualidad con las ganancias de su galpón ha decidido incursionar en la confección de carteras y zapatos, para generar mas ingresos y sentirse ocupada, ya que siempre le han gustado las manualidades.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: alimentos para sus pollos, vacunas, moldes para carteras, hilos, suelas, accesorios, etc.

Sara, es una de las fundadora de su banco comunal, con su grupo son como una familia, siempre realizan actividades para seguir creciendo, y trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una de las mejores cosas que le han pasado en su vida.

loans.use: She will buy chicken feed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Rosario belongs to the Communal Bank of the Flowers of Paradise, located at Jr Apurimac 526 in the Calleria District, of the Ucayali Department. She is 61 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but the income that he realizes does not serve to maintain the family. Therefore, Rosario decided to invest the first loan that shereceived from Manuela Ramos in a business selling fish and bananas.

Now she has a store of fish and bananas in the veranda of her house, and to do this she gets up at 6am in order to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and later she works at the business until 5pm.

With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months , she will buy: 5 bunches of bananas, 10 kilograms of fish, fruit, etc.

Rosario is a very hardworking woman who never liked to depend on anyone, and this is why she has always moved forward based on her own merits. This allows her to feel good and her business is growing little by little thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos has brought.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 526, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Rosario con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. venta D. pescado y plátano. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. pescados y plátanos en la vereda D. su casa, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo y luego se dedica a la atención D. su negocio hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 5 racimos D. plátano, 10 kg D. pescado, frutas, etc. Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora nunca le ha gustado depender D. nadie es por eso que siempre ha salido adelante por sus meritos propios, esto le permite sentirse bien y su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: With this loan, Rosario will buy more merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Señora Carmen belongs to the Communal Bank 'The Breezes', located at Jr. Huanuco 200, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 51 years old, and is the mother of 3 children. She is a widow, and her income was not sufficient to maintain her family. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of an internet kiosk.

Now she has a business with internet terminals that is very well implemented and that she manages with the help of her children all day.

With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 1 computer to use in the kiosk. Carmen considers herself to be a woman who values herself only through her efforts and dedication to help her children improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Huanuco 200, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es madre D. 3 hijos, es viuda, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Carmen con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en negocio D. cabinas D. Internet. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. cabinas D. Internet muy bien implementado que lo atienD. con el apoyo D. sus hijos durante todo el dia. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1 200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 computadora para implementar sus cabinas. Carmen se considera una mujer que supo valerse por si misma valiéndose solo D. esfuerzo y dedicación para poder apoyar a sus hijos a salir adelante.

loans.use: With this loan Carmen will buy a computer for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Ms. Angelica C. D. M. sells used American clothing for a living. She has her own business space in Rodriguez. She does not have any children under her care. She lives with her husband, who is a wage-earning driver. She has been working from a young age, which is how she was able to help her children—who are now all independent adults—get ahead life.

Ms. C. D. M. works with Emprender and has not maD. any late payments. She was recommended to the institution by her daughter, who is also our good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA ANGELICA C. D. M. TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA D. ROPA USADA AMERICANA, EN PUESTO FIJO Y PROPIO SITUADO EN LA RODRIGUEZ, NO TIENE HIJOS A SU CARGO, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO QUE ES CHOFER ASALARIADO, ELLA DESD. MUY JOVEN SIEMPRE TRABAJO CON LO QUE LOGRO SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS, AHORA TODOS SON INDEPENDIENTES.

LA SEÑORA SOLO TRABAJA CON EMPRENDER, Y NO TUVO DÍAS D. ATRSO FUE RECOMENDAD POR SU HIJA QUE TAMBIÉN ES BUENA CLIENTE.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción belongs to the Damas del Oriente Communal Bank, located at Jr Inmaculada No 211 in the district of Calleria, the department of Ucayali. She is 71 years old and has four children. Her husband is retired and for this reason she decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 in nighttime food sales.

Asunción now has a business selling food at night. She wakes up at 9am to prepare her husband's breakfast and then starts to prepare the foods that she sells at night until 11pm.

With this loan of S/.1200, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy rice, leaves to make juanes (stuffed leaves), eggs, cured meat and other products.

Because of her age, Asunción is convinced that she still has much to do to accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Asunción pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Jr Inmaculada No 211 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 71 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos familiares, es así que Asunción con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida en la noche.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida en la noche, para lo cual se levanta a las 9 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos en las noches hasta las 11 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: arroz, hoja para juanes, huevos, cecina, etc.

Asunción a pesar de su edad esta convencida que aun le falta mucho para culminar sus metas.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy ingredients to prepare her products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Señora Dolores belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Jr. Apurimac 409, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department.
