She is 62 years old and is the mother of 11 children. Her income did not serve to maintain her family. Thus, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest at the start in the purchase of a delivery bike.

Now one of her children works driving the bike, and it has generated good income. With future loans, she wants to buy another bike order to continue working with the family and to be by the side of her dearest ones.

With this loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in maintenance and buy a few things that the delivery bike needs. Dolores has worked from a very young age in order to improve her family's lives. She has educated her children and now they are helping their mother and are progressing forward together.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dolores pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 409, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 11 hijos, su esposo es pescador, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Dolores con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad uno de sus hijos es el encargado de manejar su motocarro, que le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos, y con los prestamos siguientes quiere comprar otro motocarro, para seguir trabajando en familia y estar a lado de sus seres queridos. Con este préstamo de S/.2,400 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y compra de algunos repuestos que necesitaba su motocarro. Dolores, desde muy joven siempre trabajo, para sacar su familia adelante, les dio educación a sus hijos, ahora ellos están ayudando a su madre y juntos están progresando.

loans.use: The loan will be used to maintain a delivery bike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elisa Ivana

texts.es:
Ms. Elisa Ivana P. C. was born in Coroico, in the city of La Paz. She has obtained one individual loan with the institution. She sells chicken for a living in a rented business space. She has three school age sons, who help out in the shop, under her care. They live in Anticrético in the San Pedro zone.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA ELISA IVANA P. C. NACIÓ EN COROICO, EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, TIENE UN CRÉDITO INDIVIDUAL CON LA INSTITUCIÓN SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA DE POLLOS, SU PUESTO ES FIJO Y ALQUILADO, VIVE EN ANTICRÉTICO EN LA ZONA DE SAN PEDRO, VIVE SOLA Y TIENE TRES NIÑOS A SU CARGO, LOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR LOS CUALES LE COLABORAN EN LA VENTA DE CARNE DE POLLO.

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Señora Claudina belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Asentamiento Humano, Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 13, of the Yarina Cocha District in the Ucayali Department. She is 49 years old, and is a single mother of 5 children. The income that she has do not meet the family needs, and therefore Claudina decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the sale of local fruits.

Now she gets up very early in order to go sell fruits in the door of her house, and there is a lot of demand in her area. With the help of her children they get the household tasks done. Some of her children are independent but they are always asking her for support.

With this loan of S/. 1,700, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy fruits like: papaya, plantains, coconuts, mandarins, oranges, corn, etc. Claudina feels that to work with this communal bank is a great help for all the working women like herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 13, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre de 5 hijos, es separada, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Claudina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de frutas regionales. En la actualidad ella se levanta muy temprano para salir a vender sus frutas en la puerta de su casa, ya que tienen mucha demanda en nuestra región, con la ayuda de sus hijos realizan los que haceres domésticos, algunos ya son independientes pero siempre están pendientes de ella. Con este préstamo de S/.1, 700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como: papayas, plátanos, coconas, mandarina, naranjas, maíz, etc. Claudina siente que trabajar con su banco comunal es un apoyo mas para todas las mujeres trabajadoras como ella.

loans.use: With this loan Claudina will buy more merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Señorita Deysi belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 12, in the Yarina Cocha District in the Department of Ucayali. She is 23 years old, and is single. With the first loan Deysi recieved from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in clothing sales.

Now she is studying the technical career of nursing, and it is one of the reasons that she is working to sell clothing. The business permits her to pay for her studies and she has time to sell her products.

With this loan of S/.800, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy polo shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, stockings, and underwear. Deysi is dreaming up a better future, she needs to finish this race, and to work with Manuela Ramos is a very satisfying experience because she is learning to better manage her money.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Deysi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 12, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años, es soltera. Deysi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella esta estudiando la carrera técnica de enfermería, y es uno de lo motivos por los cuales se dedica a la venta de ropa, le permite pagar sus estudios y tiene tiempo para ofrecer sus productos. Con este préstamo de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro polos, camisas, faldas, shorts, medias, ropas interiores. Deysi esta forjándose un futuro mejor, le falta terminar su carrera, y trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una experiencia muy satisfactoria por que aprendes a administrar mejor su dinero.

loans.use: With this loan Deysi will buy more merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Dina Margarita

texts.es:
Señora Dina Margarita belongs to the Communal Bank of the Americas, located at Jr. Emancipación Mz. F Lt. 30, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 49 years old and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Dina received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Now she has a store that is stocked with various products like grains and textiles. With the help of her children she manages the business and household chores.

With this loan of S/, 1,000, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of salt, preserves, vermicelli noodles, milk, cold cuts, sweets, sodas, etc.

Dina is now able to meet certain objectives like educating her children, which is the reason for all her effort. At the end of her professional career, it will give her much satisfacion to know that all that she is doing is bearing fruit that will improve the lives of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dina Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz. F Lt. 30, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad tiene una bodega que esta surtiD. de varios productos de pan llevar, también con pasamanería, con la ayuD. de sus hijos atienden el negocio y se distribuyen las tareas domesticas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de sal, conservas, fideos, leche, embutidos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Dina ahora puede lograr algunos objetivos que como la educación de sus hijos que a base de mucho esfuerzo están terminado su carrera profesional, eso la hace muy feliz saber que todo lo que hace esta teniendo frutos que más adelante será para el bien de todos.

loans.use: With this loan, Dina will buy merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Clara Genara

texts.es:
Clara belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro (“Women with a Future”) Communal Bank, which is located in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali department. She is 47 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is a public employee, but the income he earns is not sufficient to support his family. This is why Clara, with the first loan of S./300.00 she received from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small sewing shop.

She now has many orders from clients, due to her friendly manner and the fact that the clothing is well maD.. She is able to sew and take care of domestic tasks since the sewing shop is located in her house.

With this loan of S/. 900.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: fabric for lingerie, threads, hooks, plain fabrics, lace, elastic, and buttons. She will also repair her sewing machine.

Clara is one of the founders of her communal bank. She was very interested in participating because of the payment terms it offers, which are a great help to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. Ñ Lt. 12, del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es trabajador público, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Clara con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller D. costura. En la actualidad confecciona muchos pedidos que le hacen su clientes, ya que les brinda un trato amable y las prendas confeccionadas tienen muy buen acabado, comparte su tiempo D. costura con sus tareas domesticas ya que su taller esta ubicado en su casa. Con este préstamo D. S/. 900 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: telas para lencería, hilos, cierres, blondas, botones, elásticos, botones, y reparo su maquina D. coser. Clara es una D. las fundadoras D. su banco comunal, y se intereso mucho en pertenecer a el por las facilidades que brinda, en los pago que son una gran ayuda para ella.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more materials for her work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Ana Maria A. is a hardworking woman with 2 children under her care. With this business, she is able to pay tuition for her husband, who is currently studying at a public university in order to better himself. She lives in the outskirts of the city of La Paz. This is the first individual loan that she requests, taking advantage of her excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ana es una persona trabajadora que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, la señora con su negocio esta haciendo estudiar a su esposo en una universidad publica para que este se pueda superar, ella vive en una zona peri urbana de la ciudad de La Paz Actualmente es el primer credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to restock her business

loans.name: Tautautasi

texts.en:
Tautautasi N. is married with three children. For many years, Tautautasi has developed business experience selling taro and banana to the general public and villagers, twice weekly. Her weekly net cash flow is approximately 200 Tala (~83 USD).

She has received three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tautautasi’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. With her loan, she plans to purchase taro tubers, a weed killer, pesticides, a shovel, an axe and a crowbar. She hopes that as her business improves, she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Aloema

texts.en:
Aloema F., 25 years old, is married with four children. Aloema has developed over three years of business experience selling vegetables, taro and bananas. She sells to people from her village and the general public, and she earns approximately 200 Tala (~83 USD) per week.

Aloema has received three previous loans from SPBD. SPBD loans are Aloema’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for loans from traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, pesticides, a shovel, a rake, taro tubers, and a weed killer. Her husband and children will do the farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie A., 43 years old, is married with three children. She has three years of experience with her food vending business. Her business is open six days a week and she earns approximately 250 Tala (~104 USD) per week.

Marie has received three loans from SPBD. SPBD loans are Marie’s only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for loans from traditional banks. The loan will help Marie hire labor and purchase materials for her food vending business. She hopes to improve her business, so that she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase cooler, mutton flaps, oil, flour and cordials

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en:
36-year-old Tagi L. is married, with three children. For over two years, Tagi has developed experience making sarongs and dresses with her sewing business, Her business is open six days per week and she earns approximately 180 Tala (~75 USD) per week.

Tagi has received two previous loans from SPBD. SPBD loans remained her only access to capital as she has been unable to qualify for loans from traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase different kinds of clothing materials includer a roller, needles, thread, pain brushes and paints. She hopes that as her business improves, she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase sewing and clothing materials

loans.name: Taimata

texts.en:
Taimata P. is married with four children. For over one year, Taimata has developed her business experience selling taro, banana and fish to people from her village and the general public. Her husband and children help with the farming and fishing. Her weekly net cash flow is approximately 150 Tala (~62 USD).

She has received one previous loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Taimata’s only access to capital as she did not previously qualify for a loan from traditional banks. With her loan, she would like to purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, shovel, axe, spear, water torch, goggles and fishing boots.

loans.use: To purchase farming and fishing equipment

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id: Saat ini klien tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Denpasar bersama suami dan anaknya. Mereka mengontrak tanah dan membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat dan saat ini dia sedang mengandung anak kedua. Usaha yang sedang dijalani oleh Yuli A. saat ini adalah sebagai penjual kue. Ada berbagai macam kue yang dijualnya. Kegiatannya setiap hari adalah mulai jam 03.00 dinihari dia sudah harus bangun untuk membuat kue. Pada pagi harinya dia membawa kue yang sudah dibuatnya ke pasar terdekat. Tempatnya tidak begitu jauh dari rumahnya, cukup dengan berjalan kaki saja. Keuntungan yang didapat selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga rencananya mau ditabung sebagi persiapan buat kelahiran anaknya. Yuli A. sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal sehingga usahanya lebih berkembang.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Kimmatoi

texts.en: K. Kimmatoi was born in 1979 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. K. Kimmatoi has been raising livestock for 13 years so she started when she was a young girl helping her mother taking care of the flock. Now Mrs. K. Kimmatoi is married and helps her husband with the animal care and milk making. She trades the milk to fellow villagers and at the local bazaar.  It is only a part time business beacuse Mrs. K. Kimmatoi also works as a schoolteacher in the rural school. Now Mrs. K. Kimmatoi applies to KIVA to for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months.

loans.use: For business development

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48843

loans.name: Arslonbeck

texts.en: MicroInvest loaned Mr.A. Arslonbeck money to buy a pedigree bull, which he paid back on time.  He is engaged in the livestock business. He dreams of having a large flock and in future opening a trade outlet to sell meat and the milk-sour products. Now Mr. A. Arslonbeck applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to build a new cowshed.

loans.use: to build a new cowshed.

loans.name: Subankul

texts.en: A. Subankul lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. As many his fellow villagers, he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. A. Subankul is very experienced in livestock with 30 years experience. He has a large flock. His business includes raises and selling livestock and maknig meat and milk-sour products. He is married and has 7 children so he has to work hard to ensure the good standard of living for his family. Now Mr. A. Subankul applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.use: to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Ni Komang Rani

texts.id:
Living in a city encourages Komang Rani to start the kiosk business in front of her house. She runs the business to support her husband who works a truck driver because her husband's income is not enough to cover the family's life expenses. With the initial capital of Rp. 1,000,000, Rani filled her kiosk with various kinds of merchandises such as food, drink, staples, snack, etc. Rani opens the kiosk in the morning from 6 am until 6 pm. Everyday, Rani goes to the market to buy the supplies at around 5 am as her house is quite near to the state market. Her profit is about Rp. 50,000 per day. She uses the profit to cover her daily expenses. As the price of staples is getting higher and higher nowadays, Rani feels that she needs to save some money for the future since her children are all married and live with their hussbands. She uses the loan from Dinari for adding her business capital so that she can offer more merchandise and she can expand the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup dikota membuat Komang Rani membuka usaha warung didepan rumahnya. Untuk membantu suaminya , Nengah Jasa, yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk ke Jawa . Karena Penghasilannya sebagai sopir tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan ekonominya. Maka Rani membantu dengan membuka warung di rumahnya.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Rani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan, minuman,sembako ,snak,dan lain-lain. Rani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari jam 6 pagi sampai sore jam 6 sore. Setiap pagi Rani juga pergi ke pasar untuk membeli keperluan dagangannya,sekitar pukul 5 pagi,karena rumahnya dekat dengan pasar negara. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari, Rani bisa mempergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari ,karena kebutuhan sembako harganya sangat mahal sekarang ini,maka Rani juga harus bisa menabung untuk masa depannya,karena anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dagangannya semakin banyak dan berkembang.

loans.use: To add capital for buying more kiosk materials

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: M. Tolibjon is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children. Mr. M. Tolibjon was born in a simple rural family and has worked with the livestock for 20 years. He is very experienced and he has the special skills in livestock care that helps him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. He wants to buy one more milk cow so he applies to KIVA for a loan of $625 for 8 months.

loans.use: to purchase one more milk cow.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48847

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sodi

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sodi, aged 38 years old, and her husband works in a private company. She possesses high spirits in life. Ni Ketue Sodi has 2 children, 1 already has his own family and the other in college. Ni Ketut Sodi is very grateful because her child receives scholarship from the regent because he excels in his studies. Ni Ketut Sodi had operated her stall for a long time. With the funding received from DIMARI Rp.5.000.000,- (about USD540) will be used for buying all essential for the stall. Included in the merchandise sold are several varieties light food and varieties of traditional Baliness cakes. Everyday Ni Ketut Sodi purchase at the state market leaving for the market at 4 am, distant between the market and her home is close by. Returning back by 5 am Ni Ketut Sodi immediately prepares and cooks all necessities of the stall and family. Ni Ketut Sodi starts selling at 6 am because since early many buy snacks, coffee, and tea. Everyday gross revenue earned Rp.400.000,- (USD43) and net income Rp.20.000,- (USD2) daily. Ni Ketut Sodi is grateful that receiving funding from DINARI thus enabling her stall to be busy.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sodi berumur 38 tahun dan suaminya bekerja disebuah perusahaan swasta. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki semangat hidup sangat tinggi. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki 2 orang anak, 1 anaknya sudah berumah tangga dan 1 masih kuliah. Ni Ketut Sodi sangat bersyukur karena anaknya mendapat beasiswa dari bupati karena pintar. Ni Ketut Sodi menekuni usaha warungnya sudah lama.Dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari Rp.5.000.000,- dipergunakan untuk membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya.Adapun dagangan yang dijual adalah berbagai macam makanan ringan dan aneka jenis kue tradisional Bali. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sodi berbelanja di pasar Negara pukul 04.00 pagi sudah berangkat ke pasar, jarak pasar dengan tepat tinggalnya sangat dekat. Sampai dirumah pukul 5.00 pagi Ni Ketut Sodi langsung mempersiapkan dan memasak semua keperluan warung dan rumah tangganya. Ni Ketut Sodi mulai berjualan jam 6.00 pagi karena pagi-pagi banyak yang membeli jajan, kopi, dan teh. Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat Rp.400,000,-dan keuntungan bersih tiap hari Rp.50,000,-. Ni Ketut Sodi bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari sehingga warungnya menjadi ramai.

loans.use: Add Funding for Business to equip her stall (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi warungnya)

loans.name: Saidullo

texts.en: K. Saidullo was born in 1962 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. As many his fellow villagers, he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. K. Saidullo has 25 years experience in livestock. He has the large flock. His business includes meat and milk-sour products making. He is married and has 5 children so he has to work hard to ensure a good standard of living for his family. He also works as the tractor driver in the collective farm. Now Mr. K. Saidullo applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.use: Opening a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.en: M. Nuraly lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. M. Nuraly, as many his fellow villagers, raises and sells livestock. It is the family business where his wife helps him. Mr. M. Nuraly is 47 years old, is married and has 6 children. He dreams of having a large flock. He has the appropriate skills and he has 30 years experience in livestock. He also works in the collective farm. Mr. M. Nuraly applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Sattor

texts.en: K. Sattor has been in the livestock business for 30 years and he has special skills because he watched and helped his father raise livestock growing up. He has a good flock (the pedigree bull and the milk cow).  It is only a part-time business because he also works in a collective farm. Mr. K. Sattor has a good reputation. He is a very good family man, loves his family and wants agood future for them. He has 7 children. Now Mr. K. Sattor applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase rams and sheep. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase rams and sheep.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: B. Matluba is 30 years old. She was born and lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. Mrs. B. Matluba has been raising livestock for 20 years, since she was a young girl and helped her mother. Now Mrs. B. Matluba is married and helps her husband with the animal care and milk making. She trades milk among the fellow villagers and at the local bazaar. Now Mrs. B. Matluba applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en: B. Sojida lives in the J.Utkansoi region of Tajikistan. As many fellow villagers, she raises livestock. It is the family business but she has her own duties. Mrs. B. Sojida is responsible for the animal care, milk production and sour product-making. It is very hard work so her children help her. Mrs. B. Sojida is married and has a child. She also works on a collective farm. She works hard and has good reputation. Now Mrs. B. Sojida applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase special modernized equipment purchasing for milk processing and sour products making.

loans.use: to purchase special modernized equipment for milk processing and sour products making.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en: Y. Sayora is 24 years old. She was born and lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married. Mrs. Y. Sayora has been raising livestock for 10 years, since she was a young girl and helped her mother taking care of the flock. Now Mrs. Y. Sayora is married and helps her husband with animal care and milk making. She trades the milk among the fellow villagers and at the local bazaar. Now Mrs. Y. Sayora applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.en: D. Mehrubon is 40 years old. She has two children. She is a widow. That is why she is the main bread-winner in the family. Mehrubon has been running her business for almost ten years. She sells candies and sweets in the local market . Her sons help her with the business. She works very hard to give her dearest sons a good education and to make them happy. Mehrubon is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 4 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her.

loans.use: To purchase candies to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id: Usaha sehari-hari Edi Suyanto adalah sebagai pedagang bakso. Usaha ini dijalani sudah sejak lama. Dengan berkeliling, setiap harinya dia menjual bakso buatannya menggunakan rombong atau gerobak kayunya. Kegiatannya sehari-hari dimulai dari pagi dengan berbelanja bahan membuat bakso dari pasar terdekat seperti bawang merah, mie, sayur dan daging sapi. Setelah diolah dan matang, pada sore harinya dia berkeliling untuk berjualan. Tetapi terkadang dia juga berjualan di Sekolah Dasar dekat tempat tinggalnya. Penghasilan dari berjualan bakso sementara ini cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dia berkeinginan suatu saat nanti bisa menabung untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya yang saat ini tinggal di Jawa.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en: Y. Sabira is 35 years old. She’s married. Sabira and her husband have three children. Her husband helps her with the business. Sabira is a farmer. She grows such crops as wheat, onion, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber and others. At the same time she raises cattle. Having worked the land for seven years, Sabira has gained rich experience. Each year she grows enough for family consumption and for selling. She is doing all her best in order to give her children a good education and a happy life. The business is the main source of income and generates stable income.  At the same time it requires considerable capital. Thus, Sabira seeks to purchase mineral fertilizer for planting and a number of her cattles. She is asking for a loan on the size of $600. The loan will be repaid in 7 months.  Sabira thanks all for supporting her and promises to pay the loan in time

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and the cattle

loans.name: Yormuhamed

texts.en: B. Yormuhamed lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. B. Yormuhamed, like many of his fellow villagers, is engaged in livestock raising and selling. It is a family business where his wife helps him. Mr. B. Yormuhamed is 47 years old, is married and has 5 children. He dreams of having a large flock. He has the appropriate skills and he has been working with livestock for 35 years. He also works in a collective farm. Mr. B. Yormuhamed applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625  for 8 months build a new cowshed.

loans.use: To build a new cowshed.

loans.name: Ziragul

texts.en: N. Ziragul lives in the Kairakkum region of Tajikistan. As many fellow villagers she is engaged in the livestock. It is the family business but she has her own duties. Mrs. N. Ziragul is responsible for taking care of the animals and  milk production and sour product-making. It is very hard work so her children help her. Mrs. N. Ziragul is married and has a child. She also works in the collective farm. She works hard and has a good reputation. Now Mrs. N. Ziragul applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow

loans.name: Ahmirza

texts.en: U. Ahmirza has been in the livestock business for 40 years.  He has the special skills because he watched and helped his farther in the livestock trade growing up. He has a good flock (the pedigree bull and the milk cow).  The business is only part-time because he also works in a collective farm. Mr. U. Ahmirza  has a good reputation. He is a very good family man and  loves his family and wants a good future for them. He has 5 children. Now Mr. U. Ahmirza applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months for purchase rams and sheep. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to the small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase rams and sheep.

loans.name: Mujiono

texts.id:
Mujiono currently has 3 labor help. With respect to Mujiono activity being a lamp shade/cover craftsman. Lamp shades/cover made resemble orders from artshop who are his customers and also purchased directly by tourists visiting his place. His effort is sufficient to pay his 3 labor help and also revolved back as funding again. But currently he lacks funding due to increased in costs of ingredients for making lamp shades/covers. Therefore he hopes to receive funding aid from DINARI to avoid discontinuing his business.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Mujiono saat ini memiliki 3 orang tenaga kerja. Adapun usaha yang digeluti oleh Mujiono adalah sebagai perajin kap/penutup lampu. Penutup lampu yang dibuatnya merupakan pesanan dari artshop yang menjadi langganannya maupun dibeli langsung oleh turis yang datng ketempatnya. Usaha yang dijalaninya cukup membayar gaji ketiga tenaga kerjanya dan juga diputar untuk dijadikan modal lagi. Tetapi saat ini dia kekurangan modal karena naiknya harga bahan baku untuk membuat kap/penutup lampu. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan mendapat bantuan pinjaman dari DINARI sehingga usahanya tidak berhenti.

loans.use: Add Business Funding (Menambah Modal usaha)

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Her husband’s earnings as a construction laborer are insufficient to cover the family’s expenses. Therefore she also has to work. Her daily activity is being a massage therapist. She serves nearby patient or customers who frequents her services. As her place of providing her services is far, she has to get there. Currently she for constrained by transportation. Her plan is to use this loan overcome the transportation constrains and purchase massage supplies such as oils. Her family’s condition is healthy. Currently she lives with her husband and 3 children in Denpasar.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh bangunan tidak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Karena itu dia uga ikut bekerja. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai tukang pijat. Dia berkeliling kuntuk melayani pasien atau pelangggannya yang sering menggunakan jasanya. Karena tempat pelanggannya jauh, dia sulit untuk menjangkaunya. Saat ini dia terkemdala untuk transportasi. Rencananya pinjaman kali ini akan dipakai sebagai biaya transport dan beli bahan-bahan untuk pijat seperti minyak. Keadaan keluarganya sehat. Saat ini dia tingal bersama suami dan ketiga anaknya di Denpasar.

loans.use: For Commute and Purchase Massage Oils (Untuk Transport dan Membeli Minyak Pijat)

loans.name: Sumarsih

texts.id:
Sumarsih’s daily work is selling cakes/cookies. This work has already been carried out since 8 years ago. Cakes/cookies of several varieties were made, ranging from cakes pre-prepared to fresh cakes. Each day, from 1 am, she must already prepare ingredients for making cakes, makes dough/batter and fries cakes for sale. After that, she gets ready to sell them at 6 am. She brings the finished cakes by the nearby market for sale by the shops. By mid-day, she takes a break then carries out her household work like cooking, washing and others. Sumarsih desires to grow her business. She hopes to achieve this with the aid of this funding. Currently Sumarsih lives alone as her husband had already passed away. Both her children are already married and have families of their own. Currently the families are healthy.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Sumarsih adalah sebagai penjual kue. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni sejak 8 tahun yang lalu. Kue yang buatnya bermacam-macam, mulai dari kue kering sampai kue basah. Setiap hari, mulai jam 01.00 dini hari dia sudah harus menyiapkan bahan untuk membuat kue, membuat adonan dan menggoreng kue yang akan dijualnya. Setelah itu, dia akan siap menjualnya pada jam 06.00 pagi. Dia membawa kue buatannya keliling pasar terdekat dan menitipkan diwarung-warung. Pada siang harinya dia beristirahat dan nelakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lain seperti memasak, cuci pakaian dan lain-lain. Sumarsih berkeinginan mengembangkan usahanya. Oleh karena itu dia sangat berharap diberi bantuan modal. Saat ini Sumarsih tinggal sendiri karena suaminya sudah meninggal. Kedua orang anaknya sudah menikah dan mempunyai keluarga sendiri. Saat ini keadaan keluarganya sehat

loans.use: Additional Business Funding (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr:
Tacko N. is 41 years old, married with 04 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Château d'eau in Ziguinchor for 5 years. She runs a business selling jewelry and making bedsheets out of cloth she has dyed. She has customers in Ziguinchor and in Dakar. With her income, she contributes to the maintenance of her family's needs. Tacko has always respected her commitments. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Tacko N., 41 ans, mariée, 04enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de bijoux et des draps de lit en tissus teintés qu’elle confectionne . Elle a une clientèle à Ziguinchor et à Dakar. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Tacko a toujours respecté ses engagements. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and to make bedsheets

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata D., married with 08 children in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Médina Plateau in Ziguinchor for 5 years. She would like to expand her business, which consists of buying dried fish and then reselling it. Her income will allow her to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Aminata is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Aminata D., mariée, 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des poissons séchés puis revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Aminata sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama Ndiaya, a 41 year old widow with 6 children in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Médina Plateau in Ziguinchor for 5 and a half years. She buys baobab fruit, hibiscus, ginger, sugar, bags of sweets, and flavoring to make ice cream. Adama also buys and sells food products such as palm oil and vegetables. With her income, she contributes to the care of her family. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Adama N., 41 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle achète le pain de singe, du bissap, du gingembre, du sucre, des sachets et essences pour faire des crèmes glaces. Adama achète et revend aussi des produits alimentaires comme l’huile de palme et des légumes. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetables, sugar, baobab fruit, hibiscus flowers, ginger, flavoring, and bags of sweets

loans.name: Sabé

texts.en:
Sabé N. lives in Kébémer, in the Louga region of Senegal. She is 31 years old and married with three children. Sabé has been a member of the Centre 2C Village Bank for three years.

Sabé is asking for this loan to take on a very big project. She will use this loan to purchase special tinted fabric called "Thioub," which is very popular in Senegal. She will also puchase a horse and carriage for transport.

This is a new and exciting endeavor for Sabé. She has an excellent repayment record for her previous loans. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be repaid by a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy special tinted fabric to sell and a horse for transportation.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi A.  is a manufacturer of a local gin (beverage). He is married and has four children. Business is doing very well and he wishes to increase production and sales. He is requesting a loan to purchase additional raw materials for production of the local drink.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production of a local beverage.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A.  is a distiller of a local drink.  She is married and has two children. Her business is doing very well and she wishes to increase production and sales of her beverage. She is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production of a local beverage

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah Q.  is a manufacturer of a local gin (drink). He is married and has four children. His business is doing very well and he would like to use this loan to purchase more raw materials to increase production and thus, sales of the gin. This will improve his standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.name: Assisatou

texts.en:
Assiatou Combé D. lives in the Kolda region of Senegal. She is 56 years old and married with two children under her care. She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for six years.

She is asking for this loan to purchase food items and traditional brooms to sell, and also to cover the costs of transportation to her sales sites. She has a very strong savings account balance and is happy to be approved for this next loan. This loan is for a duration of six months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut butter, limes, and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica D. sells farm chemicals including pesticides and fertilizers. She is married and has four children. Monica would like to use her loan to purchase additional inventory of her goods to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of farm chemicals for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha A.  is a trader who sells clothing materials. She is a single parent with three children. Martha's business is growing and she would like to use the proceeds from her loan to purchase more inventory for resale. This will increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Omosefe

texts.en: Mrs. Omosefe O. is 30 years of age; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. She does hair and also sells drinks and pure water, a trade which she learned in 6 months and started in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Mrs. Julie O. is 40 years old, is married, and has 2 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan of $875 to enable her to buy foodstuffs for sale. She said she will be able to serve her customers better, as her customers will have more goods to choose from. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married and has four children. She is a trader who travels to farming areas to purchase food products in large quantities for resale. She also sells building materials. Business is growing and Lydia wishes to increase sales but the cost of transportation takes a great part of her profit.

She is asking for a loan to purchase higher quantities of food for resale.

loans.use: To buy higher inventories of food products for resale

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 35 years old and originally from the capital city Maputo. He is married and has 3 children: a 10-year-old boy, a 6-year-old girl and a 1-year-old baby boy. The two oldest are already in school.

Arsenio didn’t complete secondary school. When he was attending 10th grade his parents divorced and the following financial difficult situation didn’t allow him to continue in school. His mother and 5 siblings moved to Boane, a village 30Km away from Maputo, but Arsenio stayed in Maputo to work. Arsenio worked for a few years as an administrative officer in a company and than 4 years for an international company. In partnership with the local company, Mozal, they would build houses and offices in the outskirts of Maputo. In 2005 his contract was over and Arsenio was dismissed from work, so he decided to move to Boane and start his own business.

Arsenio has a small general store in Massaca, a neighborhood of Boane, where he sells mainly drinks. Beer is sold for MTn 22, soft drinks for MTn 10 and wines between MTn 35 and MTn 80. With the store Arsenio makes at least MTn 800 per day, but in the end of the month he can sell up to MTn 2,000 in one single day. Arsenio decided to rent the house he build in Boane for MTn 1,500 per month and rent a smaller house in Massaca for his family, paying only MTn 500 per month and increasing the household income.

This will be Arsenio’s third loan with Hluvuku. The first and second loans of MTn 11,000 and MTn 14,000, respectively, were used to raise chickens and build the store. Arsenio decided to stop raising chickens and have the store because the chicken business was not going very well, as many chicks would die before reaching maturity. This MTn 18,000 will be used to buy merchandise and increase the store’s inventory. Arsenio intends to diversify and start to sell food and basic needs products at the store as well.

In the future Arsenio would like to buy a car, as transport is the most difficult part of his work. Today he has to pay around MTn 800 each time he goes to Maputo to buy merchandise.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. This is a business she learned for 6 months from friends; she needs the loan to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She says, “Thank you.”

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama D. lives in Vélingara, Senegal.  She is 39 years old and married.  She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for 6 years.  She is requesting this loan to improve her food business.  She will purchase corn and peanuts in bulk to resell for a profit.  <b> This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months. <b/>

loans.use: To buy six tons of corn and 4 tons of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Ndiawar

texts.fr:
This is a jeweler who is established at the grand market of Moussanté in Thiès. He is married, a father of five, and possesses a solid 30 years of experience along with an excellent customer base. Improving his business is the purpose of applying for this loan. He can then complete his customer orders.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

C'est un bijoutier installé dans le grand marché de Moussanté à Thiès. Il est marié, père de 05 enfants.Il dispose d'une expérience solide de 30 ans et d'une excellente clientèle. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses activités qu'il sollicite ce prêt pour terminer ses commandes.

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola S. is 31 years old, she is married with 5 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, a trade she learned from her mother. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions for sale. She is really grateful to Kiva in anticipation of the loan; this can be seen from her expression when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Simiao Israel

texts.en:
Simiao is 32 years old and originally from Boane, a village 30 km away from the capital city, Maputo. Simiao has been married since 1997 and has 4 children. The 3 oldest children of 12, 9, and 6 years already go to school. On top of supporting his family, Simiao helps his mother; his father passed away a couple of years ago.

Simiao studied until 4th grade and stopped due to his family’s difficult financial situation. With 6 siblings, his parents couldn’t afford all of them in school. Simiao started to work at an agriculture company with pulverization, and learned how to work in the field. His father had 2 “machambas” (small agriculture fields), and he dreamed of having his own machamba as well. In 2001, after more than 7 years working for 2 different companies, Simiao was able to save enough to buy 2 machambas for MTn 32,000 and MTn 35,000.

Today Simiao works at the 4 machambas (his father left him the fields when he passed away) and employs 6 workers. Each machamba has 80x80 meters and is irrigated by water. Simiao plants cabbage lettuce, beans, and cucumbers. The most profitable vegetable is the cabbage, although it is the longest to harvest (3 months). Simiao sells each cabbage for MTn 17 and has some of the largest supermarkets in the region as customers. Simiao pays MTn 1,000 per month for water, MTn 1,150 for a bag of fertilizer, and MTn 1,050 for a bag of the compost, and he uses normally 5 bags of each per month. The largest difficulty of the business is the inconsistency in prices (sometimes it falls dramatically) and the transport, as Simiao does not have a car to transport his vegetables.

This will be Simiao's first loan with Hluvuku. He has never asked for a loan before, and he decided to approach Hluvuku after seeing his colleague improve his machamba. This MTn 12,000 will be used to buy fertilizer and compost and will help speed up the new harvest. In the future Simiao would like to buy a larger machamba in Namaacha, a close-by district, where he would plant more cabbage and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene I. is 49 years old and married with 8 children. She sells drinks at wholesale; she learned the business in a year. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her business in 2004. She is requesting the loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale. She says, “Thank you to Kiva and its lenders.”

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.id:
Mohammad I. sells fruits. He travels with his motorbike around Kuta to sell his fruits. He obtains his fresh fruits from the nearby market. He plans to expand his business by opening his own kiosk yet he is constrained by capital. Hence he really hopes for help with capital to expand his business. Now he lives with his second wife in Denpasar. His first wife has passed away.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Mohammad I. adalah sebagai penjual buah-buahan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motornya, dia berkeliling sepanjang Kuta untuk menjajakan buah-buahan. Buah segar yang dijualnya dibeli dari pasar terdekat lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Dia berencana mengembangkan usahanya dengan membuka tempat berjualan sendiri, tetapi dia terkendala modal. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengahrapkan bantuan modal sehingga bisnisnya lebih berkembang. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama istri keduanya di Denpasar. Istri pertamanya sudah meninggal dunia.

loans.use: To get a kiosk

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr:
Fatma W. runs a small restaurant and needs funds to expand her services. She is married and the mother of two children. Her little restaurant is located near the quarry and she has a faithful clientele; she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her specialty is Senegalese dishes.

With this loan she wants to expand her stock of basic ingredients so as to increase her earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

FATMA W. est une restauratrice qui a besoin des fonds pour augmenter ses services. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Son restaurant est situé au quartier carrière et dispose d'une clientèle fidèle, elle vend le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner et le diner ; sa spécialité c'est les plats sénégalais.

Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son stock de matière première pour améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: to add to her stock of basic ingredients for her restaurant dishes

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D., 28 years old and unmarried, is a highly involved member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata. She would like to strengthen her clothing business by buying men's clothing, shoes, and perfumes. Her income will allow her to take care of her needs and meet her obligations. Bina is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Binta D., 28 ans, célibataire est une membre très assidu du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata Elle veut renforcer son commerce d’habillement en achetant des vêtements hommes, des chaussures et des parfums ,. Ses revenus lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de respecter ses engagements. Binta sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, and perfumes

loans.name: Argentina Joao

texts.en:
Argentina is 29 years old and originally from Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland. Argentina is married and has 2 children: Humberto, who is 8 years old, and Wagner, a newly born baby boy of 2 weeks (in the picture with Argentina).

Argentina has lived all her life in Boane, a village close to Namaacha and 30 km away from the capital city, Maputo. She studied until 10th grade and than pursued a technical course of 30 months to become a nurse. She completed the course in Maputo at the Science Instituto of Maputo and was awarded the equivalence of a secondary degree diploma. Argentina has been a nurse at the Health Centre of Matola 2 (a neighborhood of Boane) for the last 4 years and is proud to help improve her neighbors' quality of life. She works Monday-Friday from 7:30 am to 3:30 pm and has a monthly salary of MTn 4,200 (around US$172). The government increases the salary every year. This year they have promised an 11% raise, but as Argentina only has a secondary level degree, she will have a lower raise in her salary. Argentina is now on her 2-month maternity leave and will also stay an extra month home using her year’s vacation days. Argentina’s husband works as an electrician and helps pay the expenses.

This will be Argentina’s first loan ever. She decided to approach Hluvuku after talking to a friend and realizing she could speed the dream of concluding the cement fence around her house. The MTn 15,000 will be used to buy construction material such as cement and blocks and also to pay the construction worker.

In the future Argentina would like to ask for another loan to expand the house and provide more comfort for her family.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti Z. sells young coconut ice everyday. The distance from her home to her business is not that far as she can still walk. She usually goes by motorbike, but the motorbike is often used by her husband who works as a construction worker. Her business is quite promising although the profit is just decent. She plans to use the loan to build a pushcart. In addition the loan is going to be used for more working capital to buy more young coconut from the nearby market. She lives with her husband and two children at Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Siti Z. adalah sebagai penjual es kelapa muda. Jarak tempat usahanya dari rumah tidak terlalu, masih bisa dijangkau dengan berjalan kaki. Sarana yang dipergunakan biasanya sebuah sepeda motor, tetapi lebih sering dipakai suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Usahanya saat ini cukup menjanjikan, meskipun keuntungan tidak terlalu besar. Rencananya pinjaman yang didapat kali ini akan dipakai untuk membuat rombong sebagai sarana berjualan. Selain itu juga, sisanya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli kelapa muda dari pasar terdekat. Bersama suami dan kedua anaknya, saat ini mereka tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

loans.use: to build a pushcart and add more working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: “I am very happy about the Kiva loan,” says Mrs. Patience O.. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fresh tomatoes, a business she learned from her mother. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her business in 1984. She is requesting $1200 to buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Raky

texts.fr:
Raki B., age 48, is married and has three persons in her care, in addition to her five children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata, in Vélingara, for five years. She wants to buy peanuts, shell them, and make peanut butter from them to sell. The income derived from her business enables her to take care of schooling for her children. Raki is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Raki B., 48 ans, mariée, 03 personnes en charge en plus de ses 05 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les décortiquer , les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants. Raki sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is an experienced entrepreneur who helps support herself and her husband with a small business selling sweets and baked goods. Her business is located in a little space at the City market in Kahovka, Ukraine. She sells a selection of candies, boxed chocolates and cookies that are popular as snacks and gifts. Alla has been working as a market vendor for the past ten years. She makes around $300 in profit each month.

Alla has requested a short term loan to help buy additional inventory for her business. She hopes to continue operating a profitable business that will meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama Baldé lives in Velingara, Senegal.  She is 53 years old and married. She has 3 children, 5 grandchildren and another child from her husband's family under her care.  She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for over 2 years.  Mariama is requesting this loan to purchase a refrigerator for her ice cream business.  She will also purchase bazin and brodé fabrics to sell. This loan is for a duration of  6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk repayment at the end of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her ice cream business as well as 2 types of fabric for resale.

loans.name: Antonio Gomes

texts.en:
Antonio is 31 years old and originally from Monte Puez, in the Cabo Delgado Province. Antonio is divorced and has a 4-year-old boy. His wife got sick in Boane (a village in the Province of Maputo, 30 km away from the capital) and decided to have a traditional treatment at her parents’ house in Cabo Delgado. She decided not to come back and to keep the boy, even though Antonio really wanted to take care of his son.

When Antonio was finishing 7th grade in Cabo Delgado, his mother passed away and he failed in school. The following difficult financial situation didn’t allow him to continue his studies. In 1999 Antonio moved to Cuamba to work as a guard and construction worker at the house his sister was building, and he had the opportunity to attend 8th, 9th, and 10th grades. As Antonio is a very dedicated student, he learned English very well and had the opportunity to work at a South African company that built roads. In 2004 Antonio moved to Boane to live with another sister and work at her small stand selling used clothes.

Soon after, his sister moved to Beira and left him in Boane to take care of the stand. After a small amount of marketing research, Antonio decided to close his sister’s stand and open a stand at the bus and mini-bus final stop selling used shoes and socks. He was the first person to sell socks in Boane and therefore built a very strong customer base. Antonio buys the merchandise in a large warehouse in Maputo every other week. He buys closed packages that contain between 90 to 120 pairs of shoes. There are 3 types of packages: mixed shoes (MTn 2,700), sports shoes (MTn 7,000), and female shoes (MTn 2,500). Antonio cannot see what is inside each package, but lately he has been quite lucky. If he can get a good sport pair of shoes size 8/9, he can sell them easily for MTn 700. And demand is high!

Sometimes Antonio gets shoes that are too old and not in a condition to resell. Antonio makes at least MTn 1,000 per day, and during the end of the month he makes up to MTn 6,000 in a single day. He has a small safe at his house where he deposits at least MTn 100 every day. That is a way of saving and making sure he has money to pay his duties. Antonio’s expenses are small: he rents a small room for MTn 250 per month and pays for energy and his food, besides sending money to his kid.

This will be Antonio’s fourth loan with Hluvuku. The first MTn 5,000 was used to buy merchandise, and he repaid it in just 2 months. The second MTn 8,000 he used to buy a refrigerator and a sofa and paid it back in 4 months. With the third MTn 11,000 Antonio had to change his plan of only buying merchandise and used part of the money to pay his uncle’s medication expenses in Cabo Delgado, as he got very sick. This MTn 15,000 will be used to buy merchandise and repair his secondhand motorcycle that is not working. Antonio wants to increase his stand inventory and attract more clients.

In the future Antonio would like to go back to school and at least finish his secondary degree. He loves studying and dreams of one day going to university. Antonio would also like to expand his business and build a proper store where he would be able to employ people who have the same difficulties in life that he faced. He would like to sell food as well, guaranteeing steady sales during the whole month, and not only big sales at the end of the months. With his hardworking attitude and good business sense, Antonio will definitely succeed in his business and life.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a fishmonger. She is married and has four children. She buys fresh fish from fishermen, brings it home for processing and then later sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a small business selling shoes at a busy market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Her attractively arranged vending kiosk is well stocked with popular shoe styles. Anna has had her business for about five years. She makes about $300 per month, a lower middle income wage for Ukraine.

Anna has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to help purchase a new supply of shoes to sell. The change of seasons is a busy time of year for many market vendors like Anna. This loan will help her to meet demand and continue to make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase new shoe inventory

loans.name: Resmiati

texts.id:
Resmiati (27 year old) sells snacks such as fish chips and cakes and also beverages, soaps, instant noodles, cigarettes and phone cards. Her business, located at Jl.Dewi Madri Renon Denpasar, is very promising because of its strategic place, off an arterial road in Denpasar. She opens her kiosk from 08:00 AM untill 10:00 PM . Since her kiosk is always busy, she often can not take rest. Resmiati works really hard since she wants to save for her four year old child's education. Now she is asking a loan to expand her kiosk. She really hopes that DINARI can help make her wish comes true.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Resmiati (27 tahun) sehari-harinya berjualan makanan ringan seperti krupuk, jajan dan kue serta juga menjual minuan, sabun, mie instan, rokok dan juga pulsa. Usaha jualannya yang terletak di Jl.Dewi Madri Renon Denpasar cukup menjanjikan karena berada ditempat yang strategis karena merupakan jalan penghubung ke Kota Denpasar. Setiap harinya dia membuka kiosnya dari jam 08.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam. Karena pelanggannya sangat ramai, dia kadang tidak sempat istirahat. Resmiati cukup ulet dalam bekerja, karena dia berkeinginan nantinya dari hasil usahanya dia bisa menabung untuk pendidikan anaknya yang saat ini berusia 4 tahun. Saat ini dia mengajukan pinjaman untuk modal membesarkan kiosnya. Dia sangat berharap DINARI bisa mewujudkan keinginannya.

loans.use: To expand her kiosk

loans.name: Abdou Aziz

texts.fr:
Abdou Aziz G. manages a hardware store in the Escale Sud district in Thiès. He is married and lives near the Jammy Xaléyi bank. He benefits from his experience in retail commerce. This is why he opened the hardware store in 2007. Renewing his inventory of merchandise is the purpose of applying for this loan.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

ABDOU AZIZ G. gère une quincaillerie au quartier escale sud à thiès. Il est marié et il habite près de la caisse de Jammy Xaléyi. Il bénéficie d'une expérience dans le commerce de détail c'est pour cela qu'il a ouvert la quincaillerie en 2007. C'est dans le but de renouveler son stock de marchandises qu'il sollicite ce prêt

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria E.’s fashion designing place is a very unique one in the sense that the styles showcased are lovely and highly demanded by her customers. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for 8 years and started in 2002. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Omar

texts.id:
Omar works as a scavenger. It is not a hygienic job since it deals with garbage. But he works really hard. He travels with his cart around Monang-Maning Denpasar everyday to collect and buy used items to be resold later. Used boxes, cans and newspapers are items he typically buy. After collecting goods all day, he returns to his rented house at Jl.Resimuka Barat to sort and weigh them. This time he is asking for loan for additional working capital..

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha yang digeluti sehari-hari oleh Omar adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Pekerjaan ini memang sangat tidak sehat, karena berhubungan dengan sampah. Tetapi dia sangat ulet dan bertahan dengan usahanya saat ini. Setiap hari dia berkeliling dengan gerobaknya di seputaran Monang-Maning Denpasar untuk mencari dan membeli barang bekas yang nantinya akan dijual lagi. Kardus, kaleng bekas dan koran adalah barang yang biasa dia beli. Setelah seharian mengumpulkan barang rongsokan, sore harinya dia kembali kerumah sewanya di Jl.Resimuka Barat untuk memilah dan menimbang barang-barang hasilnya selama sehari. Kali ini dia mengajukan pinjaman untuk dijadikan modal tambahan dalam menunjang usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Mrs. Susan O. is 41 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes, a trade she learned for 6 months and started on her own in 1998. She is requesting the loan of $875 to buy more fairly used clothes for sale. She is very happy about the loan. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes for sales

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two daughters; one who is sixteen and one who is eight. She helps to provide for her family with a small shoe sales business located at an outdoor market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Ludmila is an experienced business owner. She has been selling in the market for the past nine years.

Ludmila has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase new inventory for her business so she can continue to sell many shoes and make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou Baldé, age 46, is married and has three nephews in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Samba, in Vélingara, for five and a half years. She buys "thioub" cloth to sell retail. She wishes to maintain this business that allows her to improve her standard of living and to provide the right care for the children. Bintou is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Bintou Baldé ,46 ans, mariée avec 03 neveux à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1 à Vélingara depuis 5ans et demi.Elle achète des tissus thioubs pour revendre. Elle souhaite maintenir cette activité qui lui permet d'améliorer son cadre de vie.et une bonne prise en charge des enfants Bintou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy "thioub" cloth

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Ndeye F. is a married mother of two children. She runs a store that she opened in 2005 in the Moussante market in Thies, where she sells foodstuffs. With this loan, she would like to purchase supplies for her store in order to better satisfy her customers and build a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

NDEYE F. est une femme mariée et mére de deux enfants .Elle gère une boutique qu'elle a ouvert depuis 2005 au marché moussanté de THIES et elle y vend des denréees alimentaires .Avec ce pret elle veut acheter de la marchandise pour sa boutique pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qu'elle veut fidéliser.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Mansata

texts.en: Mansata Baldé resides in Velingara, Senegal.  She is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children and 5 nieces and nephews under her care.  She has been a member of Centre II village bank for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase "Thioub" fabric in Senegal which she plans to export in the region.  This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy special tinted fabric for resale.

loans.name: Istamar

texts.id:
Istamar has been working as a scavenger for almost six years. He travels around Denpasar every day to collect and buy used items. He starts with his bicycle in early morning. After getting some rest at noon, he starts again in the afternoon. He then brings everything he gathers to his place at jl. Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Once a week buyers come to his place to buy goods such as cans, boxes, newspapers, steels and others. His income per month can go up to 500,000 IDR, but it barely covers his daily expense and nothing is left for saving. Hence he really hopes that he be given working capital to improve his business. He hopes to save enough money for his child's education (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00)

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Pekerjaan sebagai pemulung sudah dijalani oleh Istamar selama hampir 6 tahun. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling seputaran Denpasar mencari dan membeli barang bekas. Mulai dari pagi dia sudah bekerja menggunakan sepeda dayungnya. Setelah beristirahat sebentar pada siang hari, sore harinya dia berkeliling lagi. Setelah itu dia mengumpulkan barang cariannya selama sehari dirumah tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Seminggu sekali pembeli akan datang kerumahnya untuk membeli barng bekas dan rongsokan miliknya seperti kaleng, kardus, koran, besi dan lain-lain. Penghasilan yang didapat selama sebulan bisa mencapai Rp.500.000, tetapi itu hanya cukup untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari, belum cukup untuk menabung. Oleh karena itu, dia sangat mengaharapkan diberi modal usaha, sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih maju. Diharapkan dia bisa menabung untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Adjaratou

texts.fr:
Adjaratou C. buys cosmetics in Dakar for re-sale in Thiadiaye, a community located 35 kilometers from Mbour. The income from her business allows her to pay school fees for her children and contribute to daily expenses. She doesn't yet have a shop, so she sells house-to-house and neighborhood to neighborhood.

This is her first loan with IMCEC Mbour, and her file shows her to be a woman who honors her commitments. The income from her business will allow her to make on-time loan payments without difficulty.

Her clientele is essentially made up of women and she has got good experience in this field.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Elle achete des produits cosmetiques à Dakar pour les revendre à Thiadiaye, une commune située à 35 km de Mbour. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et contribuer à la dépense quotidienne. Elle ne dispose pas encore de Boutique. Elle est une brave ambulante qui vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier.

Ce crédit réprésente son premier crédit au niveau de l'IMCEC de Mbour et d'apres l'étude de son dossier, c'est une femme qui honore ses engagements et les revenus qui sont tirés de cette activité peuvent permettre d'honorer sans difficultés les échéances de ses remboursements.

Sa clientele est essentiellement constituée de femmes et elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

loans.use:
purchase and re-sale of cosmetics

Achat et vente de produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en: Ndeye N. is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Senegal, where she takes care of 12 children in addition to her own. She has been a member of the Centre II Village Bank since 2004, and is requesting this loan in order to restock her fabric and supply her Café Touba, a local Senegalese drink that she sells. <b>This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months. <b/>

loans.use: To buy fabric and Senegalese coffee for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor (Women Of Courage) Group

texts.en:
Roseline is an outgoing and lively 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 10) in the community of Agua Negra (Black Water). Agua Negra is nestled inside the biggest port on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, with several ships coming in and out every day. This community is perhaps one of the poorest on the north coast and gets its name because of the dirty and contaminated water that flows through the community. Roseline and her husband have two of their nieces living with them, and they can barely afford the basic necessities. With this loan Roseline will replenish her clothing and shoe supply and continue selling these products from her home. In the future she wants to own a house and expand her business.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Mariadi

texts.id:
His will to expand his business is the reason for Mariadi to request a loan to DINARI. His business of electrical tools sales is currently quite good, with the only limitation of capital to increase assortments of his sales goods. Daily income is sufficient for daily expenses and a small savings. He hopes with the business expansion, later on he could provide schooling for his two children, Elok and Ellen. Today with his wife and two children, Mariadi lives in Kepaon Denpasar , by rentin a house. His family situation is healthy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Keinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya menjadi alasan Mariadi mengajukan pinjaman ke DINARI. Usahanya sebagai penjual alat-alat listrik saat ini cukup bagus, hanya saja dia terkendala modal untuk menambah jenis barang jualannya. Penghasilannya setiap hari cukup untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga dan sedikit untuk tabungan. Dia berharap, dengan semakin berkembangnya usahanya ini, nantinya dia bisa menyekolahkan kedua anaknya, Elok dan Elen. Saat ini, bersama istri dan kedua anaknya, mariadi tinggal di Kepaon Denpasar dengan mengotrak sebuah rumah. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Miswati

texts.id:
The sales business Miswati is currently doing is already few years old. At this time business is good, although material price increases have affected her small kiosk, she is still entusiastic. Daily in the morning she has to go to Kumbasari market to shop for items for resale. Usuallly her child drives her there by motorcycle. Her sales includes soft drinks, coffee and also light food. Usually buyers are people who often pass her kiosk or live around the neighborhood. For this loan, she plans to use to increase business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jualan yang dijalani Miswati sejarang ini sudah berlangsung selama beberapa tahun. Saat ini usahanya cukup bagus, meskipun terkadang naiknya harga barang berdampak pada kios kecilnya, dia tetap bersemangat. Sehari-hari pada pagi hari dia harus ke Pasar Kumbasari untuk belanja barang lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Biasanya dia diantar oleh anaknya menggunakan sepeda motor. Adapun jenis jualannya seperti minuman ringan (soft drink), es campur, kopi dan juga makanan ringan. Umumnya, pembelinya adalah mereka yang sering lewat dikiosnya atupun mereka yang tinggal didaerah sekitarnya. Untuk pinjaman kali ini, dia berencana menggunakannya sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr:
Mariama Siré C., age 45, is married and has been a loyal member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara, in Vélingara, for five years. She wants to bolster her catering business by buying rice, oil, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. Mariama is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mariama Siré C., 45 ans, mariée est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration en achetant du riz, de l’huile, de la viande et autres ingrédients pour son restaurant . Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Mariama sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Supply of rice, oil, meat, and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Julie
