texts.en: “Big J. Food is a very neat restaurant, and the food is sweet; coupled with the services, I like it,” says one of Julie I.'s numerous customers. Julie is 39 years old and married with 5 children; she operates a restaurant, which she learned from her mother, and she started hers in 1989. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She says, “Thank you, Kiva and its lenders.”

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is a fishmonger. She is married and has two children. She purchases fresh fish from  fishermen, brings it home for processing and then later sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her customers and would like a loan to purchase more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Aissatou Aymadi

texts.fr:
Aissatou Aymadi Baldé, age 48, is married and has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara, inVélingara, for five years. She wants to bolster her catering business by buying rice, oil, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions and to help her parents in difficulty. Aissatou is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou Aymadi Baldé, 48 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration en achetant du riz, de l’huile, de la viande et autres ingrédients pour son restaurant . Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. et d'aider ses parents en difficulté Aissatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is a petty trader who sells sugar, rice, soup and other foods. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is doing well but she wishes to increase sales to improve her income.

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Mr. Chuks E. is 43 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is a motorcycle rider. He learned his trade for 4 years and started riding in 2000; he needs the loan of $875 to buy a motorcycle. He is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a fishmonger and is married with five children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing and then sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her costumers.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua H. prepares a local soup popularly known in Ghana as ‘Don’t touch me’. She is a widow with two children and her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Business is doing well but she would like a loan to increase sales by producing more soup for her market. The additional money will allow her to purchase more ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for soup production

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián sells women’s clothing and seasonal household items with his wife, and he has a young son. His home is located in the Sopocachi area of La Paz, and the home belongs to his grandparents.

This is the fourth time that he has asked for a loan through Impro; it will be used to buy merchandise (women’s clothing and some household items). Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fabián trabaja comercializando ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar con su esposa de acuerdo a la temporada, tiene un hijo pequeño. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona bajo Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, la casa pertenece a sus abuelos.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el monto solicitado será destinado para compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer, y algunos enseres para el hogar). Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio, la determinación de este micro empresario y su experiencia en el comercio, el cliente es apto para acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing and household items for his business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys B. is married and has 8 dependents. She prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’ which has maize as a main ingredient. It is highly patronized by the fishermen at the shore. Business is growing well and she wishes to increase production and sales. She is running low on ingredients for her food production.

Gladys is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her food production.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is married and has 2 children. She sells both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. Her husband also works selling shoes, but his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is doing very well but she wishes to increase sales to improve her income. She is running out of stock and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of drinks.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of beverages.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian vende ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar. Su esposa le ayuda en este negocio, el cual es su única fuente de Ingresos que tienen para mantener a la familia. Ellos viven en la casa de los abuelos de Fabian, en la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La paz.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el monto solicitado será destinado para compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer, y algunos enseres para el hogar). Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio, la determinación de este micro empresario y su experiencia  en el comercio, el cliente es apto  para acceder a este crédito. Fabian es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y sus antecedentes e historial de pagos es considerado muy bueno.

loans.use: compra de más mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar.

loans.name: Gloria Martha

texts.es:
Gloria belongs to the Las Brisas Communal Bank, and her business is located at Jr. Coronel Portillo 1049, in Calleria region of Ucayali state. She is 54 years old, mother of 6 children, her husband is a teacher, but their income isn’t enough to meet their family’s needs, so Gloria with her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 decided to invest it in an Internet café business.

Today she has her Internet café business, for which she gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and then opens her business so her clients may begin to arrive.

with this loan for S/.700 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a modem for her Internet café.

Gloria is very happy and content to work for her family’s benefit as she can unconditionally support her family, and she feels fortunate to be able to count on Manuela Ramos’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo 1049, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años, es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para el sustento familiar, es así que Gloria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de cabinas de Internet.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de cabinas de internet, para ello se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de alli abre su local para que sus clientes comiencen a llegar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 modem para sus cabinas de Internet.

Gloria esta muy feliz y tranquila de trabajar en beneficio de su familia puesto que ahora puede apoyarlos incondicionalmente, se siente afortunada de contar con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase a modem for her internet cafe

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba K. is married and has 4 children. She travels to a distant town to purchase food supplies in large quantities which she in turn sells to local customers in small quantities. Business is doing very well, but the cost of transportation is becoming a financial problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation costs

loans.name: Esi Araba

texts.en:
Esi Araba A. is divorced and has two children. She travels to a distant town to purchase food supplies like maize, in large quantities, to sell in smaller quantities. Business is doing very well but the cost of transportation is her major problem.

Ms. A. is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her small profit.

loans.use: To subsidize transportation costs

loans.name: Geovana Estela

texts.es:
Geovana is a single mother who has a small business selling handmade clothing and she also sells a variety of crafts. She lives in her mother’s home in the city’s downtown commercial area. She has a very good credit history with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Geovana es madre soltera que tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa artesanal y tambien vende variedad de artesanias vive en la casa de su madre en el centro de la ciudad una zona de comercio teniendo un muy buen historial crediticio con nuestra institución.

loans.use: Sell handmade clothing

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret E. owns a cold storage facility for which she buys fish in large quantities to resell. She is a single parent of three children.

Business is doing very well and she wishes to increase sales to improve her income. A loan will allow her to purchase additional quantities of fish for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of oral care products to keep running her small business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika belongs to the Communal Bank “Damas del Oriente,” located on Asentamiento Humano Villa Oriente Mz C Lt 8 in Calleria district of Ucayali state. She is 24 years old, mother of 2 children, and her husband is a motorcar driver. With Erika’s first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in the purchase of a motorcar.

Today she has a motorcar, and she gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband so he may go work with the motorcar and she takes care of their children because they are still very little.

with this loan for S/.2000 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will pay the initial payment for the motorcar.

Erika is very happy because she can make a living in a tranquil way and without needing much effort so as to be able to also take care of her small children and attend to the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Villa Oriente Mz C Lt 8 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Motocarrista. es así que Erika con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un motocarro, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo para que salga a trabajar con su motocarro y de allí se dedica a la atención de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, pagará la cuota inicial de un motocarro.

Erika esta muy feliz, por que puede obtener sus ganancias de manera tranquila y sin necesidad de hacer mucho esfuerzo pues de esta manera también puede dedicarse al cuidado de sus pequeñas hijas y a los que haceres de su hogar.

loans.use: Pay the initial installment on the motorcar.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca E.  is a hairdresser and is married with one child. She wants to improve the services she offers to her customers. Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy  hairdressing products for her salon.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer T. is in the communication business. She purchases mobile phone credit cards from service providers and resells the cards along a road. She is married and has three children.

Her business is growing and thus, she is running out of stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cards..

loans.use: To purchase additional mobile phone credit cards for resale.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
A. Clement is welder. He is not married and is focused on developing himself. Business is doing very well but his tools and equipments are outmoded.

He is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment which will enable him run his business effectively.

loans.use: To purchase more up-to-date welding equipment

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. sells cosmetics and fabric. She is married and has one child. Her business is growing and she needs to increase her inventory of goods for sale.

Florence is requesting additional capital to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. sells shoes and women’s dresses. She is a single parent of 4 children. Business is going very well, so Ms. P. wishes to increase sales to improve her income. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Hussein David's Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Hussein D., age 28, is married with a one year old daughter. He sells spare parts, which he started one year ago. He opens his business from 2am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $146.

Hussein has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase capital for his business. He hopes to get a new loan to help increase business. Hussein will share this loan with his subgroup members selling clothes, soft drinks, beer, and clothes.

In the picture Hussein is 1st on the right back row

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar A. prepares food for sale and also sells plastics and provisions. She is married and has 4 children. Business is going very well, so Mrs. A. wishes to increase sales. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a small entrepreneur from the town of Gannusivka, Western Ukraine. He runs a small retail store in the downtown area of his village. A married father of two daughters, he works really hard to keep his business sustainable and running smoothly. Ivan’s store is one-of-a-kind in their small neighborhood. He has been operating it for 11 years. Today his monthly profit is about $1200-1400. Ivan is very happy to have his family help him with the business. He believes their joint efforts make the family business a success.

Ivan hopes to develop his business further in the future. He is thinking about installing new, vinyl windows in his store which would make it a more comfortable place to work and shop in. A van he was able to purchase not long ago has facilitated his business activity and has helped Ivan save money. Today he is requesting a loan of 4000 Grivnas to purchase toys wholesale and offer a nicer variety of this type of merchandise in his store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer A. owns a provision store. He is not yet married but is focused on developing himself. Business is going very well, so Mr. A. wishes to increase sales to improve his income. But he is running out of stock.

He is asking for a loan to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.fr:
Jeanne D’Arc N., age 51, divorced, is a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata. She wants to bolster her business, which consists of buying pigs, fattening them up in a pen, and re-selling them. Her income enables her to improve her living standard and her business. Jeanne is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Jeanne D’Arc N. 51 ans, divorcée est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des porcs, les engraisser dans un enclos et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer son cadre de vie et d’activité. Jeanne sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, and an enclosed pen

loans.name: Rodolfo Daniel

texts.es:
Rodolfo is 29 years old, married, with 2 children ages 12 and 11 years old. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. His wife is a housewife and she is in charge of taking care of their small children. Rodolfo has had a business buying and selling scrap metal for a year. He owns two small trucks in which he moves the scrap metal.

He needs a loan to buy materials to build 7 meters of a bedroom and in this way improve his home little by little. Among his future plans are saving money to buy a truck to make moving the scrap metal easier, therefore being able to improve his income and consequently his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rodolfo tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, con 2 hijos de 12 y 11 años, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua. Su esposa es ama de casa y es quien se encarga del cuido de sus pequeños. Desde hace un año Rodolfo se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de chatarra. Posee dos camionetas en las que traslada la chatarra.

Requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer 7 mts de un cuarto de habitación y así ir mejorando su casa poco a poco. Entre sus planes está reunir dinero para la compra de un camión para hacer más facil el traslado del material, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Construct 7 meters of a bedroom

loans.name: Dayzi Inocencia

texts.es:
Dayzi comes from a humble family that has advanced in small steps from a grocery business they've run. She has 4 children and has been a very industrious person since a young age. Currently, this is the fourth loan that seeks as an individual, having had an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dayzi proviene de una familia humilde que poco a poco sacaron adelante un negocio de abarrotes tine 4 hijos, es una prsona muy trabajadora desde pequeña. Actualmente es el cuarto credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two kids. This is an average family from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. However, Natalya is a unique entrepreneur. She has been selling clothing in the central city market for about a year, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: she tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of her products – she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again.

Presently, Natalya has over $4000 in turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is over $500. However, she doesn’t want to stop where she is at with her venture. Natalya is seeking a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to re-stock the merchandise in her kiosk for the upcoming summer season. We believe that Natalya’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will determine her further success and encourage new customers to buy from her.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory before summer season

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa E. prepares a native food called ‘banku’, which is made from maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. E. is married and has 4 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales, but she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for food production and sale

loans.name: Prisa Meshack's Tujikwamue A Group

texts.en:
Prisca M., age 34, is married with three children (ages 11, 9 and 5). She has a business of producing and selling clothes which she began four years ago.  She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able make a monthly profit of about $243. 

Prisca has taken out three previous loans from Tujujege Tanzania to expand her business. She hopes for a new loan to start building a house.  Prisca will share this loan with her subgroup members who sell fish, charcoal clothing and soft drinks.

In the picture Prisca is 2nd from left standing in blue

loans.use: to start building a house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’, which is made from maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. M. is married and has 7 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales, but she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her food production business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her food production business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. prepares a native food called ‘banku’, which is made from maize. Banku is popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. A. is married and has 4 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales. But she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her food production business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for food production and sale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana O. sells food items. She is married and has 4 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase sales. But she is running out of stock.

Mrs. O. is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Julia lives in the suburbs of La Paz. For a couple of years, she has been running a business selling sweaters. She had to send her children away for some time because of a personal situation she encountered, but she has hopes that soon she will be able to offer them better conditions to live and be reunited with her children again. She works with this loan to increase her merchandise and improve her income. She has excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora julia vive en una zona peri urbana D. la ciudad D. la Paz tiene un negocio D. venta D. chompas hace un par D. años tuvo que mandar a sus hijos al extranjero por la cituacion en la que se encontraban, por un tiempo pero guarda la esperanza que pronto pueda ofrecerles mejores condiciones D. vida y recuperar a sus hijos, trabaja con credito para incrementar su mercaderia y mejorar sus ingresos teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: to buy sweaters and increase her inventory

loans.name: Mata

texts.fr:
Mata K., 42, is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank in Vélingara for five years. She would like to purchase peanuts to turn into peanut butter and then sell. Mata has always kept her commitments to her group. Her income allows her to improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mata K., 42 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge dont 04 élèves est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les transformer en pâte et vendre. Mata a toujours respecté ses engagements au niveau de son groupe .Ses revenus lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is professional photographer. He is married and has 3 dependants. Mr. A. covers a wide area for his work, and would like to have a motorbike to help him make his rounds.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy a motorbike to carry out his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use in his business

loans.name: Ebo

texts.en:
Ebo Q. sells both alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. He is married and has 5 children. His income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is going very well, so he wishes to increase sales to improve his income, but he is running out of stock.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Stephano Mpims' Tujikwamue Uk E Group

texts.en:
Stephano M., age 40, is married with four children (ages 18, 11,7 and 1). He has a butcher shop which he began 10 years ago. His shop is open from 5am to 3pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of around $567.

Stephano has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to help support his butcher shop. He hopes for a new loan to open another butchery. Stephano will share this loan with his subgroup members selling charcoal, soap, vegetable, fruits, annd food.

In the picture Stephano is 1st from left standing in back row

loans.use: to open another butchery

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a baker who has been in this business for several years. She is married and has 3 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase sales. But her major challenge is an increase in the price of raw materials, especially flour for baking.

She is asking for a loan to buy more flour and other ingredients for production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo lives with his wife and two children in their own home, which is in the area north of the city of La Paz. Teofilo is employed in a services provider company in La Paz. The loan he seeks is to build a cement floor in his home. It is currently made of dirt, so when it rains, the humidity damages the walls. This is the first time he solicits a loan and a socio-economic analysis favorably qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

El señor Teofilo vive en casa Propia, en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El Señor Teofilo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de servicios de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para el vaciado de piso de cemento en su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y en épocas de lluvia, la humedad daña las paredes. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: to build a cement floor in his home

loans.name: Donkoh K.

texts.en:
Donkoh K. S. manufactures palm oil, a product of the palm fruit. Most Ghanaians use palm oil for preparing sauce for stew. It can also be used as an ingredient in soap. S. is married and has 5 children. Business is going very well, so S. wishes to increase sales. But his biggest challenge is the increase in the price of palm fruit, his main raw material.

S. is asking for a loan to buy more palm fruit and other ingredients for palm oil production and sale.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruit and other ingredients for palm oil production and sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan A. lives in a rented home with his wife and children in the street of Caopolikan, which is the neighborhood of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He has a taxi that he uses for providing transportation services. The loan he seeks is to convert his car to be natural gas compatible from gasoline in order to save costs by 50%. Compressed natural gas costs less than gasoline.

This former client of IMPRO has a good credit history that allows him to be granted a new loan. He has had a relationship with IMPRO since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Spanish Translator.

El señor Juan A. vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y sus hijos en la calle Caopolikan de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte publico y el crédito que solicita es para transformar su vehiculo que actualmente es a gasolina convertirlo a Gas Natural Comprimido y de esta manera poder minimizar sus costos en un 50%, pues el gas natural comprimido cuesta menos que la gasolina.

Es cliente antiguo de Impro y su historial es bueno por lo cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Su relación crediticia con IMPRO data desde el año 2004.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to use compressed natural gas from gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou S., 45, is married and has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank for three years. She wants to expand her business, which involves purchasing cows, fattening them and then killing them and selling the meat. Her income allows her to help take care of her family. Kadidiatou is requesting her seventh loan, which will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadidiatou S., 45 ans, mariée, est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des bœufs, les engraisser puis faire l’abattage et vendre la viande.. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’entretien de sa famille. Kadidiatou sollicite un 7ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel is 24 years old, married, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has a five-year-old son, and her husband is a merchant at a market in Mayoreo. Ms. Maribel's primary activity is selling fruits and vegetables. She already had eight years of experience at it, and she got started with her own money that she inherited from her mother.

With the loan that they are requesting from you, she will invest in strengthening her two activities so she can earn more and satisfy her customers. All her work is devoted to earning enough to pay for the education of her young son so he can grow up to become a man of means. She would also like to buy herself a vehicle to make her travel between work and home easier.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Maribel tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de un mercado en el Mayoreo. La actividad de doña Maribel es venta de frutas y verduras, ya tiene ocho años de experiencia y comenzó con capital propio heredado por su mamá. Con el préstamo que le otorguen va invertirlo en capital de trabajo para fortalecer los dos tramos que tiene y así obtener mejores ganancias y sastifacer a sus clientes. Todo su trabajo está dedicado a obtener suficientes ingresos para poder darle la educación a su pequño hijo y que éste pueda ser un hombre de bien, también le gustaría comprarse un vehículo para hacer más fácil el movimiento entre su trabajo y su casa.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to strengthen her market activities

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Maria Isabel is 62 years old, married, has two children (ages 20 and 35) and lives with her husband. Her husband works as a mover. Maria Isabel has owned a restaurant for the past five years. At first, they had a hard time finding a good place to set shop. The loan they request is to purchase grains and remodel the shop. They want to make the place look as a more permanent place and be able to tend to her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, KIVA volunteer.

Doña Maria Isabel tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos de 20 y 35 años de edad, que ya son independientes y ya no viven con ella, solamente habita en su vivienda ubicada en el barrio Arlen Siu junto a su esposo. Su esposo trabaja en una camioneta de acarreo. Doña Maria Isabel tiene una comidería desde hace cinco años, una sus dificultades al comenzar fue encontrar un local apropiado para su comidería. El préstamo es para comprar granos básicos y remodelar el local, ya que quiere establecerse y acondicionarlo mejor de lo que está para poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains for her business and also to remodel her shop

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia is 28 years old, and she lives in the North Waspan neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is married and has a four-year-old son. Her husband works a machine operator in the duty-free area and together they are getting their family ahead.

Adilia has a business selling cosmetics, which she sells on credit to her customers. She has four years of experience, and got started using microfinance loans. Through these loans, she has come out ahead and has been able to keep up. This loan is needed to provide her work with cash, which she will use to diversify her inventory, broaden her credit, and satisfy her customers. Later on, she hopes to do some home improvement projects to make it more comfortable for them to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Adilia tiene 28 años de edad,habita en el barrio Waspan Norte de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como operario de maquina en una Zona Franca, y juntos sacana adelante a la familia. Adilia tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, los cuales los vende al crédito entre sus clientes y tiene cuatro años de experiencia, ella comenzó con prestamos a Microfinancieras y es por medio de estos préstamos como ha salido salido adelante y ha podido mantenerlo, el préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y diversificar el inventario para ampliar sus créditos y sastifacer a sus clientes. Más adelante desea hacerles mejoras a sus casa, para que tenga más comodidad para habitar.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to expand her inventory and earnings

loans.name: Indalecia's Group

texts.es:
Teodosia, Candelaria and Indalecia are partners from the communal bank "Renacer."

Teodosia is a 57-year-old widow with one daughter. She runs a general store out of her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She also sells meals in the evenings.

Candelaria is married, 52 years old, and has four children. She runs an Internet cafe, and also provides photocopy services and sells cookies. In the afternoon, she sells pan-fried sausage and potatoes (salchipapas) in the doorway of her home.

Indalicea is 63 years old and married, and has 11 children. Indalicia devotes herself to growing alfalfa in the lands around Ñahuimpuquio.

Teodosia, Candelaria and Indalicea need loans for $1100 total (1000 soles each), money which will be invested in purchasing rice, noodles, oil, soap, paper, soda, and cookies.

The women dream of stocking their businesses, improving their homes, and of their children growing up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Teodosia, candelaria e Indalecia son socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Teodosia es viuda, tiene 57 años y 1 hija, Teodosia tiene una bodega en su casa donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carme, además Teodosia venD. comida por las noches.

Por otro lado Candelaria es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Candelaria tiene cabinas D. Internet, además hace servicio D. fotocopiado y venD. golosinas. También por las tardes venD. salchipapas en la puerta D. su casa.

Mientras que Indalicea es casada, tiene 63 años y 11 hijos, Indalicia se dedica a las agricultura D. alfalfa en sus terrenos D. Ñahuimpuquio.

Teodosia, candelaria e Indalicea necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, fideos, aceite, jabón, papeles, gaseosas, galletas.

Los sueños D. Teodosia, candelaria e Indalicea son surtir su negocio, hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchasing assorted goods to stock and supply their various businesses, including a general store, food services, a farm, and a photocopy provider.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet belongs to the “Renacer” Comunal Bank.

Yanet is a single mother, she is 24 years old, and has a very young daughter. She studied for a technical degree in computation. Yanet sells soft drinks of different brands and sizes at her father’s restaurant, which has at its specialty barbequed chicken.

Yanet needs a loan of 1500.00 soles, which she will invest in buying a variety of soft drinks. Part of the loan will be for making improvements to her house.

Yanet’s dreams are to expand her business and to provide the best for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Renacer.

Yanet es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hija muy pequeña, estudió una carrera técnica de computación, Yanet se dedica a la venta de gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, las ventas lo realiza en el restaurante de su papa que tiene como especialidad los Pollos a la Braza.

Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas variadas y parte del préstamo será para hacer mejoras en su casa.

Los sueños de Yanet son ampliar su negocio y brindar lo mejor a su hija.

loans.use: She will use her loan of 1,500.00 soles to buy a variety of soft drinks and also to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia is 47 years old and is a single woman living in the region of Barrio La Primavera. She has 2 children aged 20 and 28 years of age but they are now financially independent from her. Ana Patricia has been running her eatery for the last 5 years, and they have been difficult because she has had to learn the best ways to run her business.

Ana's life has been very difficult because she had to take care of her children alone, but she now tries to support them and their kids with an education, to be able to proivde her grandchildren with something that she couldn't to her own children. The loan she is requesting is to purchase ingredients for hte production of her foods, because she would like to expand her production of food to earn a greater income. She will use her improved earnings to renovate her eatery so that it can sit more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ana Patricia tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el Barrio La Primavera, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 28 años de edad, que ya son independientes a ella. Doña Ana Patricia tiene una comideria desde hace cinco años, los cuales han sido difíciles por que ha tenido que aprender la manera de encontrar la mejor manera para administrar el negocio. La vida de Doña Ana ha sido muy dura porque le tocó sacar adelante sola a sus dos hijos, pero ahora trata de apoyarles a sus hijos en la educación de sus nietos, para poder otorgarle lo que no pudo darles a sus hijos. El préstamo lo requiere para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, porque ahora quiere ampliar la producción de comida para generar más ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar la infarestructura del local para atender a más clientes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the elaboration of her food products.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes lives in the region of Loma de Guadalupe, is married and is 54 years old. She has four children aged 10, 20, 24 and 26 years of age, three of whom are married and are independent. Only the youngest one is still in her care. She has been running her eatery for four years.

One of her many worries is the poor shape that her shop is in. With the loan she will remodel the dining area to provide greater comfort and a healthy place to be for her clients. When looking towards the future she seeks to expand her business and include a small cafe, and she wishes to improve her living quarters and help her son in his professional development.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mercedes habita en el barrio Loma de Guadalupe, es casada y tiene 54 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 20,24 y 26 años de edad, tres de ellos ya están casados e independientes, solo tiene al menor a su cargo. Su trabajo es una comideria y tiene cuatro años de experiencia. Entre sus dificultades está el local que está en malas condiciones, con el préstamo va a acondicionar la infraestructura de su comedor para dar mas comodidad a sus clientes en un ambiente saludable. A futuro es ampliarlo más y convertirlo en un cafetín, mejorar su vivienda y en la formación profesional de su hijo.

loans.use: To remodel her store

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Nolvia is 37 years old, is married and has one son aged 17 years. She lives in the region of Waspan Norte in the city of Managua. Her husband works as an officer in a company and he covers the household expenses. Nolvia is a designer and the loan she is requesting is to install ceramic tiling in her home as a remodelling project to improve their way of life. The family's plans are to continue improving and remodelling their home to obtain a dignified place to live and help with the professional education for their son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad. Habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, de la ciudad de Managua. Su esposo trabaja como fiscal en una empresa y aporta a los gastos del hogar, Nolvia es diseñadora y el préstamo lo quiere para poner cerámica y mejorar su vivienda y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Los planes de la familia es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda para lograr obtener un hogar digno y ayudar en la educación de su hijo para formarlos como profesionales.

loans.use: To install ceramic tiles in her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Teresa Quiasse

texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old and originally from Magude, in the Maputo Province. She is married and has 5 children. Her two oldest children live in Swaziland with their father and are attending university and the three smaller children live with her and go to school in Boane. Teresa studied until 5th grade and stopped due to her family’s difficult financial situation. She moved with her family to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, a long time ago. Teresa has had a small stand in front of her house since 1983, at which she sells ice creams, soft drinks and basic needs products.

As her stand's business is quite unstable, she decided to start rearing chickens 3 years ago and has been successful so far. Teresa built a quite large henhouse in her backyard, where she now raises 1,000 chicks at a time. She buys the chicks and chicken feed in Maputo and pays someone to bring them to her house. After a 30-day maturity period Teresa sells each chicken for MTn 85. Clients normally go to her henhouse directly to buy chickens, but she sometimes transports them to the village center as well. Teresa counts on the help of her older daughter to run the stand, and they make between MTn 500 to MTn 1,000 per day. Teresa’s husband is a policeman and also helps with the house’s expenses and with the children’s school fees.

This will be Teresa’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use the MTn 20,000 to buy chickens, chicken feed and vaccines in large quantity to stock. She heard about Hluvuku and decided to ask for this loan, as she wants to improve her business. In future Teresa would like to build a new general store to sell food and other products.

loans.use: Buy chicks, and also food and vaccines to stock

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 47 years old and originally from Mozambique's capital city, Maputo. Alfredo is married with 3 children, who all live and study in Xai-Xai, in the Gaza Province. On top of supporting his wife and children, Alfredo helps his mother, in-laws and also a few other members of the family.

Alfredo completed secondary school and has been a teacher since 1985. He currently teaches at the Instituto Pedagogico of Boane daily from 7:00am to 10:30pm and earns a monthly salary of MTn 5,000. His salary will be increased by 11% next month due to the government's annual salary adjustment. Alfredo is an endless learner and dreams of attaining a master degree one day. He is currently in his second year at the University of Maputo, pursuing a Biology degree. Alfredo studies from 12:30pm to 5:20pm daily and takes a public transport of 40min to Maputo (30Km away from Boane). Alfredo explained that the university fees are dependent on the person’s capacity to pay and profession. With Alfredo’s base salary and teacher’s diploma he pays only MTn 100 per subject at university. This semester Alfredo is taking 5 different subjects.

As the government provides housing for teachers, Alfredo has always lived in the school at which he teaches. He has been living at the Instituto for more than 10 years now. Alfredo’s dream is to build his own house and provide comfort for his family. He is almost there. With this first loan of MTn 18,500 Alfredo will buy aluminum-roofing, cement to finish the floor and install some missing windows. Alfredo estimates that one or two more loans will be necessary to finish the house and move in. He heard about Hluvuku during a conversation with some colleagues who advised him to approach the institution after hearing him complain about the slow progress of his house’s construction.

In the future Alfredo would like to build a small henhouse in his backyard where he will be able to raise chickens and have a steady business, already planning for retirement when the day comes.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Preselina Pedro

texts.en:
Preselina is 31 years old and originally from Maputo, Mozambique's capital city. She is married and has 2 children: an 11-year-old girl and an 8-year-old boy, both of whom attend school.

Preselina completed primary school and stopped studying to take care of her home and newly born daughter. She worked for many years selling items such as firewood, used clothes and basic needs products in her house and by the road. Two years ago, Preselina was hired by a local company producing chicken meat. The company has 14 large henhouses, each with 10,000 chicks. Preselina is responsible for one henhouse, feeding the chickens and making sure they are ready within 30 days. Preselina works from 7:00am to 4:00pm and earns a monthly salary of MTn 1,645 (around US$67). Her husband works as a policeman and also helps with the household expenses.

Preselina lives in her own house with her family. She is quite happy with the house, as it has water and energy supplies, is close to the road that connects to Maputo and to a local school. However, it is still too small and missing some important parts such as a bathroom.

That is why Preselina decided to ask for her first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. Preselina intends to use the MTn 10,000 to buy construction material such as cement, bricks and sand and hopefully build a new bedroom and the dreamed-of bathroom. Preselina has taken out previous loans with Tchuma, another local microfinance institution that provides group loans. However, she prefers Hluvuku because she can ask for a higher individual loan. In the future Preselina would like to find a job with a higher salary and also to build a small shop in front of her house where she would be able to sell small products working from home. [The picture shows Preselina with her daughter Francisca.]

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Abcd

texts.en: vkkfmf

loans.use: jfjfdjgj

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old and originally from the Inhambane Province. Carlos is married and has 3 children: the oldest, a daughter aged 17, lives with her mother while the 2 youngest (7-year-old and 5-year-old) live with Carlos and attend school. Carlos studied until 7th grade. He was approved at a professional school to become a teacher but wasn’t able to attend due to his father’s difficult financial situation. I

In 1993 Carlos started work as a barman at a hotel in Matola, in the Maputo Province. After 4 years he left as he wasn’t able to survive on his monthly salary of MTn 590 (around US$24). Therefore, Carlos started his own business selling used clothes and shoes and then switching to construction material. Today Carlos has a small store in Matola where he sells cement and also rents a store in Boane where he sells cement and roof joists.

Carlos buys the merchandize in the capital city of Maputo (20Km away from Matola and 30Km away from Boane). Cement costs MTn 220 and roof joists MTn 150 -- Carlos sells them for MTn 230 and MTn 200, respectively. Even though roof joists have higher profit margins, Carlos also sells cement beucase it is a faster and guaranteed business, as there is high demand for it. Carlos sells around 150 roof joists per month at the store in Boane’s, but sometimes finds it difficult to retain long term customers.

This will be Carlos’ first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. During a conversation with a couple of friends he mentioned the lack of working capital to buy inventory and they directed him to Hluvuku. His loan of MTn 14,500 will be used to buy cement and wood in bulk, potentially at a discount. Carlos hopes to increase sales and attract more loyal clients. In the future Carlos would like to build a house in Inhambane. He already has a house in Matola, but would like to have a house in Inhumbane to be close to his family.

loans.use: Increase inventory (buy cement and roof joist)

loans.name: Francisco Jorge

texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and originally from Beira, in the Sofala Province. Francisco is married and has 5 children. All children are currently attending school.

In 1971, Francisco moved to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, with his family. He studied until 8th grade and stopped because of financial and transportation difficulties. The secondary school was located in Maputo and public buses or mini-buses were almost inexistent and very expensive. Francisco started to work with his father, a goldsmith. Francisco and his father used to buy raw materials in Maputo, but with the Mozambican civil war, they started buying in the north of the country instead, which increased their production costs.

Today Francisco has a small store in Boane where he sells his jewellery as well as clothes. Francisco makes earrings, rings and necklace with red gold, the local available raw material. Francisco buys the gold in Maputo at MTn 600 per gram. Earrings are his most popular products and are sold for MTn 250 to MTn 2,500. Francisco’s wife works at the store and they make between MTn 3,000 to MTn 6,000 per day. The other products that Francisco sells he buys in Maputo 3 times per week, going with public transportation.

This will be Francisco’s third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The first MTn 10,000 was used to buy raw materials to work as a goldsmith. The second loan of MTn 30,000 was used to start a wood business that didn’t work out. Francisco planned to buy wood in the north of the country and sell in Maputo, but as he was new to the business he didn’t forecast all the difficulties and failed. This third loan of MTn 12,000 will again be used to buy raw material (mainly gold), so that Francisco can produce many products to sell. He would like to increase his store’s inventory to attract more clients and increase his monthly income.

In the future Francisco would like to have a gold manufacturing company, producing earrings and rings in large quantities and selling to all jewellers in Maputo.

loans.use: Buy raw material to work as a goldsmith

loans.name: Vicente Zacarias

texts.en:
Vicente is 23 years old and originally from the Gaza Province. He is single and has no children. In 1991, Vicente and his family moved to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, because of the Mozambican civil war. In 1999 Vicente lost his parents in an accident and has ever since supported his 3 sisters. He lives in his late father’s house and supports his 2 younger sisters who are still in school. His older sister already works, but barely makes her own living.

Vicente studied until 10th grade and then did a professional course of 2 years to become a teacher. Since 2004 Vicente has been working as a teacher, currently teaching Portuguese and music to 6th and 7th graders. Vicente works from 12:00pm to 17:20pm and earns a monthly salary of MTn 4,500. The government adjusts the salary every year, and this time it will be increased by 11%.

This will be Vicente’s third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The first loan of MTn 5,500, in May 2007, was used to install energy in his house and pay the initial contract with the state-owned energy company. The second MTn 4,000 was used to help him pay for his graduation from the professional course to become a teacher. This time Vicente plans to use the MTN 11,500 to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, to repair his house.

Before he took the first loan he approached a few other institutions such as the local bank, but preferred Hluvuku because it offered the flexibility to pay as much as he could each month, and over a longer period. Vicente is very grateful for Hluvuku’s loans, as he has really felt a positive impact on his life after the loans.

In the future Vicente would like to go to university. He tried to enter this year, but was not accepted after sitting for the entrance annual exam. He will try again next year, as he dreams of studying psychology. Vicente would like to structure his life before forming a family, so that he can provide better for his children than his parents were able to provide.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo is 62 years old and married with 2 children and 7 grandchildren. He studied until 4th grade and then stopped due to his family’s difficult financial situation. Originally from the Inhambane province in Mozambique, he moved in 1973 to Boane, 30km away from the capital city Maputo, to look for work and stayed thereafter. During the Mozambican civil war, Arnaldo’s whole family moved from Inhambane to Maputo to stay with him, as it was safer to be closer to the capital. His oldest son also lives in Boane while the youngest lives in Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland.

In 1985, Arnaldo built a barbershop while he soon expanded to incorporate a hair salon. The shop is strategically located in Boane’s central market street, in the corner with the road that connects to Maputo, so it has always benefited from a good number of walk-in clients. Arnaldo and 1 employee work at the barbershop and his daughter-in-law and another employee work at the hair salon. Arnaldo sees around 15 clients at the barbershop and 20 clients at the hair salon per week. A man’s haircut is MTn 15 (approximately US$0.61). Arnaldo goes to Maputo every week to buy all the products necessary for his business, using public transportation. Arnaldo makes around MTn 1,500 per week.

This will be Arnaldo’s second loan with Hluvuku. The first loan he used to buy products for his businesses and also buy a television and an iron. This time Arnaldo plans to use the MTn 18,000 loan to buy products for his business, such as shampoos, conditioners, sprays and so on, as well as replace some materials that have become worn with use, such as hairdryers and scissors.

In the future, Arnaldo would like to ask for a new loan to repair his house and the barbershop.

loans.use: Buy products for his barbershop-hair salon

loans.name: Aurelia Florinda

texts.es:
Aurelia is a member of the “Renacer” Comunal Bank.

Aurelia is married, she is 48 years old and she has 7 children. She sells sausage with french fries as a street vendor in the Grau market. Aurelia also has a business selling cooked chicken from her home, which is administered by her husband and children, which they have been doing for 2 years.

Aurelia needs a loan of 2500 soles, which will be invested in buying sodas and chicken, and also in improving her chicken business.

Aurelia’s dreams are to improve her businesses and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Aurelia es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia venD. salchipollos D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Grau. Además Aurelia tiene una pollería en su casa que esta administrado por su esposo e hijos, activYdad que inicio hace 2 años.

Aurelia necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, pollos y mejoras en su pollería.

Los sueños D. Aurelia son mejorar sus negocios y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Aurelia needs a loan of 2500 soles, which will be invested in buying sodas and chicken, and also in improving her chicken business.

loans.name: Justa Sabina

texts.en:
Justa Sabina S. C. owns some land where she raises and sells animals in the town of Mache high in the sierras of La Libertad region. She has pigs, chickens, goats, guinea pigs, and ducks. She usually sells her animals in Trujillo, the capital of the region.

Justa is 55 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her children have moved away so she shares her home and business with her husband. She works long hours so she and her family can move forward in life.

A member of the community bank Mujeres de Mache, Justa is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde is a member of the “Renacer” comunal bank.

Ayde lives with her husband, she is 25 years old, and has one child. Ayde has a small restaurant in a rented space located on the Alalmeda del Cementario boulevard. She sells drinks, food, and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells meals of regional dishes. She and her husband also have a motorcycle taxi, which her husband uses to transport passengers. With the loan money, Ayde plans to buy another motorcycle taxi to rent out.

Ayde needs a loan of 2000 soles, which would be invested as part of the payment for a motorcycle.

Ayde’s dreams are to have a pharmacy shop, to build her house, and to provide a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hayde es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Ayde es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ayde tiene un recreo bar en un local alquilado, ubicado en la alameda del cementerio, vende bebidas, comida y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica. Además junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el que trabaja su esposo haciendo transporte de pasajeros, Ayde con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar otro mototaxi para alquilar.

Ayde necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una mototaxi.

Los sueños de Ayde son tener una botica, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: Ayde needs a loan of 2000 soles. The money will invested as part of the payment for a a new motorcylce, tidy.

loans.name: Alicia Antonia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the community Bank Renacer (Rebirth)

Alicia lives together with her partner, is 20 years old and has a daughter. Alicia has a grain mill in her home where she processes grains, which she buys in the Nery Garcia market, and processes them into flour and other products which she sells wholesale in the Grau market. Additionally, Alicia farms her land in Ocros.

Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD $375), money which will be used to purchase corn, wheat and barley.

Alicia’s dreams are for her child to become a professional, to improve her business and have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Alicia es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija, Alicia tiene un molino de granos en su casa donde procesa cereales, dichos productos los compra en el mercado Nery García y lo transforma en harina y otros productos que vende en el mercado Grau por mayor. Además Alicia se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de Ocros.

Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo, cebada.

Los sueños de Alicia son que su hijo sea profesional, mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD $375), money which will be used to purchase corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is a member of the Renacer Community Bank.

Fortunata is married, 30 years old, and has 2 children. She sells traditional food in the street market of Ayacucho city on Saturdays and Sundays. In addition Fortunata travels to the markets where she purchases grains and cheeses to sell in Ayacucho’s markets. She also has a car that she rents as a taxi.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1750 which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn and lamb.

Fortunata has dreams for her children to grow up to be professionals, to build a house and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Fortunata es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos. Fortunata vende comida en el mercadillo de comidas típicas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los días sábados y domingos. Además Fortunata viaja a las ferias donde compra cereales, quesos y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. También tiene un carro que alquila para hacer transporte de pasajeros.

Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 1750 dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz y carneros.

Los sueños de Fortunata son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, corn and lamb.

loans.name: German Enrique

texts.es:
German Enrique D. is originally from the city of Bluefields. He's married to Lucia Luz Amaya Sarmiento. They have 4 young children. He opened up a little bakery about 3 years ago where he bakes (using outdoor ovens) pastries filled with pineaple and cheese which are native to the area. This business is the only form of income for this family. His clients are the local coffee shops in the area. He currently buys his main ingredients little by little since he doesn't have the income to buy everything in bulk. This is the main reason why he's requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, lard, salt, yeast, charcoal in big quantaties. With these purchases, he hopes to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Germán Enrique D. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casado con la Sra. Lucia Luz Amaya Sarmiento ambos tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, hace 3 años el Sr. D. tiene una pequeña panadería donde su especialidad es hornar de forma artesanal pan dulce relleno de piña y queso, este negocio es el único ingreso de la familia, sus clientes son los cafetines que lo prefieren por ofrecer su producto a domicilio, en estos momentos el Sr. D. compra en pocas cantidades los ingredientes principales de su producto ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar en grandes cantidades, generando poca ganancia para el negocio por esta razón el Sr. D. necesita comprar 4 quintales de harina a $ 46.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal, 1 caja de manteca a $ 36.00 dólares la caja, 1 caja de levadura a $ 43.00 dólares la caja, 1 paca de sal a $ 3.00 dólares la paca y 16 sacos de carbón a $ 3.00 dólares el saco con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, lard, yeast, salt and charcoal

payments.comment: Las ventas del negocio han bajado por esa razon Abono $ 12.04 dólares a su cuota numero  03, comprometiendose a cancelar la cuota numero 03 el dia 01 de septiembre.

loans.name: Sergio José

texts.es:
Mr. Sergio is an accountant and works full time in a company and additionally does other jobs in his free time. Don Sergio is married, has a son of school age for whom he wishes to be able to provide all the education necessary to become a professional. Don Sergio’s wife is a merchant and helps with the maintenance of the home. He is requesting a loan to make improvements to his house. He is going to build a wall in the back part of his house as a security measure for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit. Kiva volunteer.

Don Sergio es Contador, y trabaja en una empresa de forma permanente aunque también hace otros trabajos adicionales en su tiempo libre. Don Sergio es casado y tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, y al que Don Sergio desea poder darle todos los estudios necesarios para que llegue a se un prefesional. La esposa de Don Sergio es comerciante y le ayuda en el mantenimiento del hogar. Solicita el préstamo para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, va a levantar un muro enla parte trasera de su casa, como medida de protección para él y su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall in the back part of his house.

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angel

texts.es:
Yessnia is a young24-year old lady who has a significant other, two children and another one on its way. Her companion is an office receptionist who supports the family's finances. Yessenia is a security guard and works at the local mall. She has been a security guard for two years. The loan she requests is to replace the zinc and wooden planks in her bedroom, this will help improve the lifestyle of her three little kids.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Yessenia es una joven mujer de 24 años, es acompañada y tiene 2 hijos y uno más que viene en camino. Su compañero de vida es oficinista y apoya en los gastos familiares. Yessenia se dedica a la vigilancia y trabaja en un centro comercial de la ciudad, como guarda de seguridad, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este oficio. El préstamo lo solicita para cambair el zinc y unas piezas de madera en su casa de habitación, ya que quiere mejorar la calidad de vida para sus tres pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Change wood and zinc from her home

loans.name: Oscar Francisco

texts.es:
Don Oscar lives in the neighborhood of Casimiro Sotelo. He is 52 years old and is a telecommunications technician. He's focused on this carreer for 11 years. He's a widower and his daughter is currently attending school. His focus at this time is to have enough earnings in order to support his daughter with her education. He also wishes to have his own telecommunications business. He has been improving his home and with this latest loan, hopes to make sturdier wall divisions (they are currently made out of plastic).

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Oscar habita en el Barrio Casimiro Sotelo, con 52 años de edad es técnico en telecomunicaciones y tiene 11 años de estar en este oficio. Es viudo y tiene una hija que se encuentra estudiando. Su fijación en estos momentos es tener suficientes ingresos para apoyar al máximo a su hija en el periodo de educación, aunque también desea llegar algun dia a tener su propio negocio de telecomunicaciones. Ha ido mejorando su casa, y con este préstamo quiere cambiar las divisiones de su casa, las que actualmente son de plástico, y las quiere construir de concreto

loans.use: Make wall dividers to his home

loans.name: Darlyng Jeaneth

texts.es:
Mts. Darlyng is married, is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood Casimiro Sotelo, has three children of 11, 8,and 3 years of age. Her husband works as a security guard and provides the income of the home. Mrs. Darlyng works as a cashier in a restaurant and has three years of experience. She is requesting the loan to improve her home. She would like to build a wall in the front of the house for more security. The goals of her family are to provide for the education and support of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Darlyng es casada, tiene 33 años de edad y habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo, tiene tres hijos con 11,8 y 3 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como vigilante y aporta en la economía del hogar. La sra Darlyng trabaja como cajera en un restaurante y tiene cuatro años de experiencia. El préstamo lo solicita para mejoras de su vivienda quiere construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para mayor seguridad. Los planes de su familia es proveer la educación y economía a sus hijos.

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of the house of residence.

loans.name: Agne Lisseth

texts.es:
Mrs. Agne is 28 years old, lives in the neighborhood of 19th of July, is single and has a daughter in school. She is currently working in a restaurant in the kitchen area. With this loan she would like to change the roof on her house and purchase wooden posts since the ones that are there are infested with termites. Her plans for the future are to provide financially for her family and be able to educate her daughter and give her a decent home

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Agne tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el barrio 19 de julio, es soltera y tiene una hija que esta estudiando. Actualmente ella trabaja en un restaurante en el área de producción, y con este préstamo que está solicitando lo desea para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y comprar también pilares de madera ya que los que tienen están ya con polillas. Los planes que tiene a futuro es ayudar en la economía de su familia y poder darle una educación a su hija y una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Change the pillars and roof of her place of residence.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
At her own shop in Managua's "municipio" of Ciudad Sandino, Maribel earns a living selling clothes in all shapes and sizes, for both men and women. She also sells cosmetics but in smaller quantities. She's a strong lady who started the business five years ago to fulfill her dream of improving her life and the lives of her young children.

Now, very wisely, Maribel has approached Ceprodel to get a loan with which she'll be able to buy merchandise from her suppliers. It's important to emphasize that the loan will benefit her children as much as it will benefit Maribel. Her credit record includes 4 loans with the institution, paid on time and in accordance with the loan agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Maribel Z. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo tamaño y para ambos sexos teniendo su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes. También vende productos cosméticos pero en menores cantidades. Es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace cinco años que inició el negocio, lo ha venido surtiendo para cumplir su sueño de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual poder comprar la mercadería a sus proveedores. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus pequeños. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa A. is a lady that makes living selling clothes which she does in her own stall at the municipal market of the City Sandino in Managua.

She started her business with little capital counting on her 3,000 cordobas (USD$ 157) from her savings and loans obtained from lenders. As time has passed, she has been able to stock her business with the support of the loans from Ceprodel, which she has used to buy merchandise and grow her business. Currently she needs to buy articles of clothing such as pants, shirts, etc. For this reason she hopes that her loan will be granted and she can continue her business of selling clothing and continue to improve the support of her home and enable her four children to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Candida Rosa A. es una dama que se dedica a la labor de venta de ropa que comercializa en su propio tramo en el mercado del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Inició su negocio con poco capital contando con C$ 3,000 (Tres mil córdobas) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios y préstamos realizados a prestamistas. A medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado surtir su negocio apoyándose de los créditos recibidos por CEPRODEL el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de la mercadería y ampliación del negocio. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de la ropa como pantalones, camisas, etc. Por esta razón es que espera en que su crédito le será otorgado para así continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación y así sus cuatro hijos puedan continuar estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: Faalogoifo S., 42, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the retail shop business. Her retail shop maintains a week's stock of  common needs of the village like rice, tinned meat, tinned fish, sugar, flour, salt, lollies, etc. She sells to the local villagers and passers-by 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 220 Tala (about $US91).  SPBD loans are Faalogoifo’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her children's education fees.

loans.use: Purchase resupply of stock for the shop

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en:
Sialei U., 45, is married with 5 children. She has no prior experience in growing and selling taro as a business, but she is an experienced farmer who sells to the villagers 2 days per week.

Sislei has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Sialei’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Because this is her first loan, all the money will be put towards starting her taro plantation business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, chemicals, and weed killer.

loans.name: Fetoai

texts.en:
Fetoai S., 33, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the taro plantation business and she sells to the villagers 2 days per week.

Fetoai has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She now expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $US100). SPBD loans are Fetoai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to purchase equipment and materials (cement, roofing materials, etc) to improve her home.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, chemicals and weed killer

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia F., 50, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the retail shop and plantation businesses. Lusia splits her time between her two businesses. She works part-time with the plantation, but the majority of the time at her retail shop, where she sells to the villagers 6 days per week.

Lusia has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 340 Tala (about $US141). SPBD loans are Lusia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the shop and chemicals and pesticides for the taro plantation.

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en:
Logotaeao K., 47, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience selling taro to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She will use part of her loan for her children's educational needs. Her husband is unemployed but is helping out with the business, including the farming.

Logotaeao has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and more taro tops.

loans.name: Taulaai

texts.en:
Taulaai F., 41, is married with 6 children. She has 4 years of experience selling taro and bananas to the general public in the main market 5 days per week. She will use the loan for her farm and will also purchase her children's sportswear for school. Her husband is her right hand in her business, supporting her and their children.

Taulaai has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to now be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Taulaai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase more taro tops, a crowbar, wheelbarrow and pesticides

loans.name: Taikerise Finau

texts.en:
Taikerise Finau U., 36, is divorced with 2 sons. Her husband left her when her youngest son was only 3 months old, and she has since taken care of both her children and her extended family. She has 3 years of experience selling taro and bananas to the villagers 5 days per week.

Taikerise has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to now be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Taikerise’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan for her taro/banana sales and will also purchase ingredients to start an ice cake business to support her weekly repayments during deficit times.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer and pesticides

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele P., 45, is married with 5 children. She has 4 years of experience in the Bingo business. She sells games to the villagers 5 days per week. Her husband is unemployed but does fishing to support the family.

Pele has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $US250). SPBD loans are Pele’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The entire loan will be used for her business.
