loans.use: To purchase prizes such as washing powder, soaps, milk, mosquito coils, and noodles.

loans.name: Faranisisi

texts.en:
Faranisisi N., 38, is married with 5 children. She has 4 years of experience in the barbeque business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Faranisisi has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to now be 350 Tala (about $US145). SPBD loans are Faranisisi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase iron roofing, timber, and nails to build a shelter for her business.

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata V., 44, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 2 days per week. Pamata will use the loan to buy weed killer, barbed wire, nails, a sack of fertilizer, and bush knives for farming and transportation fares for selling. Her husband is a musician who earns the only other income of the family. He will help in the operation of the plantation when he is available.

Pamata has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $US62). SPBD loans are Pamata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies and transportation fares

loans.name: Litiana

texts.en:
Litiana F., 30, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the barbeque business. She sells to the public 3 days per week. Her loan will be utilized for her children's school fees, to purchase cases of chicken thighs, sausages, lamp chops, taro, and bananas for her business, and carpet for home improvement.

Litiana has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $US83). SPBD loans are Litiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase barbeque ingredients

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana T., 45, is married with 7 children. She has 4 years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week. She will use her loan to purchase a back sprayer and transportation fares for her business and items for home improvement, including a toilet set(bowl), cement, nails, and sand.

Ioana has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $US62). SPBD loans are Ioana’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in a taro business and home improvements

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana L., 21, is married and has no children. She has 4 years of experience in the business of selling fresh fish. She sells to the villagers 2 days per week. Her husband is currently operating the business. The loan is needed to purchase a canoe, fishing boots, fishing nets, and fares (transportation).

Mariana has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $US83). SPBD loans are Mariana’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To replace aging equipment for a fishing business.

loans.name: Talaave

texts.en:
Talaave T., 28, is married with one child. She has many years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. Her husband earns about $150 per week but he sometimes helps with her business. Talaave will use this loan to purchase timber, a sink set, and two-inch pipe for home repairs and chemicals and fertilizer to improve her taro plantation.

Talaave has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Talaave’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: For farm and home improvements

loans.name: Vaai

texts.en:
Vaai U., 39, is married with 2 children.  She has 4 years of experience in selling traditional necklaces, earrings, and fans.  She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. Vaai will use this loan to expand her alternative business--a taro plantation--and to make home improvements. She plans to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, timber, sand, and cement.
Vaai has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $US83).  SPBD loans are Vaai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: For home and farm improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restart a small business cooking fried foods

loans.name: Toshpi

texts.en:
D. Toshpi is 47 years old and married with one son. For more than 10 years Toshpi has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, apples, strawberries, and raspberries. Her son helps with the business. She begins her workday very early, buying produce from the local farmers and then selling it in the market. Her attractive prices and friendly nature have allowed Toshpi’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

It is now the selling season and she is planning to purchase a wider variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. Toshpi is therefore requesting a $450 loan for the term of 4 months. She and her family are counting on your help, and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To Increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.en:
I. Oiniso is 43 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur, and they are raising their children with love and trying to ensure they have everything that teenagers may need. For 10 years in Tajikistan’s local markets, Oiniso has been selling fabrics for the national dresses which are very popular and very important items in the dowry of any girl.  Being very polite with the clients and having good taste, she has many customers. All fabrics are supplied from the neighboring city of Dushanbe. 
In order to better satisfy her customers’ varied requirements, Oiniso is trying to increase her range of goods. Therefore she requests a $200 loan to purchase a new stock of fabrics. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months, and your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Hudoer

texts.en:
I. Hudoer, 43 years old and married with four children, has been operating a taxi service for the past nine years. While the hours are very long, this successful business generates a stable income, enabling Hudoer to support his own large family as well as his mother and father.

In order to provide higher quality services in the future, he is now planning to fix his car . Hudoer therefore requests $600 for the term of 7 months to purchase spare parts. He thanks all for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car

loans.name: Tiloga

texts.en:
Tiloga S., 29, is married with 3 children. She has 4 years of experience selling taro chips. She sells to the villagers and school children 5 days per week. Her loan will be used to improve her taro plantation and chip business and to improve her house.

Tiloga has had 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $US 208). SPBD loans are Tiloga’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very pleased with the SPBD programme and is a long-time loyal member.

loans.use: To improve a taro chips business

loans.name: Karasoch

texts.en:
B. Karasoch, 48 years old and the loving mother of three adult sons, is married to a businessman. In order to increase their family income, for the last two years Karasoch has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, apples, and strawberries in the local market. Her elder son helps her with the business. Karasoch’s workday begins at 5:00 a.m. as she buys produce from the local farmers to sell in the market, where she is known for her attractive prices and friendly disposition. This has enabled Karasoch’s business to develop and generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Now is the season when her goods are in great demand, so she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose she requests $200 for the term of 6 months. Karasoch and her hopeful son are counting on your help, and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To Increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en:
Solialofi S., 37, is married with 5 children. She has 2 years of experience in the taro plantation business. Her husband grows the taro and Solialofi sells it to the villagers and the public at the main market 2 days per week.

Solialofi has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $US 250). SPBD loans are Solialofi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to maintain her plantation

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en:
Mesepa S., 48, is married with 3 children. She has recently started a business selling pancakes to schoolchildren 5 days per week. She plans to expand her business to sell to the villagers on weekends.

This is Mesepa's first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $US 250). SPBD loans are Mesepa’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, pans and other equipment to start her business

loans.name: Salatu

texts.en:
Salatu U., 48, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. She will use part of her loan to assist with her children's school needs. The rest of her loan will be used to buy chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, and a shovel to support her business. Her husband has been fully engaged with the project. He is one of the village high talking chiefs who consider this programme to be of vital importance in the community.

Salatu has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $US 125). SPBD loans are Salatu’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a taro plantation.

loans.name: Holbegim

texts.en:
The loving mother of two adult sons, H. Holbegim is 57 years old and married to a taxi driver. In order to increase the family income, for the last three years Holbegim has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apricots, apples, and strawberries in the local market. Holbegim’s workday begins at 5:00 a.m. when she buys produce from the local farmers in order to sell it in the market. Her elder son helps her with the business.

Now Holbegim is planning to pay for the higher education expenses of her younger son and to arrange the marriage of her elder son. For this reason she is planning to purchase an increased range of fresh fruits and vegetables to sell, as now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. For this purpose she requests a $500 loan for a 6 month term. Your support will really help Holbegim and her sons..

loans.use: To increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
T. Jumagul, a 45-year-old widowed market vendor living with her parents, is the mother of a marvelous daughter who helps Jumagul sell a variety of vegetables and fruits including tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apricots, apples, and strawberries. Buying produce from the local farmers early every morning, she then sells it in the local market.

She works very hard to give her dearest daughter a good education and make her happy; to cover the educational expenses as her daughter enters university, Jumagul is planning to increase her working capital. In order to expand the range of produce she sells, she is requesting a $500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months. Jumagul and her daughter are counting on your help and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Zebi is a 32 year old woman, she is married and has 3 children. Her husband repairs apartments. After finishing high school Zebi has had a business selling vegetables, including potatoes, carrots, onions and beets. She has already taken out one loan and repaid it without being late and understanding that she can properly use a loan she would like to increase her loan to 1000 somoni in order to increase her inventory. After her first loan her business grew, as did her inventory turns and profits and she is very grateful to investors and especially to KIVA for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зеби женщина в возросте 32 года, замужем имеет 3 детей, муж работает мастером по ремонту квартир.Шарифова Зеби после окончания средней школы занимается бизнесом по продаже овощных продуктов,картофель, морковь, лук, свекла .Шарифова Зеби уже прошла 1 степ без просрочек, поняв что смогла правильно использовать займ она хочет увеличить второй займ на 1000 сомони для увеличения товара.После первого займа у нее увеличился бизнес, оборот и прибыль.она очень благодарна инвестора , а особенно KIVA за их поддержку.

loans.use: Purchase Vegetables

loans.name: Abdinazar

texts.en:
H. Abdinazar is 64 years old, married, and has five children and several wonderful grandchildren. Abdinazar is a farmer who, aided by his youngest son, grows various crops including wheat, onions, potatoes and maize. As well, he raises cattle. Although now of retirement age, he has no interest in withdrawing from work, as he can’t imagine his life without that work.

Abdinazar is now requesting $800 for the term of 7 months in order to purchase input materials such as seeds and mineral fertilizer as well as calves in order to increase his number of cattle. After gathering his harvest he wants to sell it to the local inhabitants at prices lower than those in the market. Abdinazar promises to be diligent in repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Dr. Joseph O. is the 51-year-old proprietor of Joe Medical Clinic in Bungoma, Kenya. He is married and lives with his wife and eight children. His wife is employed as a nurse at Bungoma District Hospital. After completing his training he was posted to Nyanza Provincial Hospital where he worked for three years before venturing into private practice. His clinic, located along the Kakamega-Bungoma road, serves more than 100 clients a day. To cope with increased clientele, Dr. O. has employed four nurses to help him in the clinic. He offers a wide range of services including family planning, curative and preventive treatment, a laboratory and a pharmacy. He attributes his success to support from the KIVA/KMET partnership. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers and improve the quality of reproductive health services. To further expand his facility, he requires $1,200.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand the clinic

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Djamshed M. is a 30 year old man, he is married and has 3 children. His wife sells fruits at the market. Djamshed works as a driver for the public transport firm – Gazel. After the cold winter he would like to make major repairs to his car. He needs 3000 somoni in order to do this. This is why he decided to turn to MicroInvest. Djamshed thinks that the loan makes good sense for him. In addition to his job Djamshed raises and fattens livestock which provides him with a good additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Муминов Джамшед мужчина в возросте 30 лет женат имеет 3 детей,жена занимается реализацией фруктов на рынке.Сам Джамшед работает водителем общественного транспорта Газель. После холодной зимы он хочет провести капитальный ремонт своей машины.Для этого ему необходимо 3000 сомони .Поэтому он решил обратится в Микроинвест. Джамшет считает что кредит отремонтировать ему выгодней.Паралельно со своей работой он занимается откормом и уходом за скотом, с чего имеет дополнительный хороший доход.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.en:
A. Hurmat is a 45-year-old widow living with her parents. As a local market vendor, Hurmat, assisted by her sister, sells a variety of clothes for children and trousers for teenagers. The business is stable, allowing her to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. A friendly and polite woman who has been operating this enterprise for more than 11 years, she is now trying to diversify her range of goods so as to satisfy the needs of clients with various levels of income. Specifically, Hurmat is planning to increase her stock of summer clothes for children. For this purpose she requests $600 for the term of 3 months.

Hurmat thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner as she has with her previous loans.

loans.use: To increase the stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Ntinda Kafene Women's Group

texts.en: Joan K. has been selling crafts out of her home in Ntinda for 25 years. She is the chairperson of Ntinda Kafene women’s group that has been together for one and a half years. She is married with five children. She sells her crafts to the local community as well as exporting them. Currently she is deciding between a few possible locations for her new shop. She will supplement the loan with some of her own savings to start up the shop. She is grateful for you support.

loans.use: Joan Kasinje plans to open up a retail shop to sell sugar, salt, soap and bread.

loans.name: Abdukohir

texts.en: K. Abdukohir is 26 years old and lives in Chkalovsk, where he is engaged in food selling. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006, and the success of his business has enabled him to both repay his loans and expand his business to include not only milk products but also a variety of meats including sausages, salami, and meat rolls.  K. Abdukohir has many customers and is able to offer prices lower than those in the bazaar.  He is now applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1200 for 10 months. He wants to expand his trade and  purchase one more refrigerator.

loans.use: To enlarge his trade and to purchase one more refrigerator.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mr Vin C. and his wife were married in 1978. They have seven children; three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other four children, one is a mason and the other three are in school. His wife, Mrs Yai Chea has been a fish seller for 11 years. She buys fish from fishermen for resale in her village and nearby village. The family lives across the Mekong River about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr Vin has been a mechanic for 24 years. He does his work in the village. He is requesting a loan of US$400 to pay for repairing his house.

loans.use: To pay for repairing his house.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: D. Farogat first became a client of MicroInvest in 2002, and has proven to be a reliable borrower. Living in Khujand, where she is married and has three children, she started her clothing and children’s shoe business from scratch but now has her own trade outlet in the local bazaar. Mrs. D. Farogat is applying to KIVA for a loan  of $775 for 8 months to import the new seasonal wear.

loans.use: To import the new seasonal wear.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mr Han K., 55, and his wife, Mrs Phum Hay, were married in 1981. They have five children, four sons and one daughter. Two of their sons produce and sell Khmer noodles and the youngest son is in school. His wife produces Khmer noodles. The family lives along National Road number five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr Han has been a motor remoque driver for ten years. A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. He carries people from Udong district (Khmer former City) to Phnom Penh City. His motorcycle is very old and he wants to change for a new one, so he is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new motor to replace the old one for driving motor remoque taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for driving motor Remoque taxi.

loans.name: Sa-Em

texts.en:
Mrs Sa-Em Rath, 38, and her husband, Mr Kimchit Chay, 44, have been married for 14 years. They have one son and one daughter, both in school. Beside the children, her mother also lives with the family. Her husband has been a mason since 2005. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Sa-Em has been a weaver since she was 18 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business and some amount for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Miss Chanthy B., 40, is single and lives with her widow mother who is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Chanthy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs Yat P., 47, and her husband, Mr Chanthorn But, 48, were married in 1987 and have two daughters. Both of their daughters are married, one lives outside the family home. Her daughter and her son-in-law are silk weavers. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Yat has been a silk weaver since 1980. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$550 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business and some amount for her daughter’s weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs Tol R. (pictured with her mother and her son), 26, and her husband were married in 2001 and have one son and one daughter. Her daughter is in school. Her husband is in full-time employment in Phnom Penh. She lives with her mother along National Road number 6 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Tol used to work in a garment factory but now she has stopped working and takes care of her little son who is six months. Beside her husband’s salary, she earns a living from renting her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near the garment factory. Doing so, she earns US$60 per month.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$400 to build more rooms for rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms for rent.

loans.name: Chheangmeng

texts.en:
Mr Chheangmeng M. and his wife (pictured together) were married in 1995 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. His wife stays at home to take care of the children. The family lives along National Road number 6 about 15kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr Chheangmeng has been working in a flywood factory located in his village as a lathe operator for 15 years. He has one brother who is a blacksmith in Kampong Cham province about 150km from Phnom Pehn. His brother needs some blacksmith materials to operate his own business and lacks money.

Mr Chheangmeng is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase blacksmith material for his brother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for his brother's business.

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akuélé K. was born August 29, 1960 in Lomé. She is a married mother of three children. In April 2005, she established a dry cleaning business (JEANNA PRESSING) in the Attiégou neighborhood in Lomé. In her store, she also sells telephone cards and has a telephone booth. Mrs. Akuélé K. is a very energetic woman who sells nearly anything that can’t be found elsewhere in the neighborhood. With the first five loans she obtained, she purchased a washing machine and a refrigerator. The loan she is currently requesting will allow her to purchase 25 bags of charcoal, 10 dozen pairs of shoes and 20 bouquets of flowers. Once she sells these items, she will be able to increase her income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Akuélé est née le 29 août 1960 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. En Avril 2005, elle a crée un centre de lavage à sec (JEANNA PRESSING) dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Dans son centre, elle vend également des cartes de recharges et dispose d’une cabine téléphonique. Madame K. Akuélé est une femme très dynamique qui vend presque tout ce qui n’est pas dans son quartier. Avec les cinq premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenu, elle a acquis, une machine à laver, un réfrigérateur. Le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter vingt cinq (25) sacs de charbons de bois, dix (10) douzaines de chaussures et vingt (20) bouquets de fleurs. Ainsi à l’issue de ces ventes elle pourra augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 25 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en: Z. Muyassar lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past three years, she has been engaged in commercial service, trading beef, tongue and offal in the local bazaar.  Now Mrs. Z. Muyassar is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to finance a large-scale importation of beef.

loans.use: To finance a large-scale beef importation from Iran.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru:
Shodigul A. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. She has been growing plants for the past 20 years. She has a piece of land on which she grows wheat and other grain bearing plants. All the members of her big happy family take part in growing the plants from the moment the seeds are planted until the grain is harvested. Right now is the season for planting and she would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдукаримова Шодигул жительница города Яван. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и имеет 6 детей.20 лет занимается растениеводством.Имеет участок земли , на котором сеет пшеницу и другие злаковые культуры. Сейчас сезон посевных , она хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Погаксить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев. У нее очень большая семья и они живут очень дружно и весело. Они все вместе занимаются посадкой и другой работой до получения урожая.

loans.use: Purchase saltpeter and other mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
This time Ni Luh is in her second loan. From the first loan, she already grown her business though still small. She is enthusiastic since DINARI agrees to help again. She hopes that her current Food chips business could expand, so that she could complete the loan in a timely manner like the first loan. Many challenges she is facing nowadays, like price increases in her food chips raw materials, fried oil, etc. She very much hopes to be given help to increase her business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini Ni Luh sudah memasuki pinjaman yang kedua. Dari pinjaman yang pertama, sudah mengalami perkembangan usaha walaupun masih sangat kecil. Dia semakin bersemangat karena DINARI bersedia membantu lagi. Dia berharap, usaha jualan krupuk yang dijalaninya sekarang bisa semakin berkembang, sehingga nantinya kembali bisa melunasi tepat waktu seperti pinjaman pertama. Banyak kendala yang saat ini dia hadapi, seperti naiknya harga bahan pembuat krupuk, minyak goreng dan lain-lain. Dia sangat berharap diberi bantuan untuk menambah modal usaha.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz A., 58, keeps cows and sells milk to the neighbors and local bazaar traders. He started his business in 1992 and has very good experience in raising livestock and making yoghurt for sale. He is going to use the loan to purchase two milch cows at US$ 600 each.

Mubariz and his family live in a settlement for internally displaced people. He is married and has two daughters and two sons. This will help him to increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two milch cows

loans.name: Havasmo

texts.ru:
Havasmo P. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She has been growing plants for the past 8 years. She has a piece of land on which she grows vegetables. She sells the harvested vegetables on the market wholesale. Her children help her with the business, which is the main source of income for the family. Right now is the season for planting and she would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Партовкулова Хавасмо жительница города Яван. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей.8 лет занимается растениеводством.Имеет участок земли на котором сажает овощи .Получаемый урожай продает на рынке, оптом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса вместе со своими детьми. Они помогают ей потому что этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Сейчас сезон посевных , она хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase saltpeter and other mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana M., 35, runs her own business raising cows. She started her business in 1998 and since that time, her main financial resource has been selling milk and yoghurt. As meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan and selling calves could bring her good income, she has expanded her business activity from selling milk to also raising calves.

Tarana is married and lives with her family in a setlement for internally displaced persons in the Bilasuvar region. She and her husband are unemployed and it is very hard for them to cover their family's needs with their low monthly income.

To improve their situation, Tarana has applied for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase one cow at an estimated cost of US$ 600 and two calves at US$ 200 each.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
Ni Ketut S.'s business nowadays are in Cake sales. Daily, she makes cakes, then sells it in Badung market or offers it around. Starting with buying cake ingredients in the morning, afterwards prepares and fries the cake for selling in the evening. Besides selling in Badung market, she also offers and consigns it to her food stall clients. Income is sufficient for daily household needs. She hopes to be given capital loan to expand this cake business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Ni Ketut S. sekarang ini adalah sebagai penjual kue. Sehari-harinya, dia membuat kue lalu menjualnya ke Pasar Badung atau dibawa berkeliling. Dimulai dengan berbelanja bahan membuat kue pada pagi hari, setelah itu dia menyiapkan dan menggoreng kue lalu menjualnya pada sore hari. Selain menjual ke Pasar Badung, dia juga berjalan dan menitipkan di warung-warung yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Penghasilannya cukup untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga sehari-hari. Dia berharap diberi pinjaman modal untuk bisa mengembangkan lagi usaha membuat kue ini.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu G., 52, owns her own business breeding livestock. She started raising livestock in 1983 and since that time she has become very experienced in this field. She and her husband are unemployed and this is their only financial resource for the family. She lives with her family in Bilasuvar in a settlement for internally displaced persons.

Gullu has decided to expand the number of calves she is raising and wants to purchase additional three calves at US$ 400 each. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to purchase three additional calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hikmatoy

texts.ru:
Hikmatoy H. lives in the Bahtar region. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. She is in the business of raising cattle. She would like to obtain credit to purchase building materials. She wants to finish building her house. For this purpose she needs to purchase bricks, shingles, wooden planks and other necessary materials. This way she will be able to provide her 5 children with the space they need. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translate from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Хасанова Хикматой жительница Бохтарского района. Возракст 45 лет , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Не имеет образования. Но занимается животноводством. Хочет получить кредит для покупки стройматериалов. Она хочет достроить свой дом . Ей необходимо купить кирпичи , шифер , доски и другие необходимые вещи.Этим она сможет создать условия для своих 5 детей. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Edi

texts.id:
Edi Suyanto's daily occupation is meatballs sales. He has been in this business for a long time. By offering around he offers his self made meatballs using a wooden push cart . His activities starts in the morning from buying meatballs raw materials like red onions, noodles, vegetables and beef. After processing and cooking he offeres around for sales. However sometimes he also sells at the school nearby. Income from this meatballs sales is temporarily enough to pay for household expenses. He wishes one day to save for his child schooling expenses, who currently lives in Java island.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Edi Suyanto adalah sebagai pedagang bakso. Usaha ini dijalani sudah sejak lama. Dengan berkeliling, setiap harinya dia menjual bakso buatannya menggunakan rombong atau gerobak kayunya. Kegiatannya sehari-hari dimulai dari pagi dengan berbelanja bahan membuat bakso dari pasar terdekat seperti bawang merah, mie, sayur dan daging sapi. Setelah diolah dan matang, pada sore harinya dia berkeliling untuk berjualan. Tetapi terkadang dia juga berjualan di Sekolah Dasar dekat tempat tinggalnya. Penghasilan dari berjualan bakso sementara ini cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dia berkeinginan suatu saat nanti bisa menabung untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya yang saat ini tinggal di Jawa.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Koffi Agouda

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Agouda K. was born April 20, 1984 and is single. His business consists of dying traditional African Bazin cloth. He started this business in 2000 in the Tokoin neighborhood in Lomé. His potential customers include dressmakers and those who resell cloth. He would like to sell his cloth on the international market, and after quickly repaying his first loan, he is requesting this second one to purchase 12 boxes of dye in various colors.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 20 avril 1984, Monsieur K. Koffi Agouda est célibataire. Il a pour activité principale la teinture de pagne bazin. Commencé depuis l’année 2000, il exerce cette activité dans le quartier de Tokoin à Lomé. Il a pour clients potentiels, les revendeuses de pagne et les couturiers. Il désire rendre son activité internationale et sollicite ce 2ème crédit après un prompt remboursement du premier pour acheter douze (12) boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes.

loans.use: Purchase of 12 boxes of dye

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru:
Rahimjon Hakimove lives in the Bohtar region. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a student at a medical university. In order to feed his large family he sells fabric. He would like to receive a loan in order to be able to increase turnover. This will help him attract new clients and obtain additional income. His business also enable the local population to make purchases on location. He plans to repay the loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Хакимов Рахимджон житель Бохтарского района. Женат и имеет 4 детей. Ему 32 года. Учится в медицинском университете, а для того чтобы прокормить свою большую семью занимается торговлей тканями. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и получить дополнительный доход. Кроме того его бизнес поможет населению делать покупки прямо в свей местности. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Alemdar

texts.en:
Alemdar Q., 26, is a very energetic farmer. He keeps calves for breeding and sales. He started his business in 1999. Usually he purchases a calf from the local bazaar and during next 4-6 months he raises it and sells it to the local people in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement.

Alemdar is married, has two sons, and lives with his parents. For so large family, it is not enough to purchase one or two calves and raise them for the next 4-6 months, so Alemdar has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase three calves at US$ 300 each and fodder for the remaining US$ 100.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Sy Mohamed Ousman

texts.fr:
Mr. Sy Mohamed Ousmane S. was born November 24, 1969 in Lomé. He is a married father of three children. He resells staple goods in his store, ETS SY. He started this business in 1989 in the Aguiar neighborhood, near the main market in Lomé. His long-standing presence in the neighborhood and the quality of his service has earned him the trust of his customers. In his store, he also normally sells milk, canned goods and soap, and he has telephone booths available to his customers. This first loan he is requesting will allow him to buy 40 boxes of milk and 20 boxes of canned goods.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Sy Mohamed Ousmane est né le 24 novembre 1969 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est revendeur des produits de premières nécessités dans son magasin ETS SY. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 1989 dans le quartier Aguiar près du grand marché de Lomé. Son ancienneté dans le quartier et la qualité de ses services lui font gagner la confiance de ses clients. Il vend généralement dans son magasin, du lait, des boîtes de conserves, des savons et met également des cabines téléphoniques à la disposition de ses clients. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 40 cartons de lait et 20 cartons de boîte de conserve

loans.use: Purchase of 40 boxes of milk

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal S., 41, is a farmer who has been running his business since 1985 and is very experienced in this field. He is married and has 3 sons, They live in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. Selling milk is their main source of income, but Adigozal also works driving tractors during the harvest season, late summer and autumn.

As dairy sales are their main financial resource, he would like to expand this activity and purchase two more milch cows to raise at an estimated cost of US$ 500 each.

loans.use: to purchase two more milch cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir S. is a 34-year-old trader who owns his own small shop where he sells car spare parts. He runs his shop in the same region where he lives, Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He works as a director in this shop and as salesman as well. Car shops like this are very popular in Azerbaijan and Bashir needs more funds to verify the numbers of equipment he sells. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to verify numbers of equipment he sells

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id:
Yuli A. is a mother of one. She and her husband is now expecting for their 2nd child. They rent a piece of land and buit a semi-permanent house on it.

Yuli is in the business of making and selling cookies. She starts her day at 03.00 am everyday as she has to cook the cookies early in the morning. In the morning she then brings her cookies to the nearby market to be sold in there.

She uses the proceed from her business to help paying her family's daily necessities and also to be saved for the delivery of her 2nd child. She is hoping to be able to expand her business with this loan money.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini klien tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Denpasar bersama suami dan anaknya. Mereka mengontrak tanah dan membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat dan saat ini dia sedang mengandung anak kedua. Usaha yang sedang dijalani oleh Yuli A. saat ini adalah sebagai penjual kue. Ada berbagai macam kue yang dijualnya. Kegiatannya setiap hari adalah mulai jam 03.00 dinihari dia sudah harus bangun untuk membuat kue. Pada pagi harinya dia membawa kue yang sudah dibuatnya ke pasar terdekat. Tempatnya tidak begitu jauh dari rumahnya, cukup dengan berjalan kaki saja. Keuntungan yang didapat selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga rencananya mau ditabung sebagi persiapan buat kelahiran anaknya. Yuli A. sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal sehingga usahanya lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Joshqun

texts.en: Joshqun A. is a 36-year-old farmer who lives with his family in a small southern village of a region called Imishli. He raises cows and then sells them as milch cows and sells those cows that do not bring in enough milk for meat. He started his business in 1995, and since that time it is his only source of income. To expand his business he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1200  to purchase three calves at US$ 400 each.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en: Aflatun A. is a 49-year-old man who keeps calves and cows for dairy and meat sale. He is married and lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Imishli. He started his business in 1984 and at the same time he is a driver. His main financial resource is keeping livestock and to cover family needs, he has decided to purchase more animals. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1200. With this loan he is going to purchase one milch cow for US$ 600 and two calves at US$ 300 each.

loans.use: to purchase one milch cow and two calves

loans.name: Usubeyli

texts.en: Usubeyli Y. is a 55-year-old man who raises livestock in a small southern village of the Imishli region. He started his business in 1980 and at the same time, he is helping his close relative to look after a big livestock farm. Having his own business in the main source of income for his big family, as he has 3 sons and 1 daughter. He dreams of having as big a farm as possible, but to achieve his main goal he needs to work hard and increase the number of animals he raises. For his purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase 3 calves at US$ 300 each and fodder for US$ 100.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim B. is a 60-year-old farmer who has more than 20 years of experience in tending and raising livestock. It is his main source of income. He has four children and  they all live together in a small village in the Saatli region. He needs US$ 1000  to purchase three calves at US$ 300 each and fodder for US$ 100.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Musriah

texts.id:
Musriah and her husband rent a house for IDR 1 million/ year (around USD 125/year). The house has 4 rooms and because she only lives with her husband, she rents out the other 3 rooms to others. She's been living in that house for 10 years. Their 2 children are grown up and married already. They live in their own places.

Musriah sells cookies and traditional snack for living. She sells her cookies and snack at local market and nearby food stalls. She also accepts orders for parties. She is hoping to be able to expand her business with the loan money she is receiving.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Musriah saat ini tingal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan mengontrak rumah dengan sewa Rp.1.000.000 per tahun. Karena saat ini tinggal hanya berdua bersama suaminya,rumah sebesar 4 kamar itu, hanya satu yang ditempati sendiri. Ketiga kamar lainnya disewakan lagi. Sudah 10 tahun klien tinggal dirumah itu. Dua anaknya sudah menikah dan mempunyai keluarga sendiri. Sehari-harinya, Musriah bekerja sebagai penjual kue. Dia biasanya menjual kue buatannya di Pasar terdekat, menitipkan di warung-warung langgananya dan juga menerima pesanan kalau ada pesta atau acara. Usahnya cukup menjanjikan. Karena itu dia berharap diberi bantuan odal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Qarash

texts.en: Qarash S. is a young man of 28 who raises calves for meat production in a small village of the Saatli region. He also works helping build houses, but because people in the region are not building houses often, this work is more random. As a permanent financial resource,  his main goal is to improve his livestock business. To expand it he has applied for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase three calves at US$ 300 each and fodder. As he has seven years of experience in raising calves, he believes this will  bring him permanent income and will help to serve his family needs.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs an agency organizing and planning ball and sport dancing events in Ukraine and other Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) countries. She has two and a half years of experience working in this sphere of business. Presently, she has over $5000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit is over $1200.

Victoria loves her job. She is dreaming about opening dance schools in the nearby city of Drogobych and other towns in her region, offering a good alternative to smoking and drinking which are becoming more and more of a problem with the youth in Ukraine these days. One of the personal dreams Victoria has cherished is to obtain a degree in finance. She is hoping to have an opportunity to study in college and gain some theoretical knowledge which she believes will help her in business as well.

Today Victoria is seeking a loan for 4000 Grivnas to attend an insurance training seminar abroad. She has been working to expand her business endeavors in the area of insurance. This seminar will give her valuable training and will help her gain skills which she can apply in her everyday work.

loans.use: To attend an insurance training session abroad

loans.name: Aan

texts.id:
Aan S. lives with her husband and their child. They rent a room to live for IDR 150 thousand per month (around US$ 18). She is in the business of selling food. Most of her customers are the workers who live in the neighborhood. Her food stall is doing quite ok however recently it is not as busy as before due to the increases in prices in general. She wants to expand her business with the loan money from Dinari.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini usaha yang dijalani oleh Aan S. adalah sebagai penjual makanan. Usahanya cukup berhasil, meskipun kadang sepi usahanya terkendala naiknya bahan baku sembako. Para pembelinya adalah para sopir dan pekerja yang bekerja dekat tempat tinggalnya. Dia ingin bisa mengembangkan usaha jual nasinya sekarng ini menjadi lebih besar, sehingga nantinya bisa mendapat keuntungan yang levbih besar. Oleh karena itu, dia berharap bisa mendapat bantuan dana pinjaman dari DINARI. Saat ini, dia bersama suami dan anak tunggalnya, Aan tinggal dengan menyewa kamar di Jl Cargo dengan harga Rp.150.000 per bulan.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married and has a teenage daughter. He’s a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine where he offers transportation services. His taxi business is the only source of income for his family. Sergey is very responsible and modest and has a good reputation among other taxi drivers. He has promptly repaid all loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. He uses an economical, diesel vehicle for his taxi and, after fuel costs, he is able to bring in around $50 in daily profit. Having a flexible schedule and being willing to provide transportation services all over Ukraine has helped Sergey get many loyal clients.

Sergey is requesting a loan of 2000 Grivnas to help repair his vehicle and make it more reliable. A newer running gear system in the car will give Sergey the opportunity to travel to other destinations, change some of his regular itineraries and expand his business. Not only will this help his business but it will also give his family a better quality of life. One day Sergey is hoping to buy his own car. He believes his transportation business will help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: To repair taxi

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is an entrepreneur from Truskavets, Ukraine. She runs a small travel agency offering a whole package of tour and travel insurance services. Oksana started this venture 6 years ago. Currently, she makes about $2000 a month.

Oksana was one of the first entrepreneurs to offer this type of service in her region. She has a whole variety of exciting options for the most demanding clients: from excursions to historic sights, to horse rides, and dinners in comfortable traditional Ukrainian “Gutsul” restaurants. Oksana is very energetic and is really excited to see her business unfold and grow into a stable and flourishing enterprise. She is requesting a loan of 4000 Grivnas to attend a training seminar abroad and gain more practical skills which would be helpful in her work with her clients.

loans.use: To attend a training seminar abroad

loans.name: Neman

texts.id:
Neman S. is in the business of used goods collector. He acts as a depot agent who collect the stuffs from smaller or individual collectors. He buys the goods and then transport them to Java island where they are going to be recycled. He has been in this business since 2006.

He transports the used goods to Java once a week using a truck. Before sending the goods to Java, he has to filter and select the goods first. Only good quality recycle-able goods are to be sent. At the moment he employs 13 staffs to help him in dealing with the individual used goods collectors. He wants to add his working capital with this loan money.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak tahun 2006, Neman menekuni profesi sebagai agen atau pembeli barang bekas. Kegiatannya hanya membeli dari para pemulung, lalu nantinya dia menjualnya lagi dalam jumlah yang sangat besar ke Jawa untuk diolah kembali menjadi barang baru. Seminggu sekali dia mengirimkan barang bekas ke Jawa menggunakan truk. Barang bekas yang dibelinya tidak langsung dikirim, tetapi harus dipisahkan menurut jenis dan kualitas barang. Kalau barang bekas kualitasnya bagus, maka harganya pasti lebih mahal per kilogramnya. Saat ini dia mempekerjakan 13 orang pekerja yang membantunya keliling membeli dari para pemulung. Penghasilan yang didapat, selain bisa membayar pekerjanya, juga untuk kebutuhan sekolah kedua anaknya dan juga memenuhi keperluan rumah tangga sehari-hari. Rencananya, pinjaman kali ini akan dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is divorced and has one child. She has a business selling clothing items in the central market of Ordzhonikidze. She offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Marina’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 2 years. Currently, she has about $4000 of working capital and makes about $500 in net profit each month.

Marina is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Marina is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Mukkadas

texts.ru:
Mukkadas A. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 27 years old and is single. She makes sweet rolls and sells them on the market. She has a small bakery at home. She lives with her parents and helps them. In order for her work to continue uninterrupted she needs to stock up on flower and sugar. For this purpose she would like to obtain a loan that she plans to repay within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдуджалилова Муккадас жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 27 лет . Она не замужем. Занимается выпечкой сдобных булочек и продает на базаре. Имеет небольшую пекарню дома. Она живет сродителями и помогает им. Для того , чтобы работа двигалась бесперебойно ей нужно сделать запас муки и сахара. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит. Погасить его она сможет в течении12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase flower and sugar

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
This is Ni Luh S.'s 2nd loan from Dinari. She is able to improve her business from her 1st loan. After the 1st loan, Ni Luh S. is now also selling her rice dish at another place (not only at one place). She also sells coffee and cold drinks at her stall in addition to her rice dish.

She opens her food stall nearby a construction project site in Denpasar so the construction workers can buy food and coffee from her. She opens her stall from the morning to the evening.

Her long term goal is to open a permanent stall so she doesn't have to move around from one construction project sites to another.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman ke-2 bagi Ni Luh S. dari DINARI. Pada pinjaman sebelumnya, sudah ada peningkatan usah, walaupun masih belum terlalu besar. Biasanya Ni Luh hanya berjualan nasi disatu tempat, tetapi kali ini sudah mulai berjualan ditempat lain. Kalau sebelumnya hanya berjualan nasi, kali ini sudah ada kopi, es dan minuman lainnya. Dia berjualan disekitar proyek di Denpasar, dimana para buruh proyek suka membeli makan dan kopi. Dari pagi sampai sore dia menekuni pekerjaan ini. Dia berkeinginan, suatu saat dia bisa membuka satu tempat sendiri sehingga dia tidak berpindah-pindah lagi berjualan.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sariyati

texts.id:
Sariyati (43 year old) has been living in Bali since 1990. She lives with her husband and their three children. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker. She earns her living by selling rujak. Rujak is a traditional dish made of fresh fruits and peanut souce. Every morning her husband gives her a motorcycle ride to Badung market to buy the rujak ingredients.

She sells her rujak in front of her house. Her customers are mainly from the surrounding neighborhood.

She earns enough money to pay for the rent of her house. She hopes to the loan money to enable her to add her working capital.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sudah sejak tahun 1990 Sariyati (43) tinggal di Bali. Usaha yang dijalani saat ini adalah berjualan rujak. Setiap pagi, dengan diantar suaminya menggunakan sepeda motor, dia harus pergi ke Pasar Badung untuk belanja kebutuhan untuk membuat rujak, seperti bumbu, buah-buahan, dan kacang. Jarak antara rumahnya dan Pasar Badung tidak terlalu jauh, sehingga dia tidak terlalu menyita waktu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Tempat dia berjualan rujak adalah di depan rumahnya. Pembelinya adalah kebanyakan orang sekitar dan juga orang luar yang sudah sering beli rujak ditempatnya. Penghasilannya cukup untuk membayar sewa kontrak tanah yang sekarang ditempatinya bersama suaminya dan ketiga orang anaknya. Dia berharap diberi bantuan pinjaman untuk dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.ru:
Abdumumin S. lives in the town of Yavan. He works in retail and has a small store where he sells food and groceries. He wants to get a loan to purchase building materials to build a new section adjacent to his store. By increasing the area of his store he will increase the variety of the items. It will also help him increase his profits which help support his family. Abdumumin is 59 years old, married and has five children. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шаимов Абдумумин житель города Яван. Работает в торговле. Имеет небольшой магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить стройматериалы для постройки новой пристройки к магазину.Увеличив помещение он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему увеличить доходы , которые помогут его семье. Абдумумину 59 лет , он женат и имеет 5 детей. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Sindi Eli

texts.id:
Bags production, especially bags sewing has been Sindi's occupation for more than 5 years. She sews bags everyday to fulfill either orders from art-shops around her home or personal orders.

Sindi uses her own money to purchase raw materials, i.e. clothes, that she should pay Rp 15,000 per meter, which will be able to be made into 3 bags. The bags are sold Rp 25,000 each. Actually Sindi earn quite good income from the business, but nowadays, the price of the materials, i.e clothes, thread, and knit or accessories are increasing. That is why, Sindi expect to earn loan that will be used for increasing the capital of her business to keep it running.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jahit tas yang menjadi profesi Sindi sudah dijalani lebih dari 5 tahun, dan sampai sekarang masih bertahan. Setiap hari dia menjahit tas, baik itu pesanan pribadi maupun pesanan dari artshop langganannya. Saat ini modal yang dipakai masih miliknya sendiri, diaman dia harus membali kain yang harga per meternya Rp.15.000 yang nantinya bisa menghasilkan 3 buah tas. Harga jual per tas bisa mencapai 25.000. Sebenarnya keuntungan yang didapat lumayan, tetapi saat ini semua bahan membuat tas seperti kain, benang dan hiasan/aksesoris harganya naik. Oleh karena itu dia mengharapkan mendapat bantuan pinjaman modal untuk tetap bisa meneruskan bisnisnya ini.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Sriyati

texts.id:
The income earned by Sriyati’s husband as a worker in a workstation is not enough to afford their family's daily needs as well as to pay their children tuition fee. For that reason, Sriyati should work. She is doing laundry business with washing machine and iron as the asset. In a month, Sriyati could earn Rp 1,000,000 revenue, and still has to buy detergent and other materials, which requires Rp 100,000 a week. With the income, she is able to pay her children tution fee.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha suaminya sebagai karyawan sebuah bengkel ternyata belum cukup untuk memenui kebutuhan rumah tangga yang begitu banyak. Juga harus membiayai sekolah anaknya yang sekarang sudah SMP. Karena alasan itulah, Sriyati juga bekerja. Saat ini usahanya adalah sebagai tukang cuci pakaian (laundry). Dengan sarana mesin cuci dan setrika, dalam sebulan pendapatannya bisa mencapai Rp.1.000.000. Tetapi tentu saja dia juga harus membeli sabun dan pengharum untuk pakaian, yang perminggunya bisa mencapai Rp.100.000. Keuntungan yang didapat bisa dipakai membayar biaya sekolah anaknya, Ayu Wulandari.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Sugito

texts.id:
Sugito has been a trash collector since he moved from Java last year. He walks around his neighborhood everyday to collect trash and purchase second-hands goods from very early in the morning, has a rest in the noon, and continue the activity in the afternoon. After that, he sorts the goods according to their classification at home in Jl. Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Once a week, a buyer comes to his home to purchase second-hands goods, like old newspapers, cans, paper boxes, iron, etc. from him.

The income earned from his business is only enough for affording his family’s daily needs. There is no excess to be saved. That is why he expects to be entrusted to earn loan to increase the capital of his business so that it could be improved. He also wants to be able to save for financing his children study in the future.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sebagai pemulung sudah dijalani oleh Sugito sejak pindah dari Jawa setahun yang lalu. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling seputaran Denpasar mencari dan membeli barang bekas. Mulai dari pagi dia sudah bekerja mencari barang-barang bekas. Setelah beristirahat sebentar pada siang hari, sore harinya dia berkeliling lagi. Setelah itu dia mengumpulkan barang cariannya selama sehari dirumah tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Sore harinya dia memisahkan barang bekas menurut jenisnya. Seminggu sekali pembeli akan datang kerumahnya untuk membeli barang bekas dan rongsokan miliknya seperti kaleng, kardus, koran, besi dan lain-lain. Penghasilan yang didapat hanya cukup untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari, belum cukup untuk menabung. Oleh karena itu, dia sangat mengaharapkan diberi modal usaha, sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih maju. Diharapkan dia bisa menabung untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Suliha

texts.id:
Since moving to Bali in 1994, Suliha has wanted to work, but she faced a reality that to find a job is very difficult. That was why then Suliha decided to open a booth to sell food. Up to now, Suliha is still running the business even though the income is not too big.

Suliha has to get up early in the morning everyday to go to Kerobokan Market to purchase the materials, and then cook them, and prepare everything before opening the booth at 7.00 am. Around this time, her booth is usually full with customers who have breakfast.

She uses the income from her business to pay her children’s tuition fee. She wants to improve her business in to a bigger one, that she expects to earn loan to increase her capital.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak pindah ke Bali tahun 1994, Suliha berkeinginan bisa mendapat pekerjaan. Tetapi karena lapangan pekerjaan begitu sulit, dia akhirnya memutuskan untuk membuka warung makan. Sampai saat ini Suliha tetap menekuni usahanya ini meskipun penghasilan yang didapatnya tidak begitu besar. Setiap harinya, mulai pagi dia harus bangun untuk berbelanja bahan kebutuhan warungnya di Pasar Kerobokan. Setelah itu, dia pulang untuk memasak dan menyiapkan semuanya sebelum warungnya buka jam 07.00 pagi. Para pelanggannya biasa berdatangan pada pagi hari untuk sarapan sebelum mereka bekerja. Dari penghasilannya menjalankan usaha ini, dia bisa membayar biaya sekolah anaknya. Dia berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar. Karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal usaha.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Sunia

texts.id:
Sunia’s business is trading meatballs and sausages. She should go to nearest market every morning to purchase the materials, like meat, noodles, and sausages. Then, she will cook and prepare everything. After they have been ready, her husband and children will go door-to-door to sell them. They usually sell in the morning until noon, and again in the afternoon. Every family member work together and help each other. Sunia plans to improve the business, that someday she would be able to have a booth. That is why she expects to earn the loan.

Today Sunia lives with her husband and her two children in a rented house that should be paid Rp150,000 a month.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Sunia adalah sebagai penjual bakso dan sosis. Setiap hari, dia harus pergi ke Pasar terdekat untuk belanja bahan untuk membuat bakso seperti mie dan sosis. Setelah itu dia menyiapkan semuanya. Setelah semuanya siap, suami dan anaknya akan berkeliling untuk menjual bakso dan sosis bikinannya. Biasanya mereka berjualan pada pagi hari sampai siang, lalu kemudian kembali berjualan pada sore hari. Semua anggota keluarga saling membantu untuk kepentingan bersama. Sunia berencana mengembangkan usahanya, sehingga nanti bisa membuka tempat berjualan sendiri. Dia sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk usahanya ini. Saat ini, bersama suami dan kedua anaknya, mereka tinggal dirumah sewa dengan biaya Rp.150.000 per bulan.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Yayuk

texts.id:
Together with her husband and children, Yayuk lives in her own home in Jl. Palapa Denpasar. She has a booth to sell groceries like rice, sugar, coffee, oil, etc. Her husband is a construction worker, whose income is not enough to afford their family's needs, that requires Yayuk to work. She plans to use the loan to improve the business so that she can provide more various goods in her booth.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini, bersama suami dan anaknya, Yayuk tinggal di Jl. Palapa Denpasar dengan menempati rumah sendiri. Usaha yang dijalaninya sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual bahan-bahan kebutuhan pokok rumah tangga seperti beras, gula, kopi, minyak dan lain-lain. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pekerja proyek bangunan belum mencukupi untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya, sehingga dia juga ikut membantu meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga. Penghasilan yang didapat setiap harinya cukup unutk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Rencananya pinjaman kali ini akan dipakai sebagai modal mengembangkan usahanya sehingga nanti barang yang dijualnya lebih banyak dan lebih lengkap.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id:
Yuli has been a seamstress for 10 years. This business is her only income source, therefore she develops it diligently. She sews shirts, linens, etc. She usually purchase fabrics in advance and then sewn into finished product and sold to a garment wholesaler. Her profit was barely enough to cover daily living expenses. She hopes for funding help to continue her business, recently the price of fabric is increasing so she is facing financial constraint.

Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sudah 10 tahun Yuli menjalankan usaha sebagai penjahit. Usaha ini sudah merupakan sumber penghasilannya, sehingga dia sangat tekun menjalankannya. Adapun barang yang biasa dijahitnya adalah baju, seprei dan lain-lain. Biasanya, dengan modal yang dia miliki sekarang ini, dia membeli kain di garmen lalu dijahit menjadi berbagai macam produk, dan nantinya dia akan menjualnya kembali ke garmen. Keuntungan yang dia dapat hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari. Dia mangharapkan diberi bantuan untuk membuat usahanya tetap berjalan, karena saat ini harga kain naik sehingga dia kesulitan untuk bisa membelinya.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Juma'ati

texts.id:
Juma'ati sells vegetables and meats that she cooks herself. Most of her clients are workers who live in her neighborhood of Merpati road. She almost always sells out all her merchandise for the day as most of her clients are regulars. Juma'ati plans to obtain a DINARI loan to increase her working capital, since prices of ingredients and cooking oil is increasing. She lives in Denpasar with her husband and children in a rented room that costs $16 per month.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sehari-harinya Juma’ati berjualan sayur dan lauk pauk matang. Sayur dan lauk pauk yang sudah habis dimasak dibawanya untuk dijual. Biasanya yang membeli adalah para pekerja yang tinggal di sekitar tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Merpati. Setiap hari dagangannya pasti habis. Semua karyawan yang membeli sayurnya sudah merupakan langganannya sehingga selalu habis. Saat ini Juma’ati berencana meminjam dana dari DINARI untuk dijadikan tambahan modal, karena kebutuhan untuk bahan sayur dan minyak juga naik. Dia tinggal di Denpasar bersama suami dan anaknya di sebuah kamar kos dengan biaya Rp.150.000 per bulan

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica K. sells children’s wear in Ghana. She is married and has one child.  Her business is doing very well and her customers keep returning.  However, Veronica is running out of inventory and wishes to stock up on goods in order to increase sales.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is a baker and has been managing her own business for several years. She is not yet married because she is so focused on developing herself and her business.  Currently, her business is doing very well but she wishes to further increase her sales of baked goods.  Her major challenge, however,  is the increase in the prices of ingredients, especially flour for baking.  Therefore, Ruth is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary A. runs a business in which she prepares porridge, which she then sells to school children. She is married and has two children of her own. Currently, her business is doing very well, but she wishes to increase production and sales to improve her income.  The major challenge to growing her business is the recently increased price of maize, which is a key ingredient in porridge.  Therefore, Rosemary is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a large quantity of maize for the production of porridge.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for porridge production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel B. sells flour and also operates a corn mill in Ghana. He is married and has four children.  However, his income currently is not sufficient to meet his family’s financial needs. Nonetheless, he is confident that he can improve his business and increase sales if he is able to have his milling machine serviced.  Therefore, Samuel is requesting a loan of $525 to service his milling machine.

loans.use: For the servicing of his milling machine.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. manufactures palm oil in Ghana from palm fruit.  Most Ghanaians use palm oil for preparing stew, and also in the preparation of soap.  Therefore, Linda has many customers and is able to contribute to her family's income.  She is married and has 5 children.  However, the major challenge to her business now is the increase in the price of palm fruit.   To overcome this challenge, she is requesting a loan of $225 to buy larger quantities of palm fruit and other ingredients for the production of oil.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruit and other ingredients for the production of palm oil.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca F. sells food items at the market in her village in Ghana. She is married and has seven dependents, including her own children.  While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase her sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods.  Therefore, Rebecca is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty E. owns a provision store in Ghana which sells a variety of goods.  She is married and has two children. While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase sales by maintaining a bigger inventory with a wider range of goods.   Therefore, Gifty is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy N. is a baker and has been managing her baked goods business for several years. She is married and has two children. Because her business is doing very well, she wishes to increase sales by producing more goods each day. But her major challenge is the increase in the prices of ingredients, especially flour for baking.  Therefore, Dorothy is asking for a loan of $525 buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela K. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has two children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Sela wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana K. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has three children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Juliana wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace G. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has three children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Peace wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Ameyor

texts.en: Ameyor D. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 1 child. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then later sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase her stock to meet the demand of her customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Klufui

texts.en: Klufui F.  is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has three children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Klufui wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en: Dzifa A. is a fishmonger in Ghana. She is married and has two children. Each day, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings it home for processing.  She then later resells the fish products to her customers. Because of increased demand, Dzifa wants to increase her purchases and sales of fish.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana G. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent with two children. Diana buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, then later sells it to her customers. She wants to increase her stock to meet the demand of her customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T.  is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has one child.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Rebecca wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Norvi

texts.en: Norvi H. is a fishmonger in Ghana. She is married and has three children. Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings it home for processing.  She then resells the fish to her customers.  Norvi has experienced increased demand for fish from her customers, and wants to expand her business.  She is therefore asking for a loan of $525 to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is a single mother with one child. Each day, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings the produce home for processing.  She then resells the fish to her customers. Because her business has been successful, Alice wants to increase her sales to meet the rising demands from her customers.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $525, which will be used to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines to satisfy her customers needs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth in bulk for tablecloths, bedspreads and other goods

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a market entrepreneur from Primorsk, Ukraine. She runs a kiosk selling dry goods such as bread, sugar, cereal, candy, and macaroni. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Oksana is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again.
