High inflation rates are affecting businesses in Ukraine. Oksana is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a new vending facility. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Oksana reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has a successful small business selling sports apparel at a large market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Married, with two young sons ages 10 and 11, Marina works hard to help provide for her family. She decided to start her own business about six years ago. She now has two selling locations at the market and has hired one person to help her with sales.

With the busy summer season approaching, Marina has requested a short term loan to help purchase a new supply of t-shirts to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase supply of t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna D. is married and has one daughter. Her family lives in Primorsk, Southern Ukraine. Irina sells trendy clothes for young people in the central city market. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place. Inna re-stocks her inventory regularly and tries to watch all new tendencies in fashion to make sure her assortment of merchandise pleases the different tastes of the young people who buy from her. Inna has been in this trade for 10 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about $9000 in inventory. Her profit is about $2000 a month.

Inna is hoping to use this loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and keep her business running successfully this summer season. It’s always harder for entrepreneurs to keep their profits high in the summertime. However, Inna has her business in a resort city which hopefully will cause her profits go up this summer.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is an entrepreneurial-minded businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. He works as a self-employed taxi driver, is developing a concrete manufacturing business and is involved in a multi-level marketing business. Vladimir is married and has a 7-year-old daughter. He makes about $35-$40 a day driving his taxi which provides a good income for his family.

Vladimir has requested this loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to help develop his concrete business by purchasing a piece of equipment to make concrete blocks called “breeze blocks”. All of the previous loans that Vladimir has received from Nadiya Ukraine have been repaid on time. We are happy for this opportunity to help him invest in this promising business venture and look forward to his continued success.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to make concrete blocks

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Born May 13, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Jeanne P. is a widowed mother of four children, whom she takes care of alone. She has lived in Cotonou for over a decade, where she has been involved in sales, particularly selling various products such as canned goods, school supplies, pasta and soap, and making and selling lollipops and yogurt. She is an earnest woman who has excellent relations with those around her, which helps attract customers to her store. She is currently in great need of financial assistance in order to buy supplies. She is thus requesting this loan to satisfy her customers, who expect a lot from her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 13 mai 1956 à COTONOU la capitale économique du BENIN, dame P. Jeanne est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous à sa charge. Installée depuis plus d’une décennie à COTONOU, elle exerce dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de produits divers tels que les boîtes de conserves, les fournitures scolaires, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons et aussi la fabrication et la commercialisation des sucettes et de yaourt. De bonne moralité, elle entretient de très bonne relation avec son entourage ce qui lui permet d’attirer plus de clients. Actuellement elle manque cruellement de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui attend beaucoup d’elle.

loans.use: Purchasing 15 bags of coal, repairing a refrigerator, purchasing three bowls of cassava flour and 30,000 CFA francs to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Betty Teodora

texts.es:
Betty used to earn a living selling things on credit which is how she scraped together enough money to set up a more stable business. She now sells snacks at a stand in the city center. The business is going well and she can help her husband with household expenses. She lives in an "anticretico" (a property arrangement common in Bolivia) with her husband and 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

LA SEÑORA BETTY ANTERIORMENTE SE DEDICABA A LA ACTIVIDAD D. REPARTIR COSAS AL CREDITO, CON LO QUE JUNTO UN CAPITAL PARA MONTAR UN NEGOCIO MAS ESTABLE, ACTUALMENTE VEND. GOLOCINAS EN UN ANAQUEL EN EL CENTRO D. LA CIUDAD, LE VA MEJOR CON ESTE NEGOCIO Y PUED. AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ELLA VIVE EN UN ANTICRETICO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO Y SUS 2 HIJOS.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Parfaite

texts.fr:
Born February 20th, 1974 in Cotonou, Mrs. Parfaite D. is married and the mother of two children in school. She sells a variety of seasonings and is seeking this loan to expand her field of business in order to better satisfy her customers. She buys seasonings in the main market Dantokpa which she then retails to neighbors in her area. It’s been six years since she started her business and it’s been running very well because of her energy and enthusiasm.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 février 1974 à COTONOU, dame D. Parfaite est mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de divers condiments et sollicite ce prêt pour élargir son champ d’activité afin de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle. Elle achète les divers condiments au grand marché DANTOKPA qu'elle revend au détail à ses voisins de quartier. Il y a cinq années qu'elle s'est lancé dans cette activité qui lui marche très bien à cause de son dynamisme.

loans.use: Purchase of two bags of onions, one bag of tomatoes, and 20,000 francs to stock other seasonings

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Born September 1st, 1960 in Cotonou, Mrs. Angèle H. is divorced and the mother of a child for whom she is solely responsible. She is a retailer of charcoal, sacks of corn, manioc flour, drums of oil and other daily food products in the city of Cotonou. She is very reliable and this will be her fourth loan. She is lacking financial means to stock various products. She is seeking this loan to supply and satisfy her customers because demand is strong.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1 septembre 1960 à COTONOU, dame H. Angèle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant dont elle a la charge exclusive. Elle est revendeuse de charbon, de sacs de maïs, de farine de manioc, de bidons d’huile et autres produits de consommation courante dans la ville de COTONOU. De bonne moralité, elle est à son quatrième crédit. Elle manque de moyens financiers pour l’approvisionnement des différents produits. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner et satisfaire ses clients car la demande est forte.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 bags of charcoal, five of corn, and five of manioc flour, as well as 10 drums of oil

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Born June 6th, 1977 in the town of Savi, in Ouidah Commune, Mrs. Emilienne A. is married and the mother of three children. She is also responsible for two family helpers who assist with her daily activities. A hair stylist by trade, at the same time she manages sales of cosmetic products that complement her business such as hair extensions, beauty products, etc. She is currently having trouble meeting her customer’s needs and is therefore seeking a loan to satisfy them.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 06 juin 1977 à SAVI dans la commune de OUIDAH, dame A. Emilienne est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a à sa charge deux domestiques qui l’aident dans ses activités quotidiennes. Coiffeuse de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des produits cosmétiques rentrant en ligne de compte pour son activité tels que les mèches, les produits de beauté et autres. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés pour satisfaire de sa clientèle. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk hair extensions, various hair styling accessories, and 50,000 francs CFA to complete the purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Nelva Jesus

texts.en:
Nelva Jesus V. D. L. is a business woman in the town of Mache, high in the sierras (mountain range) of the La Libertad region of Peru. Nelva owns a home in which she has a general store and a small eatery, and she rents out rooms to travelers. The meals she serves for lunch are very popular among the population. She has been a business woman for many years and has many loyal customers.

Nelva is 57 years old, a widow, and a has 7 children. Her children have all moved away from home so she lives alone. Without her businesses, she wouldn’t be able to survive, because she has no one to rely on.

A member of the Mujeres D. Mache community bank, Nelva is requesting a loan of s/800 ($300 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store and buy ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.use: To restock her store and buy ingredients to prepare her meals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria L. E. Santos is a business woman and community leader in the town of Mache, high in the sierras (mountain range) of the La Libertad region of Peru. Victoria raises and sells animals, such as pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and cows, and wheat, alfalfa, corn, rice, and vegetables. She spends a lot of time traveling to and from Trujillo, the capital of the region, where she does a lot of business.

Victoria is 50 years old, married, and has 6 children. All of her children have moved to Trujillo, so she is hoping to live closer to them one day. She is very popular in her community. She is the president of her community bank and is also an officer with the Ministry of Health.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Victoria is requesting a loan of s/2000 ($725 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the extra capital to buy a few more pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy a few more pigs to raise and sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ysabel Margarita

texts.en:
Ysabel Margarita L. E. has a general store and raises animals to sell in the town of Mache, high in the sierras (mountain range) of the La Libertad region of Peru. Ysabel raises cattle and pigs and sells them in Trujillo, the capital of the region. She has 12 years of experience and has many loyal customers.

Ysabel is 43 years old and has 4 children. She enjoys her business and being able to take care of her family. She works long hours so her children can have the opportunity to study and become professionals.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Ysabel is requesting a loan of s/1500 ($550) that she will repay over 4 months. She’ll use the loan to buy a few more pigs.

loans.use: To buy a few more pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda V. D. Castillo has a farm where she raises animals, such as pigs and cattle, to sell at the market. She has been a farmer all of her life in the town of Mache, high in the mountains of the Libertad region of Peru. She owns some land and knows everything there is to know about pigs and cattle.

Hermelinda is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her children moved to Trujillo, the capital of the region, which is along the coast, so she and her husband now live alone. She’s worked hard for her entire life to survive.

A member of the Mujeres D. Mache community bank, Hermelinda is requesting a loan of s/3000 ($1100 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the capital to buy more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy more animals to raise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. G. has a business making cheese in the town of Mache high in the mountains of the La Libertad region of Peru. She’s been making her cheeses for 7 years and sells her product in Trujillo, the capital of the region. She also raises animals, such as pigs, sheep, and chickens, to sell at a local market.

Angelina is 48 years old and has 6 children. She loves her businesses, because, without them, she wouldn’t have any other way to survive. She works hard to save and help her family as much as possible.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Angelina is requesting a loan of s/3000 ($1100 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her cheeses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cheeses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. S. owns a small general store and some land where she raises different animals in the town of Mache, high in the mountains of the Libertad region of Peru. She has been running her store for 8 years and now has plenty of loyal customers. On her land, she raises livestock, including pigs, cows, and chickens.

Cristina is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. She enjoys working and helping her family. In the past, she had low self-esteem and little decision-making power in her family.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Cristina is requesting a loan of s/2000 ($725 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all of her best-selling goods.

loans.use: To restock her store with all of her best-selling goods.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena started the business to increase her family's income. She's a single mother with 2 daughters, 6 and 8, and she has to be at home for them. The only way to manage was to set up her own business. She started, 3 years ago, selling used clothing in the "tianguis" (traditional markets) and surrounding neighborhoods. She now rents a shop where she sells clothes and accessories for women. Thanks to her dedication and perserverance, she's managed to grow and increase her sales.

Lorena needs a US$500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to continue expanding the business so that she can increase her sales and, in turn, her income. With your help, Lorena and her children will be able to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares debido a que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 8 años de edad, debido a que necesitaba estar junto a ellas, la única forma para poder hacerlo era poner un negocio propio. Ella inicio hace 3 años con la venta de ropa usada, primero vendiendo en los tianguis y rancherías, actualmente renta un local en donde vendo ropa para dama y accesorios, gracias a su dedicación y constancia ha logrado crecer e incrementar sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para seguir ampliando el negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu ayuda Lorena y sus hijos podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Olga Enriqueta

texts.es:
Olga, married with one son, is an enterprising woman. She started the business when the store was passed along to her but she also felt the need to help her family and to have something that was her own. That's why she started her business selling milk products, "embutidos" (a kind of sausage) and snacks, because she's always been a hard-working woman and she enjoys keeping busy. She began more than five years ago and, little by little, she saw the business prosper and she couldn't quit because she realized that it was profitable and that it would be a good investment if she worked hard and put in sufficient time.

She now needs a US$975 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise for her business and to grow it. The business is an important source of income for her family and that's what drives her to forge ahead. Her family supports her and encourages her to keep going. With your help, Olga can continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Olga es una mujer emprendedora, casada y madre de un hijo. Inició el negocio cuando le traspasaron el local pero además sentía la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y tener algo que fuera suyo y la motivara. Por esa razón inicio su negocio de venta de productos lácteos, embutidos y dulces, porque siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y le gusta mantenerse ocupada. Comenzó hace mas de cinco años y poco a poco fue notando que el negocio iba prosperando y ya no lo pudo dejar porque se dio cuenta que era productivo y que seria una buena inversión si lo trabajaba bien, esforzándose mas y dedicándole el tiempo suficiente.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio y hacerlo crecer ya que es una fuente de ingresos importante para su familia y esto la motiva a salir adelante, por su familia quienes la apoyan y alientan a seguir adelante. Con tu ayuda Olga seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is married with 4 children, 23, 24, 30 and 32. She started her business because she only had an elementary-school education and it was the work that provided her with an income to live. She started 8 years ago with a small amount of jewelry bought with a loan. Later she paid cash and, little by little, the business grew until she had her own shop, well established, where she also resells shoes and "blancos" bought from catalogs.

Maria now needs a US$875 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her shop because she doesn't currently have enough money to cover the expense. With your help, Maria can continue her progress.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María es casada y madre de 4 hijos de 23, 24, 30 y 32 años. Inició su negocio ya que solo cuenta con estudios de primaria y fue el oficio que le dejo ganancias para subsistir. Comenzó hace 8 años inicio con un pequeño lote de joyería que saco a crédito, después compro de contado y así poco a poco fue creciendo, hasta tener su local bien establecido donde además vende zapatos y blancos por catalogo.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $875 que pagara en 6 meses, para remodelar su local, ya que actualmente no cuenta con liquidez para solventar ese gasto. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Remodel store.

loans.name: Julieta Elena

texts.es:
Julieta is married with 2 children, 8 and 2. She started the business because she's always wanted to have one, separate from her job, that would provide an extra income for her family. She started the business more than six years ago and it's worked for her because she knew that she could combine it with the job that she still has. Julieta's husband has always supported her efforts to get ahead and helps her operate the mini-mart and be there when she can't. That's a big help because her job is demanding and she doesn't always have the chance to see to the business.

Julieta is applying for a US$975 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to stock her store because she's out of some indispensable items. With your help, Julieta will continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Julieta es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años. Inició el negocio porque siempre ha tenido el interés de manejar su propio negocio a parte del trabajo que tiene, ya que esto le da la opción de tener un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de su familia. Comenzó hace mas de seis años con el negocio y le ha funcionado porque ha sabido combinarlo a la par con el trabajo que actualmente tiene, además su esposo siempre la ha apoyado mucho a salir adelante y el se encarga también de administrar el mini súper y de estar al tanto de lo que hace falta, porque en ocasiones si es mucha la carga de trabajo y no siempre tiene la oportunidad de ver las necesidades del negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir de mercancía la tienda ya que le faltan algunos productos que son indispensables. Con tu apoyo Julieta seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ayéwa Baby

texts.fr:
Ms. Ayéwa Baby L. is single and was born December 17th, 1981 in Hahotoé village in the Vo prefecture. She is a cosmetics retailer in the Agoè market. She buys merchandise in Lomé’s main market for potential customers such as hair salons and women in her neighborhood. She makes a lot of sales on market days, which are every third day of the week. She has been doing business for six years and is seeking her first loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 20 boxes of lotion, 40 boxes of deodorant and 50 boxes of perfume.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle L. Ayéwa Baby est célibataire née le 17 décembre 1981 à Hahotoé dans la préfecture de VO. Elle est revendeuse de produits cosmetiques dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle achète ses marchandises au grand marché de Lomé et a pour clients potentiels les salons de coiffures et les femmes du quartier. Elle réalise un chiffre d’affaires élevé les jours de marché. Ce marché s’anime tous les trois jours de la semaine. Il y a six (6) ans qu’il exerce ce commerce, et sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter vingt (20) cartons de lait de lotion, quarante (40) cartons de déodorant et cinquante (50) cartons de parfums.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Born March 12th, 1973 in Vogan village of VO prefecture, Mrs. Kokoè T. K. is married and the mother of three children. She sells jewelry and fabric in the Agoè neighborhood; she has been doing business since June 2004. She buys jewelry from Cotonou, Benin and fabric from the main market in Lomé. This is the first loan she is seeking, for 500,000 francs CFA and it will allow her to buy 40 pairs of earrings, 20 bracelets, and 40 necklaces. Her goal in borrowing this loan is to expand her display in order to attract more customers. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.
Née le 12 mars 1973 à vogan dans la préfecture de VO, Madame T. K. Kokoè est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de bijoux et de pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a démarré ce commerce depuis juin 2004. Elle achète les bijoux de Cotonou au Bénin et les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quarante (40)  boucles d’oreilles, vingt (20) gomettes et quarante (40) colliers. Son objectif, en prenant ce crédit est  d’agrandir son étalage afin de pouvoir attirer plus de clients.

loans.use: Jewelry retail

loans.name: M’Tambéna

texts.fr:
Mr. M’tambéna H. was born in 1971 in Kokoliakpé village of Haho prefecture. He is married and the father of three children. He established a shop selling basic goods. With income from his shop “Petit Paris,” he manages to meet the needs of his family, especially those of his children. Currently, he envisions adding new sales activities: selling cell phone credit recharge cards and local drinks. This is the first loan he is seeking and will allow him to expand his business activities by buying four drink containers and credit recharge cards with a value of 75,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. M’tambéna est né en 1971 à Kokoliakpé dans la préfecture de Haho. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a crée un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités. Avec le revenu de son magasin « PETIT PARIS », il arrive à assurer les charges de sa famille surtout celle de ses enfants. Présentement, il envisage ajouter d’autres activités à l’ancienne. Celle de la vente des cartes de recharges et des boissons locales. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de réaliser son projet par l’achat de quatre (4) bidons de 50 litres de contenance et des cartes de recharges pour une valeur de 75000FCFA

loans.use: Purchase and resale of cell phone credit recharge cards

loans.name: Eneida

texts.es:
Eneida has been selling typical foods from the villages of the Peruvian jungle for 13 years. In the capital, she wanted to launch a business,and couldn't think of a better way than to sell the delicious dishes of her native area. At 8 o'clock every morning she moves the tables and chairs out to the sidewalk alongside her home and sells until past midnight. Eneida has requested loans on various occasions with which to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes. She would like to expand the exterior portion of her home and install a canopy and a cement bar that would serve as a table for additional diners, thus allow her to seat more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eneida vende comida de la Selva desde hace 13 años. En la capital, ella quiso poner un negocio y no encontró mejor forma que ofrecer al público platos de su tierra natal. A las 8.00 de la noche ella saca mesas y sillas en la vereda de su casa, y vende hasta pasada la medianoche. Eneida ha solicitado préstamos en distintas ocasiones para comprar los ingredientes de los platos que ofrece. A ella le gustaría ampliar la parte exterior de su casa y colocarle un toldo o una barra de cemento que sirva de mesa, y así tener más comensales.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for the prepared foods she offers

loans.name: Poukdiwindé

texts.fr:
Mr. Poukdiwindé L. was born on 14 February 1969 in Dapaong, a city situated in the far north of Togo. He is married and has four (4) children. In 1998, he created an establishment selling spare parts in the Agoè region. This loan, his first, will allow him to stock up on car and motorcycle parts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur L. Poukdiwindé est né le 14 février 1969 à Dapaong ville située à l’extrême nord du Togo. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Depuis 1998 il a crée un établissement de vente de pièces détachées dans le quartier d’Agoè. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner en pièces de véhicules et en pièces des engins à deux roues.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle and car parts to supply his shop, and make sure that he can meet his customer demands.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Denia

texts.es:
Denia has adapted her house to include a store where she sells soft drinks and beer. She's been running this business for 10 years. At the moment, her nephew provides her with the beer on credit, because she lacks the capital to order it directly from the beer manufacturer. At the same time, Denia washes clients' clothes every day in order to pay her debts and improve the economic status of her household. She would like to make improvements to her house and improve her business by increasing the size and variety of her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Denia ha acondicionado en su casa una tienda de gaseosas y cervezas. Ella se ha dedicado a esto desde hace 10 años. Por el momento, un sobrino le brinda a crédito las cervezas que vende, porque no dispone del capital para pedir directamente a la Empresa Cervecera. Paralelamente, Denia lava ropa todos los días para ayudarse en la economía de su hogar y pagar deudas. A ella le gustaría arreglar su casa y mejorar su negocio aumentando el stock de productos.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of products to sell

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna studied Cosmetology for 5 years. She worked a year for private clients and later she made up her mind to open her own hair salon in her home. But Giovanna does not only work in her hair salon! A year ago her son took ill, which left her in need of money. That's how she came to launch a second profitable business renting cell phones to make calls. At the beginning, she went out through the streets offering her service to the public. Later, she installed a small phone booth for the cell phone business outside of her hair salon.

With a previous loan, Giovanna was able to buy a refrigerator with which she sells ice cream to her neighbors during the summer. This loan, like others she has received will be used toward the purchase of materials and tools for her hair salon.

Translated from Spanish buy Kiva volunteer, Erin Corcoran.

Giovanna estudió Cosmetología hace 6 años. Trabajó un año para personas particulares y luego se animó para poner en su casa su propia peluquería. Pero Giovanna no solo se dedica a este negocio. Hace un año su hijo enfermó por lo que necesitaba dinero. Fue así que vio un negocio rentable en la actividad de alquilar celulares para realizar llamadas. Al comienzo, ella salía por las calles a ofrecer su servicio al público. Luego, instaló en el exterior de su peluquería un pequeño módulo de llamadas.

Giovanna pudo comprarse una heladera, por lo que en verano ella ofrece helados a sus vecinos. Los préstamos que ha recibido han sido destinados para la compra de materiales e implementos para su peluquería.

loans.use: To invest in her hair salon and buy materials for the business

loans.name: Eduardo Jesus

texts.es:
Eduardo is married and has two daughters ages 21 and 15, and a son who is 20. From a very young age Eduardo has been involved in printing, working as an assistant for many years. After he was married, he realized that his salary would not be enough to take care of his family, so 15 years ago he decided to start saving and eventually he was able to open his own shop in a room in his house.

Today he has a good customer base and he would like to invest in growing his business. He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase materials needed for his business. Your support will help Eduardo continue to succeed.

Eduardo es casado y tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 21,15 y un hombre 20. Desde muy temprana edad el señor Eduardo tiene conocimientos de serigrafía ya que trabajo como ayudante muchos años hasta que cuando se caso y nacieron sus hijos al darse cuenta que no le alcanzaba su sueldo como empleado, por lo que hace 15 años decidió ahorrar y poco a poco fue formando su taller, al principio en un cuarto de su casa que adecuo, hoy en día cuenta con una buena clientela y busca invertir para vender mayor cantidad de artículos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar pinturas para su negocio. Con tu apoyo Eduardo saldrá adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR HIS PRINTING BUSINESS

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena has three children, two daughters ages 19 and 23, and one son age 28. Eight years ago she realized she needed to find work when she separated from her husband. The money he gave to the children didn't cover the family's expenses, and after a lot of time looking for work, Elena decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little she has grown her business.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase more clothing to offer her customers and increase her income. Your contribution will help make this possible.

Elena, es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres de 19, 23 y un varón de 28 años; desde hace 8 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo debido a que se separo de su esposo, y con el dinero que le daban sus hijos, no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses, para surtir con ropa nueva para así tener más opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso. Con tu contribución Elena saldrá adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Maricela Del Scocorr

texts.es:
Five years ago, when her youngest daughter was born, Maricela decided to leave her work to dedicate more time to her children. Because she still needed to generate income, she looked for a way to earn money and still be with her family, eventually starting her business selling clothing. Now, thanks to what her mother taught her, she is able to make her own garments. She offers her customers good prices, made to order pieces and new clothing.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, so she can purchase a sewing machine

Maricela, desde hace 5 años cuando nació su ultima hija decidió dejar de trabajar para poder dedicarse mas a sus pequeñas, pero ante la necesidad de ingresos económicos, busco la manera de tener un negocio en el cual no descuidara a sus hijas y fue así como inicio con la venta de ropa, pero ahora gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre ha aprendido a elaborar ella misma las prendas, redituándole mejor ya que le da un buen precio a la gente y les hace la ropa a la medida y las prendas son nuevas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una maquina para de coser para poder hacer ella misma la ropa que vende.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SEWING MACHINE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María sells shoes through a catalog. Her sister inspired her to create this business, as she told her that this type of business was profitable. Today, María travels constantly to Trujillo to buy shoes according to the season and sells them to her friends. She takes photos of the shoes and sells them through her homemade catalog of photos. With the loan she as asked for, she has invested in her business and the earning gained will help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

María se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Su hermana le animó a crear este negocio, puesto que ella le comentó que este tipo de ventas eran rentables. Hoy en día, María viaja constantemente a Trujillo para comprar zapatos de acuerdo a la temporada y ofrecerlos a sus amistades. Ella misma les toma fotos y les ofrece a manera de catálogo. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, ha invertido en el negocio y con las ganancias obtenidas ha ayudado a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more pairs of shoes
